Unfortunately, we can't provide access to this account with the information we have on file for you or using the information you've provided. It's important that we be enormously careful in these situations as inadvertently providing anyone but the account's owner access to that account is an enormously bad thing to do.

I'm escalating this issue to our senior staff so they can look into other ways to get you access to the account.

value: As noted before, we would need authorization from the owner of this account (EMAIL) before we can move the site into a new account. They can either reply directly to this ticket, or email us separately and reference Ticket#

I've confirmed that the problem you're describing is a bug and have opened a ticket with our engineers for investigation. I don't have an ETA for when they'll have the issue fixed, but I will follow up with you as soon as I have an update.

I'm very sorry you've run into this problem, and thanks for your patience while our team works to get this resolved.

macros.title: New Bug Report::Not Really A Bug (Follow-up)

Leave a comment for the agent who escalated this ticket explaining to them that you've investigated and found that it's not a bug. Let them know the appropriate answer/macro to give the user in your note, and then re-assign the ticket to that agent and submit as open.

I'd be happy to look into this. Unfortunately I was unable to look up your account as it appears we don't have an account associated with this email address. Can you please let me know what site URL, email address or username this is in reference to?

I'm sorry to hear that you are experiencing this problem. Weebly has made a decision to block a number of countries because those countries were responsible for the creation of mostly fraudulent websites. I'm sorry that this is affecting your site. We did not mean to harm good sites in this process. I've configured your account to skip this blocking process, so you should be able to log in now. If you run into any further issues with this, please just let me know and I'll get right back to you.

actions.value:
You can set up email forwarding for your domain name through a very simple interface in the 'Domains' tab of your account. Read over our short guide to learn how this works:
  
http://kb.weebly.com/email-forward.html
  
Email Forwarding enables you to forward any email sent to your domain name over to your personal email address (or addresses) at a provider like Gmail or Yahoo. This lets you manage your new email addresses without the need for a second or third inbox to constantly check in addition to your personal email. 
  
But this isn't the only option. 
  
If you don't want forwarding and instead prefer an actual email inbox for your domain name, you're also welcome to set up email with Google Apps mail. This provides a complete email solution through the Gmail interface. It's more complicated to set up, but works like a charm, and is always an option if you don't want to go the email forward route. Take a look at our tutorial: 
  
http://kb.weebly.com/setup-email.html
  
The only drawback here is cost: Google has just recently started charging $50 a year for this service.

value:
No problem at all!

Let us know if you need anything else and thanks for building with Weebly!

Cheers!

We're trying to troubleshoot why this would occur.

If the issue persists, first check that your computer can accept cookies by visiting [this link](http://www.weebly.com/weebly/loginTest.php) and if you can't, enable them using the help found [here](http://www.google.com/support/websearch/bin/answer.py?answer=35851).

We've heard reports of antivirus software preventing users from logging in.  If you have antivirus software installed, try temporarily disabling it and then logging in.  If this works, you'll need to add Weebly to the software's "safe" or "accepted" list.

Please also make sure the date/time on your computer is set right. If the date is "off", it can make your computer think your login has expired right away.

We are able to setup email for people who own their own domain (ie. www.example.com), but unfortunately not for people using sub-domains of .weebly.com (ie. example.weebly.com).  If you want an email address that is specific to your site's address, you'll need to purchase your own domain name.

Email Forwarding enables you to forward any email sent to your domain name over to your personal email address (or addresses) at a provider like Gmail or Yahoo. This lets you manage your new email addresses without the need for a second or third inbox to constantly check in additional to your personal email address. 

But what about the replies that you send out? These replies will come from your personal address instead of from your domain address unless you make a simple change to the settings at your personal email provider. We've written guides that show how to make the necessary change at each of the major email providers.   

At Gmail / Google Mail:

http://kb.weebly.com/forward-gmail.html

At Yahoo:

http://kb.weebly.com/forward-yahoo.html

At Outlook.com:

http://kb.weebly.com/forward-outlook.html

At Hotmail: 

http://kb.weebly.com/forward-hotmail.html

It should take no more than a few minutes to make the changes noted above. Once you change these settings any reply sent to an email that was forwarded through your domain name will come from your domain name instead of from your personal address.

You'll need to use your email address as the username to log in to this account. The username on this particular account is an email address that starts with (INSERT FIRST PART OF EMAIL ADDRESS HERE: firstpart@). 
  
If you do not recall your password, you can use your email address to retrieve it via this link:

http://www.weebly.com/#reset
 
A link to reset your password will be sent to your account's email address (which, again, is the email address noted above). If you don't see it in your inbox, be sure to check the junk/spam folder as it may have been incorrectly filtered.

If you have any trouble using that link, please reach out to us using the account email address as your contact point and we can assist in manually resetting your password.

Unfortunately, there is not enough content on your site yet.  Because of this, we are unable to verify your account.  Please contact us when you have added more information to your site and I will happily assist you in verifying your account.

The login form is not currently set up with SSL. This is a potential security issue when an account is created. It is also a common sign-up method used across many different sites on the internet.

For this to cause a problem, someone would have to sit between your internet connection and Weebly. The only way they could do that is through an unsecured wireless network. So someone would have to knowingly target you through your unsecured wireless network (within range of that network) and be looking to sniff for this information. Then figure out what it is and find some value to taking over a Weebly account through which they could gain no personal information about you (we don't display payment info or anything else in a publicly accessible way in the account) or do much of anything aside from vandalize the site.

So while I agree that this is a security hole and fully appreciate your concerns, it is one that has little to no chance of actually causing a problem. We do intend to provide an HTTPS login at some point in the future, but this is not as easy as just flipping a switch and making it happen.

If there's anything further I can assist you with, please just let me know and I'll get right back to you.  Thanks for using Weebly!

To change your account's email address or password, simply log into Weebly and select the blue "Account" button at the top of the screen. You can then alter your information by using the change link found to the right of each setting.

We're sorry to see you go!  To delete your account, click on the "Account" tab after logging in.  You should see the delete account option on the bottom of that page.  If you run into any issues with this, please just let me know and I'll get right back to you.

The limit for individual file sizes is:
Free: 10MB
Starter: 100MB
Pro: 250 MB
Business: 3GB

To disable Weebly's Facebook Login option, you'll need to turn off the connection to Facebook found under the 'Account' tab in Weebly, and also potentially remove Weebly as an "app" in your Facebook account. Both of these fixes are easy to do and are explained in our guide: 

http://kb.weebly.com/disable-facebook.html

If you've connected your Weebly site to the wrong Facebook or Twitter account (or just don't want to share your site with either going forward) you can easily disconnect them. Just follow along with our short guide and you'll be on your way:

http://kb.weebly.com/revoke-social.html

Unfortunately, we would need written authorization from the owner of this account (EMAIL) before we can either move the site into a new account or give you access to edit this site.  They can either reply directly to this ticket, or contact us separately and reference Ticket # {{ticket.id}}

Thank you for understanding.

You can certainly use Office 365 and keep your website with Weebly. Unfortunately, we cannot provide you with a static IP address so when you set up your Office 365 account, you'll need to choose the option to manage your DNS yourself. Microsoft's instructions for this option are here: http://office.microsoft.com/en-us/office365-suite-help/set-up-and-manage-domains-HA102819938.aspx?CTT=5&origin=HA102818317#_Toc378671198


Instead of Microsoft controlling your DNS and pointing to your Weebly website, your current registrar will keep the DNS and simply point MX records to Microsoft for the e-mail. Depending on exactly which Microsoft services you're using, you may need to set up other DNS records as well. Just be sure you don't change the A-records that point to Weebly.

I'm very sorry for the issues you've been experiencing.  The only people who could ever "hack" your site are people to whom you've provided the password. There is no direct connection / backdoor to your account via your site, so anyone who wanted to get access would need to go to Weebly.com, guess your username and then try to break your password over and over again (they would be stopped automatically by our system after roughly ten attempts).

The only other way to access your account would be if you had used a shared computer to log-in and did not log-out (or had saved the password on the shared computer), or if you are using a PC that is infected by malware (such as a key-logger), and your keystrokes were recorded.

Beyond that, none of your credit card info is visible in your account (or even to anyone who works here, including me) so even if someone somehow broke into your account via some amazing guesswork there wouldn't be any information there for them to steal.

If you think that your computer or email account was compromised I would recommend that you (and anyone else who has access to your log-in information) run a virus/malware scan on your computer.  You will want to scan specifically for things like key-loggers.  Once you have done this, I would recommend changing your password again, just to be safe.

If there's anything further I can assist you with, please just let me know and I'll get right back to you.

The problem is that one of your other accounts was banned.  Once an account is banned, you generally cannot access any of your other accounts. 

To fix this problem, you need to clear all Weebly related Flash cookies from your computer.  Just follow this link and use the tool they provide to delete anything referring to Weebly:  

http://www.macromedia.com/support/documentation/en/flashplayer/help/settings_manager07.html

Once you've done, this you'll need to close your browser and open it again.

There are a few reasons that the invalid e-mail message may show up on your account. Usually it's because we've tried to send you a message which bounced back.
  
Occasionally accounts are incorrectly flagged.  If you've double checked the e-mail address on your account and are still able to receive e-mails from us, you can click on the red X in the lower-left corner of the warning message to close it.  This won't cause any problems. Do keep in mind that if the message comes back, it means that another e-mail has bounced and you may want to consider changing the e-mail address on your account just to be on the safe side.

The problem is that your account is registered under a different email address than the one you've been trying to login with. However, after comparing the system logs for both accounts, I see that you've accessed both from the same IP address and can reset your password for you. Your temporary password is weeblyback3.

If you use your email address in the username field to log in along with the password noted above, you should be able to gain access to your account again. Once in, please click on the Account tab to reset your password to something more secure.  You can also change all your other account access information from this same tab.  If you continue to experience any issues accessing your account, please just let me know and I'll get right back to you.

macros.title: Account::Logging In to the Wrong Account

value:
I'm sorry for the issues you've been experiencing.  I believe the problem is that you currently have more than one account with Weebly, and you've somehow ended up logging in to the wrong one. Your site is actually in an account connected to your (EMAIL) address, so you should use that email address as your username when you log in. 

If you do not recall your password for this account, you can use the email address noted above to retrieve it by going to this link: 

http://www.weebly.com/weebly/resetPassword.php

A link to reset your password will be sent to your the email address on file. If you don't see it in your inbox, be sure to check the junk/spam folder as it may have been incorrectly filtered.

If you still continue to experience any issues logging in to your account, please just let me know and I'll get right back to you.

Our login form does actually function over SSL. It does so in a behind-the-scenes way called JSONP that won't show the lock in your browser. You can rest assured thatÂ your login information is completely safe and secure and is being passed over SSL.

You can log in to edit your site by going to www.weebly.com and clicking the "Log In" link in the upper right corner of the window. Enter the email you used to sign up at Weebly and your password, and click the login button. If you don't remember your password, you can use the reset password link under the login form - a reset email will be sent to the email account you signed up with. 

If you experience any issues logging into your account, please let me know so I can take a closer look.

The way you will solve this problem is:

1) Log in to your Weebly Editor for the site
2) Click on the Button on the home page
3) Highlight the button text
4) Delete all the button text
5) Type:      Button Text       onto the button
6) Make sure you type a capital B and a capital T and the rest of the letters lower-case. Make sure there are no spaces before or after the words (only one space between)
7) Click off the button
8) PUBLISH your website

Assuming that you have done this correctly, you will NO LONGER see the button on the PUBLISHED site. The button WILL REMAIN in your editor, but it will not be visible to visitors.

I've manually reset your password to weeblyback3.

If you use your email address in the username field to log in along with the password noted above, you should be able to gain access to your account again. Once in, please click on the Account section to reset your password to something more secure. This section is accessible through the icon in the upper right of your account. 

You can also change all your other account access information from this same tab.  If you continue to experience any issues accessing your account, please let me know and I can take a closer look.

Sorry to hear that you ran into a problem with the verification process! We only ask our customers to verify if one of the sites they've built has triggered our spam prevention system. This doesn't mean that your website is spam -- our automated system is designed to check for certain things, but it can't tell the difference between a site that's okay and one that isn't, and that's where the human verification comes in.

I've fixed the issue and manually verified your account, and you'll be able to publish your sites without any issues now.

Currently our connections to Facebook and Twitter are done at an account level. This means every site in your account is connected to the same Facebook / Twitter profiles. There isn't currently a way to connect an account to multiple social profiles, so the only way around this is to manually share links to the other profiles by copying and pasting the links and manually sharing to those profiles. Sorry we don't have another way to do this right now!

Hello,

You are receiving this email to confirm your change of account request. If you have received this email in error, it's likely that another user entered your email address while trying to create an account. If you didn't initiate the request, you don't need to take any further action. You can simply disregard the email. If you have requested an account change, please respond back in a timely manner.

I apologize that this is happening out of the blue, but Weebly doesn't allow adult sites on our network.  Because of this, we had to take your sites down and turn your account off.  This isn't a "moral" issue for us, we simply have the same policy regarding adult content as a social network like Facebook.

Unfortunately, Weebly doesn't allow adult sites on our network so we wouldn't be the right host for your site.  This isn't a "moral" issue for us, we simply have the same policy regarding adult content as a social network like Facebook.  Thank you for understanding.

Unfortunately, due to past issues with fraudulent credit card purchases, our Abuse and Operations teams have blocked all purchases from Albania. I am very sorry for this, but there is no way for us to lift this ban.

Your account was in violation of our Terms of Service.  Because of this, your site was shut down and your account was disabled.  Sorry this happened out of the blue.  The ban cannot be reversed.

See our TOS here:

http://www.weebly.com/tos.php

We received a chargeback for one or more services rendered through your Weebly account. That means that the credit card company told us the charge(s) were fraudulent and not only took back the money that we had charged, but they also turned around and charged us substantial fees for "allowing" that fraud to happen. In cases like that, we do what we have to in order to protect our company and credit card holder both legally and financially - so we ban the account responsible for the fraud.

Were you aware of this chargeback?

value:
Howdy!

Here is some great information about how to increase your SEO -- Search Engine Optimization.

It can take a number of weeks for new websites to get "indexed" in the search engine listings and even longer for a site to show up in the results for specific keywords.  The following page in our support center provides specific steps and information detailing how to get initially indexed and better ranked in search engines, however, this is the only information regarding SEO our support center will be able to provide.

[The Basics of SEO](http://kb.weebly.com/seo.html)

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=2J8ZdPGxUIU&list=UUF8HNx9282f1dPrXsgrxtnw

It isn't necessary to list your site with Webmaster Tools to get indexed by Google, but it can be very helpful for improving your ranking.  The following article on our help site shows the exact steps you should take in order to get verified with Google Webmaster tools. Our short guide walks through this process if you'd like to give it a go:  

https://weebly.zendesk.com/hc/en-us/articles/201723433-Verify-Your-Site-with-Search-Engines

[Getting Verified by Google](http://kb.weebly.com/webmaster-tools.html)

You can also be verified by Bing if you'd like to take those extra steps:

[Getting Verified by Bing](http://www.bing.com/toolbox/webmaster)

You can do some optimization to help ensure your images show up in a Google image search, but it's not as fine-tuned as it is for a regular page search since there's less information for the search engines to work with.

Here are some things you can do:

* Use a descriptive image alt tag
* Embed your images in relevant pages
* Use a relevant heading and/or caption next to the image
* Include relevant descriptive links near the image
* Use descriptive anchor text to link to the image from other pages

If search results don't show recent changes you've made to the Title and Description area of your site, keep in mind that this is because search engines are not updated in real-time. It can take anywhere from a couple of days to a few weeks for a change made a page on your site to be reflected in the small preview area shown by a search engine. And there's no way for us as a company or for you individually to speed up this process, though Google is usually speedier about indexing your site if you set up a free Webmaster account with them.

And note that if a visitor clicks on the link to your site provided by the search engine they'll see the newest version of your site. There is no delay with that at all. It's only the preview area shown in the search engine results that takes time to update.

While we don't offer specific advice or assistance for this, here are some suggestions to  help you grow your website traffic:

**Spread the Word** - Tell your customers, family & friends about your site.

**[Optimize for Search Engines](http://kb.weebly.com/seo.html)** - make sure people can find you on Google.

**Update Regularly** - keeping your website content fresh gives visitors a reason to come back.

**Use Your Social Network** - post your site to Facebook, Twitter and/or LinkedIn whenever you update your content.

**[Start a Blog](http://kb.weebly.com/new-blog.html)** - a blog is an easy way to regularly add new content to your site and attract and build repeat visits.

**[Add a Facebook Like Button](http://kb.weebly.com/facebook-like.html)** - so your visitors can easily share your website with their friends.

**Promote Your Site** - add a link to your email signature, include a link to your site when you post to forums or comment on articles.

**[Start an Email Newsletter](http://kb.weebly.com/newsletter-form.html)** - use it as a tool to bring visitors back to your website.

**Get Reciprocal Links** - swap links with other websites that have a similar audience to drive free qualified traffic.

**Try Pay-Per-Click Advertising** - drive targeted traffic to your website.

If you need an SEO consultant, there are a number of third-party companies out there that are happy to assist Weebly users. If you search Google for "SEO consultant" you'll see many of them on the first page. While we don't currently endorse any companies or consultants in particular, I'm confident you will be able to find a consultant to help with your individual needs.

Weebly is a web host and sitebuilder, but each site on our network belongs to the individual account owner. Their content does not belong to Weebly any more than the content of a site at Wordpress.com belongs to Wordpress.

You will need to reach out to the owner of the website directly to ask them to take down the content referring to your company.

Alternatively, you may request to have the links ignored (disavowed). See the following links for more information.

https://support.google.com/webmasters/answer/2648487?hl=en

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=393nmCYFRtA

The problem is that one of your other accounts was banned.  Once an account is banned, you generally cannot access any of your other accounts. 

To fix this problem, you need to clear all Weebly related Flash cookies from your computer.  Just follow this link and use the tool they provide to delete anything referring to Weebly:  

http://www.macromedia.com/support/documentation/en/flashplayer/help/settings_manager07.html

Once you've done this you'll need to close your browser and open it again.

This sounds like a browser cache issue. Can you try to clear your cache, exit your browser completely, re-open it and then access Weebly? If you're not sure how to clear your cache, take a look here:

http://www.wikihow.com/Clear-Your-Browser's-Cache

If that is not successful, please try accessing the Weebly Site Editor in an "Incognito" or "Private" Browser Window.

I am sorry you experienced this. We have refunded the charge back to your card, and you should see this reflected on your statement within a few business days. I have also disabled the responsible account and banned them from our system.

I would recommend contacting your credit card company as soon as possible, as it appears this card has been compromised.
We do not allow MLM / Make Free Money style sites on our network.  Because of this, your sites were shut down and the accounts disabled.  Sorry this happened out of the blue.

Thank you for contacting Weebly about this issue. I realize that this situation is a serious concern for you, however, Weebly, as a provider of web hosting services to the general public, is simply not in a position to evaluate the merits of claims thatÂ one of its users has posted materials that allegedly violate the rights of another person. Â 
Â 
The United States Congress has recognized that it is inappropriate for internet service providers and web hosts to police claims that are made about content that others have created.Â That is why Congress enacted Section 230 of the Communications Decency Act to protect companies like Weebly from being expected to act as an arbiter in situations like this one.Â Congress recognized that otherwise it would be impossible for companies like ours to provide the services that we do provide.
Â 
If you believe that a person has violated your legal rights via the content theyâve posted on a Weebly-hosted website, you should consult an attorney about bringing a lawsuit against that person.Â  If you do not know the name of the person who posted the material, it is possible to bring what is known as a "John Doe" lawsuit against them.Â  
Â 
Additionally, if you believe that someone may have committed a crime by posting something on a Weebly-hosted website, you should contact law enforcement first and foremost so that they can investigate if and as needed. 
Â 
I know this reply is likely quite frustrating and not what you want to hear from us, but we cannot necessarily respond further or in more detail about the specifics of every situation. And I want to stress again that you should consult an attorney as nothing in this email is intended as legal advice.
Thank you very much for making us aware of this problem site.  I have taken it down and disabled the responsible account.

You've encountered this issue because it appears that your site was in violation of our Terms of Service.  As a result of that violation we were forced to ban your account.  You can learn more about our ToS here (all of the key info is right up top):

http://www.weebly.com/terms-of-service/

If you feel that we've made an error by banning your site, please reply to this message with more info about your account and we'll look into the situation to see if the ban can be reversed.

We are going to be releasing the new Weebly eCommerce to the Designer Platform sometime this year. We wanted to make sure we really thought through how to best help you offer this to your clients, and make sure you understood the changes well ahead of time.


At this time, I don't have a release date or any information about pricing, but stay tuned to http://blog.weebly.com for announcements. 

If there's anything further I can assist you with, please just let me know and I'll get right back to you.

Weebly is a web host and sitebuilder but each site on our network belongs to the individual account owner. Their content does not belong to Weebly any more than the content of a site at Wordpress.com belongs to Wordpress.


You will need to reach out to the owner of the website directly to ask them to take down the content referring to your company. A Trademark is not the same as Copyright (which is stringently protected by the DMCA) and we cannot simply act as the enforcement arm of your company in these Trademark claims.


We would be happy to take action given a proper court order, should you choose to pursue legal action against the person who created the site.

Please direct any legal communication to:

Legal Compliance
Weebly, Inc
460 Bryant Ave
Suite 100
San Francisco, CA  94107


If you believe this website is violating your copyright, feel free to file a DMCA complaint at http://www.weebly.com/dmca.php.

Unfortunately, due to recent issues with fraudulent credit card purchases, our Abuse and Operations teams have blocked all purchases from the country of Turkey. I am sorry, but there is no way for us to lift this ban on a case by case basis.

Howdy!

I can definitely help you out with this! When would be a good time to call you and discuss this? Also, it doesn't look like we have a phone number on file for your account. Please respond with a good time and good phone number so that we may discuss this. Looking forward to speaking with you!

I've moved the site over to the new account for you.  The password for your new account is weeblyback3.

If you use the requested email address in the username field to log in along with the password noted above, you should be able to access your new account. Once in, please click on the Account tab to reset your password to something secure and easy to remember.  You can also change all your other account access information from this same tab.  If you run into any issues with this, please just let me know and I'll get right back to you.

We maintain regular backups which can be restored in case of a catastrophic failure on our end. We can restore an accidentally deleted site on a case-by-case basis, but we cannot just roll back to a certain date and time.

If you wish to maintain an offline backup of your site, you may do so by going to the Settings tab an scrolling down to the Archive section where you can download a .zip archive. Please keep in mind Store and Blog pages (and some other features) rely on our database and won't be included in the archive. Also, this archive is generally intended for moving the site to another host and it's not possible to import the archive back into Weebly at this time.

You can use the 'Copy Site' feature under the 'More' menu next to your site title on your dashboard page to create a copy of the site online which can be republished if necessary. Again, blog and store content is not part of the copy.

While we can restore deleted pages and sites, we don't currently have the ability to restore other content or to roll a site back to a previously published or saved state. Weebly's save-as-you-go functionality ensures you never have to worry about saving your work, but it also means that we have no direct way to put a site back to how it was at a previous date and time.  I'm truly sorry I don't have a way to fix this for you.

To change the web address (URL) of your website, go to the "Settings" tab of the editor and click on "Change Site Address".  From here, you can choose a different address.  Once complete, re-publish your site.  Learn more on our help site:

http://hc.weebly.com/hc/en-us/articles/201740093-How-Can-I-Change-My-Site-s-Address-or-Domain-Name-

Please note if you own a custom domain name, you cannot change your name without purchasing a new custom domain name (unless you already own the domain to which you're trying to switch).

actions.value: The inventory only displays when it drops below 4 (since this is when it would be most relevant to a customer). If you have five or more items in stock, then your shoppers won't see the total inventory.

We also host several free live training sessions every week to walk customers through the ins-and-outs of building a Weebly website.  We encourage you to register to attend any of those sessions here:

http://hc.weebly.com/hc/en-us/sections/200362446-Live-Training-Webcasts

To delete a site, just click on the 'More' button next to the site name on the dashboard/user home page after logging in.  There is an option to delete the site there.  If you run into any issues with this, please just let me know and I'll get right back to you.

I'm sorry to say we don't currently have a way to expand a standard Weebly account beyond ten sites. But there is a way around this! 

If you need more than 10 sites then the appropriate approach is to convert your account to Designer. This can be done via your 'Account' tab (there's a button there to convert your account to Designer); Designer accounts can have an unlimited number of sites via their 'Clients' section.  Please note that each Published site in the Designer Platform is $7.95 a month. You could continue to maintain the initial 10 sites in your 'My Sites' tab under your flat Pro fee; they are not included as part of the Designer Platform.

Unfortunately, at this time, we're not able to transfer sites between Weebly accounts.

You have three options as to how you can proceed:

1) The site can be rebuilt entirely from scratch on the new account. If you're using a custom domain name, you can start using it on the new account instead.

2) We can move the website into a ***brand new Weebly account***. This account must use an email address that *is not already associated with any other Weebly account*. If you want to take this route, do NOT create the Weebly account. Just let us know what email address you would like to use and which site you want moved and we'll take care of the rest. And keep in mind that we can only move one site to one new email address. There isn't an option to move multiple sites to one new account.

     **Please note that if you're using the Weebly Store features, these cannot be moved or copied. If we move your site to a new account, any existing store or products will be lost and need to be rebuilt. 

3) You may consider using the 'Editors' tab to assign someone else as an administrator for the site. The other party can log in using their own e-mail address and password and edit only that site without having access to the rest of the account.

The issue here is that you made a typo in the email address you used to create the account. But that typo is a blatant typo of the address you've used to contact us, so we've been able to manually reset your password to weeblyback3 and fix the typo so that your actual email address is username on the account.

If you use your email address in the username field to log in along with the password noted above, you should be able to gain access to your account again. Once in, please click on the Account tab to reset your password to something more secure.  You can also change all your other account access information from this same tab.  If you continue to experience any issues accessing your account, please just let me know and I'll get right back to you.

Howdy!

I would love to help you out with this. When would be a good time to call and discuss this with you?

It doesn't look like we have a phone number on file for your account. If you would, please respond with your number and a good time to reach you so that we may work to resolve this issue.

Looking forward to speaking with you!

actions.value:
I am very sorry for the delay. This is our busiest season, and unfortunately, your question has not yet been answered.

Do you still need an answer? If so, we'd ask that you check out our FAQs and help guides at help.weebly.com.   If you can't find the answer you need, please reply to this email and let us know that you still need assistance.  Your ticket will retain its original priority in the queue and we'll get to it as soon as we can.

There is also no need to reply to this email if your question has already been handled. 

Again, I am very sorry for the wait and for this request. We're doing everything we can to increase our staffing to meet our current demand as we continue to experience rapid growth.

In order for the portal to work properly, you need to set up two C Name records.  One for Preview, and one for Portal (or whichever subdomain names you would like to use).

Portal needs to point to portal.editmysite.com.  You need THAT exact url.  Nothing else.  No substitutions.

Preview needs to point to preview.editmysite.com.

Please give that a try.  Once the settings are correct, you will be able to alter the designer settings.

Should it still not work, kindly send us a screenshot of your C Name record settings and we will get right back to you to help resolve the issues.

macros.title: Commerce::Shipping and Payments::Missing PayPal Order Notification

value:
If you received an order through Paypal but it did not show up in your Orders tab, this is usually because the buyer changed some information when they arrived at the Paypal checkout screen after filling in the Weebly checkout forms. There are a number of things they can change at the Paypal checkout, including shipping address and contact information. When the information they entered at Weebly doesn't match what's added at Paypal, the order is not sent back to Weebly.

Our developers are working with payPal to try to find a way around this issue.

macros.title: Campus::Add an Existing Teacher Account to Campus

value:
Your teachers with existing Weebly accounts can be added to Campus as long as they have an Education account (if they aren't sure, logging in at http://education.weebly.com/ will convert them if they aren't already using Education), and are then invited by you to Campus.

To do this please follow these steps:

1. Click the 'Add a Teacher' button, and then enter first and last name. 

2. Next, enter the email address the teacher uses to log into their Weebly account. Please ensure you have the correct email address.

3. Click on 'Add' and then the system should recognize that there is an existing account under this address and send an invite to them. Make sure to advise teachers to check their junk/spam for this email if they don't see it in their inbox.

Please note that the system will automatically generate a random username based on the teacher's first/last name as if it were a new account, but once the registered email address is put in, the system will recognize it as an existing account.

If you have teachers who want to use Weebly and **do not** already have an account, you can create a new account for them by adding them to Campus following the steps above (noting that with a new account, there will be no invitation sent - you will need to provide them with their login information directly).

If you run into any issues with this, please just let me know and I'll get right back to you.

macros.title: Close as Solved By Phone Team
Commerce::Advanced Stats with Google Analytics for eCommerce

value:
If you'd like more detailed stats for your store, Google Analytics provides powerful (and free) tracking for eCommerce. Weebly enables you to take advantage of this tracking via the Advanced section of your Store Settings.

Our short guide details how to activate this tracking both within Google Analytics and Weebly:

http://hc.weebly.com/hc/en-us/articles/201879947-Advanced-eCommerce-Tracking-with-Google-Analytics-

It's necessary, of course, to have a Google Analytics account to access these free stats. If you don't have such an account, set one up at http://www.google.com/analytics/.

Google's stats provide detailed info about:

Products: Which products shoppers buy, in what quantity they buy those products, and the revenue generated by those products.

Transactions: The revenue, tax, shipping, and quantity information for each transaction. 

Time to Purchase: The number of days and number of visits it takes for a customer to make a purchase, starting from the most recent campaign through the completed transaction.

While Weebly provides the option to add a list of products to a store by uploading a .CSV spreadsheet, that option is not a one size fits all solution to placing products in a store and isn't always an advisable approach to doing so. It's meant to be used in one of three scenarios:

1) If you exported products from Etsy. 

2) If you exported products from Shopify. 

3) If you built the spreadsheet completely from scratch using our provided sample spreadsheet as your guide. You can find our example spreadsheet here if you want to try it out:

http://hc.weebly.com/hc/en-us/articles/201378203-Import-Products-or-an-Entire-Store-from-Etsy-Shopify-or-a-Spreadsheet-

There are no other scenarios in which the spreadsheet option will work. So, for example, if you downloaded a list of products from a store system other than Etsy or Shopify, that list isn't going to work when you try to upload it even if you modify it. You'd need to either build the list completely from scratch or add your products through our usual process that we describe here:

http://hc.weebly.com/hc/en-us/articles/201378113-Add-Physical-Products-to-a-Store
Please respond to this email so that I can verify your identity, and manually reset your password.

macros.title: Commerce::Export Order History to CSV / Quickbooks

value:
You can export your store's Order History to either a CSV Spreadsheet (for use with programs like Excel) or a Quickbooks file via the Orders section of your Store dashboard. Check out our short guide to see how this works: 

http://hc.weebly.com/hc/en-us/articles/201802306-Export-Your-Store-Order-History-to-CSV-Excel-Numbers-or-Quickbooks

You can download data for all of your orders or download orders that have occurred over a set period of days or weeks that you select. The link to download the file is sent to the email address on file for your account, so if you don't receive the download link within ten minutes make sure you're looking at the right email address and check your spam folder to see if the link has been inadvertently dropped there. There is currently no other way to get a link to download your order history other than through an emailed link.

macros.title: Commerce::Other:: PayPal Guest Checkout / Credit Cards

value:
The PayPal feature you're looking to use is what's known as Guest Checkout. This feature enables your customers to make a purchase through PayPal using any major credit card without the need for a PayPal Account. PayPal only provides this option if you have either a Premiere or Business account with them. 

Here's how to turn this on within PayPal:

::Log in to your account at PayPal.com

::Go to your Profile and select "More Options"

::Choose "My Selling Tools" from the menu on the left. 

::Here's you'll find a section called "Selling Online". Select Website Preference from this section and click the Update link. 

:: Last step! Turn on the "PayPal Account Optional" selection and then SAVE your changes at the bottom of the page. 

That'll do the trick! There's nothing extra you need to do with your Weebly site to get this working. As soon as you make the change in PayPal your customers will have the option to either pay with their credit card or log in to their PayPal account (though it may occasionally take PayPal a couple of hours to reflect the change has been made).

Each checkout provider charges their own transaction fees which are described on the 'Checkout Settings' page (where you choose Paypal, Stripe, Square, or Authorize.net). Those fees are charged by the checkout provider and have nothing to do with Weebly.


With a free, Starter, or Pro account, Weebly also charges 3% per transaction, but that fee is waived with the Business service. 


If you were using the Weebly product elements before the upgrade, your account will be "grandfathered" so that you can have unlimited products and no transaction fees, no matter what level of service you have. You can view the limits for your account by logging into Weebly and clicking this link: 

http://www.weebly.com/weebly/accountDetails.php

If you have any further questions about this, please just let me know and I'll get right back to you.

macros.title: Commerce::Other:: Why Can't I Use Paypal?

value:
With a Free, Starter, or Pro account, you can use Stripe to process credit card payments directly from your site. 

With a Business account, you also have the option of using Paypal, Square, or Authorize.net to accept payments. 

The alternate payment methods are a feature of the Business upgrade and are not available with a Free, Starter, or Pro account. 

If you prefer to use custom buttons from Paypal instead of using the Weebly Store, you are welcome to do so and you do not need to upgrade in order to do this. You'll need to create your purchase buttons on the Paypal site, then place the code they generate for you into one of our Custom HTML Elements.  Learn how this works here:

[Create Custom PayPal Buttons](http://kb.weebly.com/paypal-custom.html)

How can you send email from an Alias? By adjusting a couple of settings directly through your Google email inbox. 

The first step is to log in to that mail inbox and then to follow along with our short tutorial: 

http://hc.weebly.com/hc/en-us/articles/202161508-Send-Email-FROM-an-Alias

And if you're not sure what an alias is, this guide will show the way!

https://weebly.zendesk.com/hc/en-us/articles/201789187-Create-Aliases-of-an-Email-Address

Facebook takes a "snapshot" called a Cache of your website (or blog post) when it first sees it. The next time you post the same link, Facebook will think that it already knows everything it needs to know about the page, and it won't actually go fetch the changes.

To have Facebook take a new Cache of your site, you will want to go to this link, paste in the URL for your blog post, and click "Fetch New Scrape Information".

https://developers.facebook.com/tools/debug/og/object/

This will force Facebook to take a new look at your site, and subsequent shares of your link will show the new information.

macros.title: Commerce::Other::Are Contact Forms Secure with the Business Plan SSL?

value: I'm sorry, but only the shopping cart/checkout pages are SSL secure with our Business Plan.  Data submitted via the "Contact Form" element is not secure. Please be sure not to collect any sensitive personal or financial data in this manner.

The Business upgrade is a site-level service.  For more clarification regards "grandfathered" accounts, please take a look at the update at:
http://blog.weebly.com/2/post/2013/11/ecommerce-update.html 

You can use the basic commerce features on any of your websites, but if you need the more advanced commerce features (taxes, shipping, inventory control, SSL), you will need to upgrade individual sites to Business service.  If you have any further questions about this, please just let me know and I'll get right back to you.

Currently the new Commerce Business platform is not available in Education accounts. One option would be to spin the site off into a standard Weebly account. You would then be able to upgrade the site.

If you want to take this route, please do NOT create the Weebly account. Just let us know what email address you would like to use and which site you want moved and I will happily take care of the rest for you.

This issue is actually caused due to a setting in your Paypal account. It's pretty easy to fix.

http://blog.scrobbld.com/paypal/change-encoding-in-your-paypal-account/

Follow those instructions and you should be good to go.

If you have any further issue, please do get back in touch with me and I'll be happy to help you further!

macros.title: Commerce::Other::Can I Have a Store Without Selling

value:
At this time, our commerce features are not suitable for displaying a catalog with no option for online purchasing. To do that, you'd need to use the regular picture/text elements instead of the Store. 

If you want to keep up with our changes and updates, be sure to follow our blog at http://blog.weebly.com.

You are also welcome to suggest and vote on this and other features at http://www.weebly.com/editor/feature_request.php.

To create a "Donate" button, follow the instructions [here](https://www.paypal.com/cgi-bin/webscr?cmd=_donate-intro-outside).

Once you set up your button or link, PayPal will give you code that you should place into an Embed Code element in your Weebly editor.  Read more about how this works here:

http://hc.weebly.com/hc/en-us/articles/205737658-Accept-Donations-with-PayPal

Please do let me know if you have any further questions or concerns.

You will be given the ability to rate **me** on the support you received on this issue -- I always appreciate the feedback.

macros.title: Commerce::Other::Missing PayPal Order Notifications - Enable IPN

value:
We have determined that this problem originates in your PayPal account. Our developers worked with PayPal and found a way around the problem, but it is something you'll need to do in your own account.

These are the steps to perform:

1. When you log into your Paypal account, on the "Summary" page, look about halfway down the page on the left and click "Seller Preferences".

2. Under "Getting Paid and Managing Risk", you'll see the "Instant Payment Notifications". Click the "Update" link next to that option. 

3. Click the "Choose IPN Settings" button.

4. You should now be on the page where you can enter a URL into a text field. Please enter any URL there - you can use http://www.google.com/ for example - and then enable IPN and save.

5. Now click the link to "Turn off IPN". 

Once you've performed these steps, you should no longer have a problem.

Please give that a try and let me know.

If you'd like to preserve the original look of your site, you can choose to operate your store in what we call "Legacy Mode".  Please see the following instructions:

1) Click on the 'Store' tab at the top of the editor. 

2) Choose 'Settings' on the left and then select 'Display'.  

3) Scroll to the bottom of the page and you'll see a button there that toggles Legacy Mode On / Off. Switch that it *On* and save your Settings. 

When you Publish your site, your products will look exactly the same as they did before the change. However, keep in mind that this only changes how the store is displayed. The way the store is managed is still handled through our new commerce features. Learn more about this here: 

http://hc.weebly.com/hc/en-us/sections/200282928-Commerce

If you prefer not to use our Store feature, you're welcome to use other shopping carts.  But it is necessary that these other carts provide you with embeddable "Add to Cart" style buttons for each item you'd like to sell.  Most carts do provide this option, but some do not, so you'll need to check with your provider. 

Learn more here:

http://kb.weebly.com/other-carts.html

Howdy!

I wanted to get in touch with you to say that it was a pleasure speaking with you today, and I'm glad we were able to get everything squared away.

Please let me know if I can be of any further assistance! You can reply to this email and it will come to me directly, or you can always give us a call back.

You will be given the opportunity to rate **me** on the support you received on this issue -- I always appreciate the feedback.

macros.title: Commerce::Other::PayPal buyer phone number not displayed

value:
If you need to have your customerâs phone number included with their order information, then there is a setting in Paypal youâll first need to enable.

Log into your Paypal account and go to âMy Selling Toolsâ under the Profile menu. Once there, click the update link next to âWebsite Preferencesâ.

When you scroll down on this page, you will see the âContact Telephone Numberâ section. Paypal disables this by default, so youâll need to choose whether to require the phone number or simply make it optional.

Once youâve done that, you should see phone numbers from your customers in your orders.

This problem is due to your PayPal account requiring encrypted buttons.  To remove this requirement, please:

1) Log in to your PayPal account.  
2) Click Profile.  
3) From the Selling Preferences column, click Website Payment Preferences.  
4) In the Encrypted Website Payments section, select Off.  
5) Click Save.

No important information is passed from your site to the cart, so it is not necessary for the buttons to be encrypted.  All of your customer information is entered through the encrypted payment page that PayPal will present them when they're done.

Unfortunately, it is too late to make changes to your domain as we are now technically unable to cancel the domain and switch it out for a different one.  That means it is simply not possible to fix your domain now.  A domain is essentially an unchangeable piece of property -- you even own it completely outside of our system and can transfer it elsewhere if you ever want to do so. 

So to change your domain to the one that you want you'd need to buy a new domain.  To purchase a new domain name, click on the 'Settings' tab in your editor, click "change site address" and choose Option B. After you enter an available domain name, you'll be taken to a purchase page to complete your order.

http://hc.weebly.com/hc/en-us/articles/201273693-Buy-Your-Own-Personal-Domain-Name

Some of our themes use background images for the header / banner area of of the site instead of using the standard headers that most of our other themes use. This makes it impossible to use the Header Slideshow option. You're currently using one of the themes that works in the way I've described. What are your options? 

The only real option to use Header Slideshows is to switch to a theme that support this feature. Many of our themes **do** support this feature, so it's fairly easy to find one. What you will look for is a Theme that has a "contained" header area, rather than a screen-wide one.

These slideshows function in much the same way as our standard slideshows, excepting, of course, that they've been designed to work specifically with the Header of the site.  To learn more about all the banner slideshow options, please see:

http://kb.weebly.com/banner-slideshows.html

And you can learn how to switch themes here:

https://weebly.zendesk.com/hc/en-us/articles/201696407-How-to-Switch-Themes

actions.value:
Unfortunately, we are unable to provide refunds for domain orders because we have already paid for the cost of the name through the registrar and can't get a refund ourselves, according to the rules of ICANN which is the association that manages all domain registrations.

The domain is registered under your name and is fully transferable to another service provider. To manage your domain settings, log in to Weebly and go to the Domains tab . You'll see a list of every domain name you own. In here, you can adjust your DNS settings (name servers) to point to a host who can better suit your needs. We apologize that we were unable to fully satisfy you, but please check back as we are constantly improving.

We appreciate your patience while we continue to develop Weebly!

It sounds like the current image ratio setting isn't the right fit for your images.  You can adjust this very easily by following these instructions: 

1) Go to the 'Store' tab in the editor.  

2) Click the 'Settings' option on the left and then choose 'Display'. 

3) You'll see a section for Image Ratios here with several options. 

You can select 3x2 or 4x3 for images that are rectangular and have a width greater than height.

If your images are square, you should select 1x1 ratio. 

And if your images are taller than they are wide, you may opt for 3x4, or 2x3.

4) Once you've made your selection, just save the settings and Publish your site. Your images should now be displaying properly.

for their statement about they're a business:
What is a taxable person?
For VAT purposes, a taxable person is any individual, partnership, company or whatever which supplies taxable goods and services in the course of business.
However, if the annual turnover of this person is less than a certain limit (the threshold), which differs according to the Member State, the person does not have to charge VAT on their sales.

You can easily remove the Cart from your menu bar.  Here's how to do it:

1) Click the *Store* tab in the Weebly editor. 

2) Choose *Settings* on the left side and then select *General*. 

3) Use the *Store Mode* drop-down menu to choose the *Buy Now* option. 

4) Save your Settings and then Publish your site. The Cart menu should now be gone. 

But I'd recommend not turning it off. Why? 

Because there are an incredible number of new features that come along with this Store tab, one of which is a Mini Cart that helps your customers keep track of everything they're buying from you (and essentially prompts them to purchase as they add more stuff to their cart). macros.title: Designer::Can I Bill My Clients Through Weebly?

value:
Unfortunately, we are not currently able to directly bill your Clients. You would be responsible for charging your clients for the service(s) you are providing.  

There's a good chance we'll add this functionality in the future, and we greatly appreciate your patience as we continue to develop Weebly.

If you want to keep up with our changes and updates, be sure to follow our blog at http://blog.weebly.com.

You are also welcome to suggest and vote on potential new features at http://www.weebly.com/editor/feature_request.php.

macros.title: Designer::Can I Use the Designer Platform for a Site That Won't Be Hosted Here?

value:
If a website is being hosted somewhere else and there's no plan to point the domain name here and use it with our hosting, then the most you would be able to do is build the website in our editor, export it once it is finished, and then upload the exported site to the existing host. At that point, you would then perform all future updates and maintenance for that site with whatever means the host provides. You would not be able to use our Editor to update or edit that site. This would be true whether you were using the Designer Platform or just a standard Weebly account.

You can export your website using the "archive to .zip" option under the "Settings" tab of the Editor. Please keep in mind that blog and store pages will not be exported as they rely directly on our database. Some of our elements also may not work correctly when hosted elsewhere, like our Contact Form and Slideshow elements. If possible, you should try to keep your website hosted on Weebly in order to easily update it.

Learn more here:

http://hc.weebly.com/hc/en-us/articles/215827367-Back-Up-Your-Site-zip-

The zip archive cannot currently be used to restore a site back to Weebly, so it is only useful as a personal backup or for uploading to another host.

I just spoke with our QA department regarding "requests failing" to submit changes, and it appears that this is an issue that has to do solely with the ability of your device to connect to our server.

When editing on the iPad, the data is being stored locally on the device. It then periodically "syncs" with our servers -- sharing the information.

The message that you're seeing is telling you that the information stored locally and has yet to sync to the server.

I myself see this happen at my house when I'm using my iPad to edit my own sites. I connect via my phones "wi-fi hotspot" which, while it can be a speedy connection, it is not a "stable" connection, and thus creates periodic issues for me when trying to reconcile the content I've added locally on my iPad with the Weebly servers.

There is unfortunately not a solution we can offer from our end for this issue, as it does depend solely on the ability for the device to connect to our servers.

macros.title: Designer::Client can't log in using Safari

value:
There is currently an issue with the way Safari handles cookies which are required by our Designer client login portal. With most browsers you'll be able to log in without an issue, but  Safari  incorrectly blocks the cookies required by our designer portal because it believes they're coming from a third party (which they're not). We're working on fixing this issue, but for the time being you'll need to change one setting in Safari to get things working.

To fix this issue, you should go to Safari -> Preferences -> Privacy -> and under "Block Cookies", select "Never", then save and reload the login page. Once you do that, try to log in and you'll get through without an issue. You can always re-enable the browser to block cookies from third parties again once you've logged in, but if you log out and have to re-enter your password then you'll have to 
unblock the cookies again.

Should that not work, unfortunately, the client will need to use a different browser.

The Weebly iPhone and Android apps currently can only be used for standard Weebly sites.  It can't be used for Client sites simply because it's not possible for us to create a branded version of the app for every single designer.  

However, a version of the app that allows Designers to manage / track Client sites will be coming later in the year.  Stay tuned for updates!

value:
Unfortunately, it is not possible for us to move sites built with the Designer Platform into your regular Weebly account.

Once moved, it will appear under the "My Sites" tab on the new account. If you want to take this route, we will need an email address from you that is NOT already associated with a Weebly account. We can then create the account for you and move the client site over to that account.

Assuming you want to proceed, I will also need for you to confirm which client site this was in reference to.  Please just reply to this email with the requested information and I will get everything set up for you right away.

Designer::Why Isn't My Portal Address Working?

value:
In order for the portal to work properly, you need to set up two C Name records.  One for Preview, and one for Portal (or whichever subdomain names you would like to use).

Portal needs to point to portal.editmysite.com. You need THAT exact url. Nothing else. No substitutions.

You can use a subdomain like login.yourdomain.com, account.thisisyourdomain.com, or any other subdomain you prefer. But the CNAME always needs to point to portal.editmysite.com. 

Preview needs to point to preview.editmysite.com in exactly the same way as described above. 

Please give that a try. Once the settings are correct, you will be able to alter the designer settings.

Should it still not work, kindly send us a screenshot of your C Name record settings.

Each email inbox you purchase from Weebly and Google Apps mail includes the option create up to 30 different aliases of that address. An email alias enables you to receive mail from a different address through the same inbox. Letâs say you create a Google Apps email like this one:

me@tomtravels.net

You can also have aliases of this address like tom@tomtravels.net, contact@tomtravels.net, thisisanemailaddress@tomtravels.net, and upto27otherthings@tomtravels.net.

How is an alias different from a normal email address? It differs in that all the messages sent to an alias are simply forwarded to another address. In the example above, mail sent to tom@tomtravels.net and contact@tomtravels.net would be forwarded to the inbox for me@tomtravels.net. This makes aliases useful for a single person who wants multiple addresses, but not useful for creating addresses for different people since itâs very unlikely youâd want different people all using the same email inbox.

You can learn all about how to set this up using our short guide here: 

http://hc.weebly.com/hc/en-us/articles/201789187-Create-Aliases-of-an-Email-Address

Sorry for the confusion!

If you're already logged into your personal Google account when you click the "Go to Inbox" link, Google may try to take you to that inbox or they may show you a list of Google accounts you've used on this computer and ask you which one you want to use. 

If you land in the wrong mailbox, click on your address or profile picture in the upper right corner of the screen and choose "Add Account". You'll be able to log into your new Google Apps account from there. Use the e-mail address you're trying to set up and the temporary password you were given. 

If Google shows you a list of Google accounts to choose from, scroll to the bottom of the list and click "Add Account". Log in using the new e-mail address you're setting up and your temporary password.

Once you get into the account, you'll be prompted to accept Google's terms and conditions and then you'll be routed to your inbox. 

Next time you click on that link, Google will remember this account and you'll be fine.

If you feel at all confused or intimidated by the instructions at that link, you may want to write your registrar and ask them to set this up. Feel free to copy and paste the message I've written below:
  
*I created a website with Weebly and need to point my domain to their servers.  Can you set this up for me or walk me through the process of making these changes?  I need to create A-Records for "www" and for my root domain. That's one record for "www"  pointing to 199.34.228.59. And one record for the root domain pointing to 199.34.228.59.*
   
*If you need more info on these changes, please see:*
  
*http://hc.weebly.com/hc/en-us/articles/201372693-How-to-Use-a-Domain-You-Purchased-Elsewhere*
  
*Note that I want to keep using you as my domain registrar.  I am not requesting a transfer and do not have new name servers to provide you.*

macros.title: Domain::Free Subdomain Forwarding to Custom Domain

value:
When you switch from a free Weebly subdomain to your own domain name we automatically forward any visitors from that free Weebly subdomain to your personal domain. This is done to ensure that anyone who visits your old subdomain is automatically sent to your proper address. 

That said, the old subdomain is not directly connected to your site in any way. Google and the other search engines don't see the subdomain so it won't impact SEO. Your visitors don't see it so they won't know that Weebly is involved. It's not something that anyone would ever know about it unless they already know about the old subdomain (from an older version of your site) and happen to use it. That's when we automatically forward them to the new domain name.

macros.title: Domain::Internal:: Redemption Period / RGP is Almost Over

value:
Your domain expired more than 44 days ago.  After the 44 day mark we actually lose direct control over the domain and we have to pay a very hefty fee to bring it back online. 

Our domain registrar has informed us that it would be possible to renew your domain for $80. Please note again that this higher price is not due to fees being assessed by Weebly. We have to pay the higher rate to renew the domain because it's gone into a state known as the "Redemption Grace Period" due to how long it's been expired.  

If you are interested in renewing this domain immediately, please submit your payment through http://charge.weebly.com/expired-domain.html and reply back to let us know once complete.  We will then pay to reactivate your domain and everything will be back up and running.

You should purchase the domain from RGP now if you want to bring it back online immediately; otherwise, you can wait and attempt to register it once it's fully available again (which occurs roughly 75 days after the original expiration date), but note that it will then be available to register by anyone, and you could potentially lose ownership of it.

Your domain will be removed from RGP in a few days based on what we see in our system. So if you want to wait it out and register it again as new, you certainly can. Just note again that anyone else will be able to register it after the RGP period ends so you'll want to act fast simply to make sure you don't lose your domain to someone else.

I'm truly sorry for this and wish it was fixed already.

macros.title: Domain::Internal::DROA / Domain Registry of America Scam (Already Transferred)

value:
You DO NOT need to transfer your domain to the "Domain registry of America" in order to renew your domain; however, unfortunately, it looks like you have already done so.  They are actually trying to scam people into transferring their domain to them so they can have you pay them to renew it.

I'm sorry that this happened to you!

For future reference, all legitimate billing notices will come by e-mail from an @weebly.com address and will advise you to log into your Weebly account to update your billing information. We do not send paper notifications and we do not take payments by mail. You can click the Billing tab within your Weebly account at any time to view all of your paid services and the renewal options.

macros.title: Domain::Internal::DROA / Domain Registry of America Scam (Not Transferred)

value:
You DO NOT need to pay the "Domain Registry of America" in order to renew your domain.  They are actually trying to scam people into transferring domains into their control.

If you've paid them, you should request a complete refund, and if they do not offer it, call your credit card company and reverse the charge they've placed.

Your domain is properly under your control and set up with Weebly as is. When you log into your Weebly account, click the 'Billing' tab to see all of your paid services and renewal dates and options.

For future reference, all legitimate billing notices will come by e-mail from an @weebly.com address and will advise you to log into your Weebly account to update your billing information. We do not send paper notifications and we do not take payments by mail. You can log into your Weebly account at any time and click on the Billing tab to see all your paid services and renewal dates and settings.

Howdy!

Our developers have released a fix that has resolved your issue.

Please let me know if you experience any further trouble!

macros.title: Domain::Internal::EPP Code / Unlock Domain for Transfer

value:
It's certainly not a problem for you to transfer your domain elsewhere and we do everything we can to make the process as easy as possible. You can unlock a domain for transfer and generate your EPP code via the 'Domains' tab of your account. Follow along with our short guide to learn how to do so: 

http://kb.weebly.com/unlock-domain.html

You are also welcome to simply update the nameservers on your domain to provide a new host with full DNS control. Changing your nameservers can sometimes involve less hassle than transferring it.  Take a look at our instructions to see how to change your nameservers and other settings:

http://hc.weebly.com/hc/en-us/articles/201184656-Manage-Nameserver-Records

To manage your domain settings and whois information, log in to Weebly and go to the 'Domains' tab . You'll see a list of every domain name you own. Select the Manage button and then: 

Go here to learn how to alter your DNS Settings (like A-Records, CNAMEs and Nameservers):

http://hc.weebly.com/hc/en-us/articles/201184656-Manage-Nameserver-Records

Go here to learn how to update your WHOIS info: 

http://hc.weebly.com/hc/en-us/articles/201103198-How-to-Update-Your-Domain-s-WHOIS-Info

You can purchase a domain (.com, .net, .co.uk, .ca, .nl, .de, .fr, .es, .us, .eu, .info, .co, .co.nz, .com.au or .org) through Weebly very easily with no setup or configuration necessary.  The cost of this is $39.95 per year for a 1 year term, or less per year when purchased for a longer term.  Hosting is included, and there are no additional monthly fees.  

Pricing for domain names is as follows:

1 Year $39.95
2 Years $33.95/year (15% discount)
5 Years $29.95/year (25% discount)
10 Years $24.99/year (37% discount)

Please note, .com.au domains can only be purchased for 2 years at a time.

To purchase your own domain name, click on the 'Settings' tab in your editor, select "change site address" and choose Option B. After you enter an available domain name, you'll be taken to a purchase page to complete your order.  Learn more here:

http://hc.weebly.com/hc/en-us/articles/201273693-Buy-Your-Own-Personal-Domain-Name

Howdy!

Our developers have released a fix that has resolved your issue. A republish of your site will be required for the changes to show on your LIVE site.

Please let me know if you experience any further trouble!

You can purchase WHOIS Privacy Protection for your domain name to hide your information from the international WHOIS database. This is $10 per year and you can read more about this (and how to activate it) in our short guide here:

http://kb.weebly.com/whois-privacy.html

Please note, we cannot offer WHOIS Privacy Protection on international domains (.co.uk, .ca, .nl, .de, .fr, .es, .co, .co.nz, .com.au and .eu).

If you have any questions about this, please just let me know and I'll get right back to you.

You received an email from Register.com, the company that Weebly uses to register domain names.  It was one of two emails:
- An annual contact information review (subject line âAction Required: Notice Regarding Your Domain Nameâ) which is sent once a year to verify the information for your domain name listed in the WHOIS database is correct
- A contact update email (subject line âAction Required: Confirm Your Contact Informationâ) which is sent because you recently purchased a new domain or made changes to your contact information associated with an existing domain.

In either case, these are legitimate emails.  

If you got the âConfirm Your Contact Informationâ email, please click the âConfirmâ button in the email.  It should take you to  page that says âYour Email is Confirmedâ.  If you get an error message or have any other difficulties, please respond to this email and we will investigate further to make sure that your domain contact information is accurate and confirmed.

If you got the âNotice Regarding Your Domain Nameâ email, you do not need to take any action if the information you see listed is correct. If any information is not right, you can easily update the information. Here's how:
- log in to your Weebly account

You received that email from Register.com, the company that Weebly uses to register domain names. ICANN regulations require you to verify that the information for your domain name listed in the WHOIS database is correct once each year.
You do not need to take any action if the information you see listed is correct. If any information is not right, you can easily update the information. Here's how:
- log in to your Weebly account
- click the Domains tab 
- click the "Manage" button to the right of the domain name. 
- on the next page you will see a box with "Contact Information". Click the "Edit" button to update your your contact information.

PLEASE NOTE:  If you do make any changes to your contact information, you will receive another email within the next week or so asking you to confirm your email address by clicking a âconfirmâ button in the email.  This is just an extra step to protect you from accidentally transferring or losing your domain.

Your domain expired more than 34 days ago.  After the 34 day mark we actually lose direct control over the domain and we have to pay a very hefty fee to bring it back online. 

Our domain registrar has informed us that it would be possible to renew your domain for $80. Please note again that this higher price is not due to fees being assessed by Weebly. We have to pay the higher rate to renew the domain because it's gone into a state known as the "Redemption Grace Period" due to how long it's been expired.  

If you are interested in renewing this domain immediately, please submit your payment through http://charge.weebly.com/expired-domain.html and reply back to let us know once complete. If possible, please include the transaction ID of your payment.  We will then pay to reactivate your domain and everything will be back up and running.

You should purchase the domain from RGP now if you want to bring it back online immediately; otherwise, you can wait and attempt to register it once it's fully available again (which occurs roughly 75 days after the original expiration date), but note that it will then be available to register by anyone, and you could potentially lose ownership of it.

You would have received multiple emails beginning several months ago warning that your domain account had invalid credit card details on file and an update was required in order to renew the domain. Warnings were also at the top of your account stating the same. I'm very sorry for this inconvenience and frustration, but hope that we can fix the situation quickly.

Thank you for getting back to us. Your domain has now been reactivated. While it may take up to an hour before your domain is fully restored, you should be able to continue publishing now.

Please note that in rare cases it can take up to 24 hours for the domain to be fully reactivated.

You received that email from Register.com, the company that Weebly uses to register domain names for our customers, because you recently purchased a new domain or made changes to your contact information associated with an existing domain.

New ICANN regulations require email verification for all new domain purchases or updates to contact information on existing domains.  Please click the âConfirmâ button in the email.  It should take you to  page that says âYour Email is Confirmedâ.  If you get an error message or have any other difficulties, please respond to this email and we will investigate further to make sure that your domain contact information is accurate and confirmed.  I apologize for the inconvenience.

We cannot normally make changes to a domain since we only have a very short window to make edits before the domain can technically no longer be altered.  But since you very recently purchased this domain, we should be able to make the needed changes.  

What address would you prefer instead of the one you purchased?

We are able to move domain names into register.com's retail division on your behalf, however this requires that you already have an account created at register.com.

If you do not yet have an account, you'll need to set one up. You can create an account through register.com directly or you can go through their discount division, namebargain.com.

When you have an account created, please reply with the account username along with the contact name (first/last) and we will have the domain moved over for you.

Your domain is currently in an expired state.  According to the rules of ICANN (the association that manages all domain registrations), you cannot transfer a domain while it is expired.  You technically no longer own the domain while it is expired and we have to pay to renew it so it can be transferred. 

Instead, you should log in to Weebly, click on the "update your billing information" link that is shown in the top orange notification box, and once complete, your domain will be reactivated and renewed.
