Once your domain is renewed, we can unlock your domain and assist you in transferring it.  Note that paying for the registration with us means you should not need to pay your new registrar anything for the domain.

Unfortunately, domain transfers are not allowed within the first 60 days of a domain registration. This rule is set by ICANN (the association that manages domain registrations).

However, this is not a problem as you are provided with full DNS management of your domain via your 'Domains' tab.  From here you can update your name servers or A-Records to point to a host that better suits your needs.  If you're unsure of the DNS information for your new host ask their help desk. 

Learn how to change your domain settings here:

http://hc.weebly.com/hc/en-us/articles/201184656-Manage-Nameserver-Records

We can help you make these changes if needed.  And after 60 days pass we can also help you transfer your domain completely away from us whenever you're ready.

Your domain was registered through our partnership with TuCows. Because of this, you would need to log-in directly through TuCows in order to make any changes to your WHOIS or DNS records.

To access your TuCows log-in credentials, log in to Weebly and go to the 'Domains' tab . You'll see a list of every domain name you own. Select the Manage button next to the domain name. You will then see a pop-up window that will show your your TuCows log-in details.

In order to comply with ICANN, the international organization that oversees all domain registrations on the internet, all domain owners need to verify that their WHOIS contact information is correct. A verification email would have been sent to the address on file for your domain. 

If you need to update the email address on file, log in to Weebly and go to the 'Domains' tab. You'll see a list of every domain name you own. Select the Manage button next to the domain name. You will then see a pop-up window that will show your your TuCows log-in details. Once logged in to TuCows, please update the email address listed for the Organization Information,  Admin Information,  Billing Information and  Technical Contact Information (these addresses should all match).

Please let  us know once this has been done and we'll make sure a verification email is resent to your address.

In order to comply with ICANN, the international organization that oversees all domain registrations on the internet, all domain owners need to verify that their WHOIS contact information is correct. A verification email would have been sent to the address on file for your domain. 

If you need to update the email address on file, log in to Weebly and go to the 'Domains' tab. You'll see a list of every domain name you own. Select the Manage button next to the domain name. You will then see a pop-up window that will show your your TuCows log-in details. Once logged in to TuCows, please update the email address listed for the Organization Information,  Admin Information,  Billing Information and  Technical Contact Information (these addresses should all match).

As noted in the email you received, if your contact info has not change you don't need to do anything at all.

I'm very sorry for any confusion. According to the rules of ICANN, the international organization that oversees all domain registrations on the internet, any time a domain is registered anywhere in the world, the owner's information must be submitted to the WHOIS database. This database is searchable on the internet.

There are companies who provide WHOIS "privacy protection" for a fee. Basically, the company submits their information to the WHOIS database in place of yours. They filter out any junk contacts and forward legitimate contacts to you privately.

It's possible to purchase WHOIS Privacy Protection for your domain name. This is $10 per year and you can read more about this (and how to activate it) in our short guide here:

http://kb.weebly.com/whois-privacy.html

As an alternative, you can log into your domain control panel and update the administrative contact for your domain, but you can't actually remove the contact information altogether.

To manage your domain settings and WHOIS information, log into your Weebly user account first and then go to the 'Domains' tab. Find the domain whose information you'd like to change and click the 'Manage' button. Your WHOIS contact information is accessible and editable there. 

Learn more here:

http://hc.weebly.com/hc/en-us/articles/201103198-Update-a-Domain-s-WHOIS-Info

macros.title: Domain::Internal::Why Did My Domain Renew Early?

value: The domain payment renews early to ensure that it renews before its expiration date.  If the payment were not to process successfully, it would allow you buffer time to update the payment details prior to the domain's expiration. The domain won't actually expire until the anniversary date of the purchase but the renewal payment is due about 45 days prior to that.  I apologize for any confusion this has caused.  If you have any further questions about this, please just let me know and I'll get right back to you.

The domain payment renews early to ensure that it renews before its expiration date.  If the payment were not to process successfully, it would allow you buffer time to update the payment details prior to the domain's expiration. The domain won't actually expire until the anniversary date of the purchase but the renewal payment is due about 45 days prior to that.


If you see a message that your domain is suspended, that means that you did not renew the domain at least 30 days before the expiration so we've notified our back end registrar that we wish to "suspend" our auto-renewal of the domain. Basically, we're not going to pay for the renewal until you confirm that you want to keep the domain by renewing with us. Your website is still online, you still have access to your account, there's nothing to panic about. I can assure you we're not trying to be sneaky or tricky or anything like that. That's just the notation in our billing system which indicates that we've suspended the auto-renewal on the back end.


Please keep in mind that if you're planning to transfer your domain to a new registrar, that transfer must be completed BEFORE the domain expires. According to the rules of ICANN (the international organization that oversees all domain registrations in the world), a domain cannot be transferred while it's expired and there is generally about a 3 month period after the domain expires before it is released to be re-registered.

I would not recommend letting your domain name expire in hopes of re-registering it somewhere else. There is generally about a 3-month waiting period (sometimes longer) after a domain expires before it becomes available again and there is no guarantee that someone else won't register the domain before you're able to get it back.

The best option is to either leave the domain where it is and simply update the DNS to point to the new website or transfer to a new registrar now, before the domain expires.

If you want to use more than one domain with your site you simply need to Publish the site to one of those domain names and then forward the other domain (or domains) to that one. 

If you bought the domain you want to forward from Weebly then this is extremely easy to do. Read our short guide:

http://hc.weebly.com/hc/en-us/articles/213488637-Use-More-Than-One-Domain-with-a-Weebly-Site

If you bought the domain through another registrar you'll just need to ask them how to forward one domain to another (or just ask them to forward the domain for you).

Weebly currently offers .com, .net, .co.uk, .ca, .nl, .de, .fr, .es, .us, .eu, .info, .co, .co.nz, .com.au and .org domains for sale.  However, you can purchase a domain with a different extension from another registrar and configure it for use with our service by following these instructions:

http://hc.weebly.com/hc/en-us/articles/201372693-How-to-Use-a-Domain-You-Purchased-Elsewhere

Keep in mind that using a domain name you purchased with another registrar requires a subscription to either our Starter or Pro service.

You can use a domain with accented or special characters, but you must first convert it into a format that is compatible with the internet domain name system.

You can do this yourself by entering your domain name at the following site:

http://www.charset.org/punycode.php

The resulting string of characters will look strange, but it will automatically translate to your original domain name.

If you have any questions, please let us know.

To publish additional sites to sub-domains of a domain you own, take a look at the instructions we provide here:

http://hc.weebly.com/hc/en-us/articles/201019517-Use-a-Free-Subdomain-as-the-Address-for-your-Site

macros.title: Editor::Forms::Are Webforms Secure With the Business Plan SSL?

value: I'm sorry, but only the shopping cart/checkout pages are SSL secure with our Business Plan.  Data submitted via the "contact form" element is not secure. Please be careful not to collect any sensitive personal or financial data in this manner.

macros.title: Dupe - Post Phone Call - Issue Resolved/Info Requested

value:
Hello,

Just wanted to reach out to say it was great speaking with you today and Iâm really glad we were able to take care of everything for you. If thereâs anything else we can help with, please reply directly to this email or give us a call back whenever you like.

Thanks so much for using Weebly!

If you're using the Starter, Pro, or Business version of the Weebly editor, you can add a 'Favicon' that will show up in the tab area of your browser.  To do so, simply follow the instructions here: 

[Add a Favicon](http://hc.weebly.com/hc/en-us/articles/204196423)

Favicons can be tricky because they're stored in a different part of the browser's cache than the rest of your site. Even when you refresh your browser, it may take a day or so for you to see changes to your favicon. Though it may show up right away if you refresh your browser several times in a row (as silly as that probably sounds).  

Anyone who hasn't visited your site recently will see the new favicon without issue.

If you haven't already, you'll need to confirm with Google AdSense that Weebly can access your account.  Please log into your AdSense account [here](https://www.google.com/adsense) and make sure there are no outstanding items to complete in order to fully set up the account.  

If you still experience a problem, locate your Google AdSense publisher ID and ensure that it matches the one Weebly has on file for you.  To see which AdSense account you have set up with Weebly, click on the 'Account Settings' button after logging in, and then click on 'External Accounts'.

When you first setup AdSense on your site, it can take up to four days for Google to become adjusted to the content of your site and begin serving ads.

Please note that if you are using the AdBlocker extension for Firefox or other ad-blocking software on your computer, you will need to disable these in order to see the ads on your site.

Unfortunately, we don't currently have the integrated functionality to create anchor links. However, you can create anchors in a custom HTML element if you know a bit of HTML. This [short guide to anchor links](http://hc.weebly.com/hc/en-us/articles/203905186) may help you out if you want to learn more about them.

To learn more about adding music and other audio to your site, please see the following article for a breakdown of exactly which file types are supported in Weebly:

http://hc.weebly.com/hc/en-us/articles/202049368-Upload-Music-to-Our-Audio-Player
Our audio player element supports the most common MP3 encoding rates; however, your file may be encoded at a different rate.  The rates we support are 44.1 kHz, or 22.05 kHz, or 11.025 kHz.

Our audio auto-play option causes the audio to play on a single page as soon as it's loaded, but it's impossible to have audio play continuously across all pages in our system. 

In order to have the same song play continuously across multiple pages of a site, that site must live in an iFrame (or be entirely made using Flash). We don't currently offer this as an integrated feature as it would have a very dramatic (and negative) impact on how the site functions. 

Beyond that, it is generally a bad idea to have music auto-play continuously throughout an entire website. Why? Because many of your site's visitors will be listening to music of their own, watching TV or movies in the background, or listening to other audio of some kind. Having music play on your site automatically will be a major annoyance for those visitors and more likely than not lead to them immediately leaving your site. This is one of several reasons most websites don't have music playing in the background.

Music in iTunes is in a format other than MP3 by default, but Weebly only supports MP3 files. So the songs you want to upload just have to be converted to MP3. This can be done in iTunes - Apple has a support page for it:

http://support.apple.com/kb/HT1550

You can embed video from YouTube (using our YouTube element) or other sites by using our Embed Code element. For help with either, please see:

http://hc.weebly.com/hc/en-us/articles/201552746-Embed-Video-from-YouTube-Vimeo-and-Others

To take advantage of the Youtube autoplay option, you must embed your Youtube videos using the 'Embed Code' element.  For help with this, please see:

http://hc.weebly.com/hc/en-us/articles/201552746-Embed-Video-from-YouTube-Vimeo-and-Others

Once you have embedded your custom video, you must modify the HTML code to include the option for auto-play (please see the before and after example below for details).

Example:


HTML CODE BEFORE ADDING AUTOPLAY:

    `<iframe width="420" height="315" src="[YouTube Video URL]" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen></iframe>`


HTML CODE AFTER ADDING AUTOPLAY:

    `<iframe width="420" height="315" src="[YouTube Video URL]?rel=0&autoplay=1" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen></iframe>`


Note the additional text added after the 'Youtube Video URL', which is what tells the video the play automatically. Please note that the above is **not** functional code and that your code may look different. This is simply an example.

If you have any questions, please let us know.

Our Video element allows you to upload an unlimited number of videos (each video can be up to 1GB in size) to your site.  Learn more about how to use this element here:

http://hc.weebly.com/hc/en-us/articles/202022398-Upload-HD-Videos

Note that the video player is part of our Pro service. If you don't have Pro, it's possible to embed videos from other hosts like Vimeo or YouTube by using our Embed Code Element:

http://hc.weebly.com/hc/en-us/articles/201740213

The best formats generally are MOV, WMV, M4V, MPG or MP4.  Any of those should work perfectly for you, so long as the file size is under 1 GB. To learn more about our video player, please see:

http://hc.weebly.com/hc/en-us/articles/202022398-Upload-HD-Videos

This problem is likely caused by one of two issues:

1 -- The file itself is too big. Currently no individual file uploaded to a Weebly site can be larger than 1GB in size. You can upload hundreds of videos that are 999MB or less each, but not videos that are even slightly larger than 1GB. 

2 -- The format of the video isn't supported. Though we support almost all video formats, if yours isn't working, it's worth exporting your file to MP4, M4V, MOV, WMV or OGG via whatever video editing program you happen to use. Any of these file types should always work. 

It's also possible that switching to another browser and re-uploading the video from there could fix the issue.  If the first two suggestions don't seem to be causing the issues, please give that a try.

Take a look at our troubleshooting guide to video upload problems here:

http://kb.weebly.com/video-troubleshoot.html

If you still run into any issues after trying these troubleshooting steps, please just let me know and I'll get right back to you.

Unfortunately, the HTML programming language does not recognize blank spaces, so it can be difficult to format your bibliography without using Custom HTML and CSS. The best option for your NHD site is to create the bibliography offline, and then save it as a PDF. You can then link to the PDF file. Linked PDFs open in a new tab in the browser as illustrated in the first part of this article:

http://hc.weebly.com/hc/en-us/articles/201273623-Upload-Documents-PDF-Powerpoint-Slides-and-More

The main reason you'd use a block quote is if you'd like to have a block of text stand out from the rest of the text both above and beneath it. This is usually done when quoting another person or source. 

We have a short guide to using the block quote element here. It's worth a quick read if you'd like to learn more:

http://hc.weebly.com/hc/en-us/articles/201019497-The-Block-Quote-Element

macros.title: Editor::CARBON - How to Use the Accordion

value:
The Accordion allows a website to contain a lot of content but keeps the design neat and clean by only showing small snippets of information at one time.

If a user wants more information each item can be expanded or stretched to reveal more content. Once theyâve read the additional information, they can then hide that content to allow them to easily browse through the rest of the page. You can choose from multiple styles such as standard, minimal, 3D, and boxed.

Once added to your page, just click on the Accordion element to begin editing it.

macros.title: Editor::I Don't Like the New Editor

value:
I'm truly sorry to hear you're not happy with the changes we've made, but unfortunately, it isn't possible to switch back to the old editor. Our new site creator is here to stay. 

We understand that no matter how many improvements we've made, such a big visual change to our service can be incredibly jarring. Especially if you were just hoping to pop in and make a few changes to your site without having to think too much about it. But other than the major visual changes, the editor continues to work in the exact same way:  

1. You still drag elements to the page to add content. The elements function in the same way they always have (except that a few of them now have some added features): you now drag them from the left instead of from the top. 

2. Some of the elements have new titles, but those titles still describe the same function. For example: "Paragraph" is now called "Text"; "Custom HTML" is now called "Embed Code". 

We have written a short guide to the new site creator that you can read here:

http://kb.weebly.com/site-creator.html

You may also find our Beginner's Guide to Weebly helpful in navigating the new editor: 

http://help.weebly.com/beginners-guide.html

If you have any specific questions about the new Editor, please just let me know and I'll get right back to you.

macros.title: Editor::CARBON - How to Use the Price Chart

value:
The Price Chart allows you to neatly display your different pricing plans to your potential customers.  With multiple layouts youâll be able to showcase your pricing in a well designed and effective manner. 

Once added to your page, just click on the FAQ element to begin customizing. You can add an unlimited number of plans, as well as features associated with those individual plans.  Every plan includes a sign-up button (that can be linked to a product or standard page) and that button can be placed either directly under the price or at the bottom of the list of features.  You can fully tailor the pricing table color scheme to match the design of your website.

macros.title: Editor::CARBON - How to use the FAQ Element

value:
A dedicated FAQ section helps address the basic needs of your users by allowing them to quickly and easily navigate through commonly asked questions to find a solution. If someone wants more information each item can be expanded or stretched to reveal more content. 

The FAQ comes with several customizable design features that will allow the it to blend in seamlessly with your website. Once added to your page, just click on the FAQ element to begin customizing.
While we currently only offer US Dollar, Euro, and British Pound symbols, we are working to expand the available currencies. Thank you for your patience!

macros.title: Editor::Blockquote Style Varies From Theme to Theme

value:
Each of our built-in themes has a unique blockquote style, ranging from very subtle to more elaborate.  If you don't like the style in your current theme, the only real option is to try out a different theme in the 'Design' tab to see how the blockquotes look there (though I realize that may not be particularly viable).  You can always switch back to your original theme if you don't like the changes.

Learn more about the 'Blockquote' element with our short guide:

http://hc.weebly.com/hc/en-us/articles/201019497-The-Block-Quote-Element

You can alter the settings for your blog's display, timezone, and comments via the 'Manage Blog' button found right at the top of the blog within the editor.  Take a look at [this short article](http://hc.weebly.com/hc/en-us/articles/201405136) to see how easy it is to make these changes.

You can delete an unpublished blog post by going to your Blog page in the editor. Next, click the "Drafts" button in the lower right corner. A pop-up window will show you all of your unpublished posts. Hover your mouse over this post and click the X to delete the post.

To delete a blog post that has already been published, click on the post within the editor. On the following screen, click the arrow in the upper right corner for the option to delete this post. Please note, this will immediately remove the post from your site.

Removing a category from the list of categories on your blog sidebar is a matter of editing each blog post that references the category, and un-checking the box next to the category name in the editable list that appears alongside each post when you edit it. 

To see which of your posts include the category you want to remove, go to your live blog and click on the name of the category. Every post that includes this category will appear. You can then use the editor to edit the posts, un-check the appropriate box, save each post, and then publish the site to finish.

An RSS feed element is automatically added to the sidebar of any blog you create.ââThis feed allows blog visitors to receive automatic updates about your blog in their favorite feed reader. There are dozens and dozens of such readers available for Windows, Mac OS, iPhones, iPads, Android devices, etc. 
ââ
It's also possible to offer visitors an option to sign-up for updates to your blog via email. This can be done for free through a Google service called Feedburner. Read our instructions below to learn how to set it up, but please note that this is not a Weebly service and not something we can directly support. It should work perfectly with your site though.
ââ
http://hc.weebly.com/hc/en-us/articles/204278816

Unfortunately, there isn't a way to import blog posts from another system into Weebly.  The best option currently would be to link to the old blog as an "archive" from the sidebar of the new blog.  You can do this by dragging a 'Paragraph' element to the sidebar and creating a link.  For assistance creating links, please see our detailed guide:

http://hc.weebly.com/hc/en-us/articles/201018148-Create-Links

I apologize that this current functionality is not available in Weebly at this time.

A page's address is based on the name of that page.  So if you name a page "blog", the link to that page will be http://www.youraddresshere.com/blog.html.  If you name a page Contact Us, then the link will be http://www.youraddresshere.com/contact-us.html.  Every space between words in the name is replaced with a "-" in the link, and uppercase letters are converted to lowercase.

macros.title: Editor::Blog::Links in Other Languages (Translate Blog Links)

value: When you click on one of the 'Language Flags' in the Weebly editor, it changes the language of the Weebly editor, but it has no effect on your live site. Unfortunately, at this time, there are some built-in buttons and links, especially on blog and store pages, that can't be renamed or displayed in a different language. I truly apologize for the inconvenience.

Weebly very recently updated the way we format our blog links. In the past the links for our blog posts were ungainly and, honestly, a little ugly. See an example from our own blog:

http://blog.weebly.com/2/post/2014/04/start-your-something.html

Notice the "2" and the "2014" and the "04" in there. It's messy. Our new formatting removes all that excess, providing cleaner blog post URLs that look much more like the URLs we use for our standard pages. Here's the same post shown above in the new style:

http://blog.weebly.com/post/start-your-something

Your own blog post links have been cleaned up in this same way.

Does this mean the old links will no longer work? Not at all. All of your older post links automatically redirect to the new version of that same post. To see this in action, click on the http://blog.weebly.com/2/post/2014/04/start-your-something.html link. Notice how it leads directly to the http://blog.weebly.com/post/start-your-something page? 
Any old links from your blog will forward to the new URLs in the same way.

Hope this info helps!

Each blog post has access to a 'Read More' element. You can drag this element between two other elements. When you publish your post, everything above that 'Read More' element will display on the main page of the blog, and everything below will only display if the visitor clicks the 'Read More' link (or the post's title) to read the entire post. 

If you want to split up your post in this way, you will need to put your content in at least two elements. If you write a really long essay, then the first part of the essay should be in its own 'Paragraph' element, and the second part of the essay should be in another 'Paragraph' element. That way you can drag the 'Read More' element between the two of them.

For more information about this, please see:

http://kb.weebly.com/read-more.html

When replying to comments on your blog posts, you must do so from your live website, not from within the Weebly editor. The links are not active in the editor, so you won't be able to reply there.

If you want your comment to show that you are an administrator for the site, you should first log in to your Weebly account, and then go to your published blog to make a comment.  Your comment as an admin will be highlighted and set apart from the other commenters.

If you have any questions about this, please let me know and I'll get right back to you.

An RSS feed element is automatically added to the sidebar of a blog.  RSS allows your blog visitors to easily see updates to your blog in their favorite feed reader.

Learn a bit more about RSS here:

http://hc.weebly.com/hc/en-us/articles/201913808-What-is-an-RSS-Feed-

And about creating a blog here:

http://hc.weebly.com/hc/en-us/articles/202015808-Start-a-Blog

You can create a blog under the 'Pages' tab.  Visit the Blog section of our help site to get step-by-step instructions that show how to get started: 

[Creating a blog](http://hc.weebly.com/hc/en-us/articles/202015808-Start-a-Blog)

Tagging a blog post creates a category in the sidebar of your published site.  A visitor can click on a category to view all blog posts that have been tagged with that category.  It's not necessary to tag posts, but it can be a useful way to allow visitors to your site to find and read older posts about specific topics.  

For a full rundown of how to best use the tags / categories, please see:

http://hc.weebly.com/hc/en-us/articles/201405086-Create-a-Blog-Post

Weebly currently has an iPhone and Android app that can be downloaded directly from the iTunes and Google Play Stores.  Please note that the existing apps can be used on tablets, but were not specifically designed to take advantage of the extra screen real estate on an iPad/Android tablet.  

Download the iPhone app here:

http://itunes.apple.com/us/app/weebly/id511158309?mt=8 


Download the Android app here: 

https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.weebly.android

We are big mobile fans and the existence of only an iPhone and Android app is not due to us not caring or not being aware of the existence of these products.  It's just that creating a blog post or editing an entire site requires a lot of moving parts so we're having to think through how we want to approach mobile editing on this larger screened platform.  

Note that our websites, our video player and slideshows are HTML based and work just fine on our published sites with all iOS, Android, Windows and BlackBerry devices.  It's only editing itself that is limited to the iPhone and Android apps.

macros.title: Editor::Burn CD / Save Site to Flash Drive / Offline Viewing

value:
You can download your site as a .zip archive under the 'Settings' tab in the 'Archive/Un-publish' area.  Once you've downloaded the zip file, unzip it onto your hard drive and burn the files to a CD or save to a flash drive. Your homepage is named index.html.

Please note that blogs, forms, and some other features may not work when viewed offline.

If you have any further questions about this, please just let me know and I'll get right back to you.

If you use a built-in 'Forum' element, you are restricted to one forum per account because you're automatically assigned an account user ID.

However, if you go to either Tal.ki or Nabble.com you can generate as many different forums as you want, and then embed them on your Weebly site using the 'Embed Code' element.

For assistance with the 'Embed Code' element, please see:

http://hc.weebly.com/hc/en-us/articles/201740213

The 'Editors' tab enables you to invite any number of other people to help you edit an individual site.  For more information about this, please see:

http://hc.weebly.com/hc/en-us/articles/201696487-Invite-Other-People-to-Help-Edit-a-Site

If your editors aren't receiving their invites, this means those invites are going to a junk/spam folder or bouncing back to us. That being the case, go to the 'Editors' tab and look to the right of the invitee's email address. There, you'll see the word "Invitation" underlined as a link. Click that and you'll see the link to the page they need to visit to accept the invitation -- you can email them this link from your personal address to help ensure they receive it.

You can copy a site by using the copy option found under the 'More' button to the right of the site's listing on your main 'Account' page.  Read these short, step-by-step instructions to learn more:

http://hc.weebly.com/hc/en-us/articles/201505746-Can-I-Copy-a-Site-

Unfortunately, there is not a way to change the background color of individual elements.  The only backgrounds that can be changed are the backgrounds for the entire body and content areas of the site.  It's impossible, at least currently, to get more specific than that.  I'm sorry that's not a feature we offer yet!

For advanced users it is possible to change the background image or color of the entire page by modifying the CSS and HTML of the design template. Please review the linked guide below for specific instructions:

 [http://kb.weebly.com/background-color.html](http://kb.weebly.com/background-color.html)

Unfortunately, we're not able to provide case by case solutions for custom HTML problems and questions, due to the wide range of uses and associated problems.  There are just too many variables for our team to be able to provide hands-on guidance. Altering the CSS of a theme should be done with the understanding that you should know HTML / CSS thoroughly, and be confident in your ability  to make changes.  

You should also check out our guide to making basic changes to the HTML / CSS of a Weebly theme:

http://kb.weebly.com/html-css.html

And, if you need more information, be sure to visit the W3C Schools Website to read some great free tutorials on how to work with HTML and CSS:

http://www.w3schools.com/

For assistance using the Embed Code element, please see: 

[Using the Embed Code Element](http://hc.weebly.com/hc/en-us/articles/201740213-Create-Widgets-Embed-Code-and-Add-External-Content)

If you're comfortable editing code, you can modify the HTML & CSS of your theme using the "Edit HTML / CSS" option under the "Design" tab of the editor. Please note that we don't provide in-depth assistance with theme customizations, but there are a wide variety of instructional websites where you can learn more about working with HTML and CSS.

For information on how to make basic alterations to a theme, click on the "DOCS" button while in the code editor.

HTML validation errors like the ones you've described here are unavoidable unless you hand write the HTML and CSS for your entire site. Even extremely successful and popular sites like amazon.com generate hundreds upon hundreds of validation errors if you check them. 

A What-You-See-is-What-You-Get editor like ours (or dreamweaver or Squarespace or any other such system) cannot be expected to churn out perfect code.  Validation errors do not mean there is anything wrong with your site. They quite simply mean your code isn't absolutely perfect. Your site will function normally for your visitors and show up as expected in search engine results.

You can add a lot of different kinds of custom features and content to your site via our 'Embed Code' element. This allows you to embed items to your site just by dragging the element down and pasting the code in.

For assistance using the 'Embed Code' element, please see: 

[Using the Embed Code Element](http://hc.weebly.com/hc/en-us/articles/201740213)

How do you know if a widget or app is embeddable? The best way is to just ask the provider or search their FAQs to see. There's no reason it won't work so long as they can give you embeddable code for your site.

I'm very sorry for the issues you've been experiencing.  It looks like this problem is being caused by the javascript in your MailChimp form.  It isn't sandboxed (as most JQuery widgets are and should be) so it is interfering with our javascript.  You just need to turn the javascript off and re-create the form.  

The option to turn this off is explained at the top of this tutorial:

http://hc.weebly.com/hc/en-us/articles/201740203-Create-a-Newsletter-Sign-up-or-Autoresponder-Form

Add the new opt-in form code, Publish the site, and you'll be all set.

If you continue to run into any issues, please just let me know and I'll get right back to you.

You can edit your site with HTML, CSS, and Javascript; however, Weebly does not support building your site with server side languages, such as PHP or ASP. We also do not currently offer database access, and these options are not likely to become available in the near future.  Very sorry for that!

To delete an element, simply click within that element to "activate" it. You should see an 'x' on the upper right corner. Click this and then confirm that you want to delete the element.  If you run into any issues with this, please just let me know and I'll get right back to you.

Currently, the only way to delete a file is to delete the element used when it was first uploaded. Let's say you created a link from a picture and then uploaded a file when creating that link -- you could only delete the file by deleting the image element and replacing it with a different element. 

This obviously involves a fair amount of work if you have several files to delete. It also requires that you remember the element you originally used to upload the file, which may be long since forgotten. So if you know the specific names of any files you'd like deleted, please just reply to this email with the list, and I will delete the files for you from our end.

macros.title: Editor::Designs/Design Options::Can I Upload My Own Font?

value:
While you can install any font you want on your computer, fonts on the web don't work in quite the same way. You can't simply install any font you want to a website and be confident that all visitors to your site will be able to see it. 

Generally speaking it's best (and easiest) to select from the list of fonts found under Design > Design Options. There are a fairly wide range of styles there. 

If you're knowledgeable in CSS you can also assign Google Web Fonts to your site via Design > Edit HTML / CSS. 

http://www.google.com/webfonts/ 

Both our provided fonts and Google's fonts can be seen by any visitor to your site thanks to the way they're designed to work. But a font you've simply downloaded to your computer is not going to be supported in this way and is likely to only be visible to visitors who have also installed it to their own computer. That ultimately defeats the purpose of using the font.  If you have any further questions about this, please just let me know and I'll get right back to you.

macros.title: Editor::Designs/Design Options::Can I Upload My Own Custom Theme

value:
You may be able to use an outside web template by clicking the Design tab, then the "Change theme" button. On the following screen, click the "Import Theme" button.  Please note that templates or themes uploaded into Weebly must meet some basic specifications (as you'll see under the 'Documentation' tab of the 'Edit HTML/CSS' area).  

You will most likely have to modify any theme you use so that it meets these criteria, unless that theme has been specifically designed for use with Weebly.  At this time,  we are unable to provide in-depth support for the use of custom themes or scripts.  There are simply too many variables involved for our small team to be able to provide assistance on a case-by-case basis.

Alternatively, you can directly modify the HTML & CSS of a standard Weebly template using the "Edit HTML / CSS " option under the "Designs" tab of the editor.  However, this feature should be used only if you're experienced with HTML & CSS code as we do not provide support for problems that may occur while using this area of the editor.  We appreciate your patience as we continue to develop Weebly.

Though you can make a lot of changes to your site and theme using our editing tools, the background color / image on some templates can only be changed through the CSS of the theme. We've written a guide to making these changes here:  

http://kb.weebly.com/background-color.html

Note that some experience with HTML / CSS is helpful in making these changes and that altering the background is not something our help desk can directly support. But the changes made in the CSS are fairly simple ones and if you follow along with the guide you'll be on your way. You can also easily switch back to your original, standard theme via the Design tab if you don't like the changes you make in the CSS.

If you'd like to skip the coding and select a template that has built-in support for custom background images, click on the Designs tab and select "Change Theme" then check the box for "Supports backgrounds". This will sort so that the designs that support background images are at the top.

To change the site title, paragraph title, paragraph text, and other fonts for your site, click on the 'Design' tab and then click "Change Fonts". In this area you'll see an area to configure font type, color, size and line height for your site.

You can modify the width of the content area by clicking 'Edit HTML/CSS' on the 'Design' tab. You should only attempt this if you're familiar with HTML & CSS because we're able to provide very limited support for design customizations. Most of the design templates have several different divs that need to be adjusted in order to widen the template.
  
Keep in mind that these themes are set up to display beautifully on monitors of all sizes. If you increase the width of the theme, users with smaller monitors will have to scroll to see the full width of the site.

macros.title: Editor::Designs/Design Options::Custom Headers Don't Transfer Between Themes

value: Every theme has a slightly different design for the header image area so we don't transfer header images between themes. I know this can be frustrating since you have to recreate your custom header images, but if we transferred them over there's a very strong chance they'd look awful and you'd have to recreate them anyway.

The fonts that Weebly offers are designed to work regardless of whether someone has them installed on their computer or not -- as a result they're different from standard fonts and can occasionally be weird on certain themes or in certain browsers. Our developers are looking into the problem with this particular font,but for now the only real option is to select a different one. Sorry for that.

macros.title: Editor::Designs/Design Options::Choose A Recently Used Theme

value:
You can view (and reselect) your ten most recently used themes using an option found under the 'Design' tab of your account. This should enable you to find the theme you were previously using and connect it to your site again. Read our guide on switching themes here:

http://hc.weebly.com/hc/en-us/articles/201696407-Switch-and-Manage-Themes

Would you mind replying with a screen shot of the problem attached to your email?  If you aren't sure how to take a screenshot on your computer or device, please refer to the following page for simple instructions covering a variety of platforms:

http://take-a-screenshot.org/

macros.title: Editor::Designs/Design Options::CARBON - Whyâd you remove older themes?

value:
We are now displaying our most current themes in the editor. These responsive themes have all been redesigned to work seamlessly across desktops and mobile devices.

You can still access any themes you had recently used by selecting the recently used themes option under the Design tab. Read our guide on switching themes here:

http://hc.weebly.com/hc/en-us/articles/201696407-Switch-and-Manage-Themes

The Landing Page layout that you're using always includes a button in the header area. This is not something that can be removed in the editor, however, if you do not use this button it will not appear on the published site. If you have used this button or it is appearing on the published site, there are two simple options to make it go away:


1. Change the Text in the button to read: **Button Text** then also remove the button link, and republish your site. This should hide the button on the live site.


OR


2. Switch to another type of Page Layout via the Pages tab or the gear icon next to the header image. Each of Weebly's design templates includes multiple page layouts to choose from.


Alternately, you can go into the HTML / CSS of the theme (found under Design > HTML / CSS)  and remove the button from the HTML. This requires knowledge of HTML though and should only be done by advanced users.


Currently there are no other options for removing the button from the header area of a Landing Page layout. Very sorry for that!

The themes in your account are global, so changes made to a theme are applied to any site that is using that theme, regardless of which site you're working on when you make the changes.  This is true even when a theme is copied along with a second site. 

To get around this, you would need to create a second version of the theme with a new name. To do so, export the theme (using the link in the lower left corner of the 'Edit HTML/CSS' area), and then rename the zip file that you download. 

Then you can go to the 'Design' tab, select 'Change Themes', and then click on 'My Custom Themes'. From there, you can import your renamed zip file, and then apply the theme to whatever site you want and make changes to it without it affecting the other sites.

I'm very sorry to hear you didn't receive the email! Unfortunately we can't guarantee automated emails like these are going to be delivered to every email address. Some of them get sent to the junk/spam folder by your email provider and some of them are blocked for one reason or another. I know it can be frustrating, but that's simply the nature of email. 

The good news is that it's not necessary to get the email in order to download the .zip file as we also include your last three download links in the Settings > Archive section of the editor. If you go to Settings > Archive now, you'll find a link to download your zip file. This download link is added under settings usually around five minutes after you click the link to generate the zip.  If you run into any issues with this, please just let me know and I'll get right back to you.

You can export your website using the 'Archive' option under the 'Settings' tab of the editor.  Please keep in mind that Store pages and Blog pages will not be exported as they rely directly on our database. Some of our elements also may not work correctly when hosted elsewhere, like our 'Contact Form' and 'Slideshow' elements.  If possible, you should try to keep your website hosted on Weebly in order to easily update it.

For more information about this, please see:

http://hc.weebly.com/hc/en-us/articles/215827367-Back-Up-Your-Site-zip-

The zip archive cannot currently be used to restore a site back to Weebly, so it is only useful as a personal backup.

Favicons can be tricky because they're stored in a different part of the browser's cache than the rest of your site. Even when you refresh your browser, it may take a day or so for you to see changes to your favicon. Though it may show up right away if you refresh your browser several times in a row (as silly as that probably sounds).  

Anyone who hasn't visited your site recently will see the new favicon without issue.

Learn more about how favicons work by following this short guide: 

http://hc.weebly.com/hc/en-us/articles/204196423

I apologize, but this is not really a Weebly issue as much as the way that some browsers stack Flash and Javascript.  Even when it's coded properly to show the Javascript on top, some browsers insist on putting the Flash (the video) on top. The good news is, you can easily fix this by adding wmode="transparent" to the embed code for the video or other Flash content. 

For more information about this, please see Adobe's comments here:

http://kb2.adobe.com/cps/155/tn_15523.html
Currently, free Weebly sites have a limit of 5 pages, Starter sites have a limit of 10 pages while Pro and Business sites have unlimited pages. Sorry for any confusion.

I apologize for the confusion.  That particular message stays in place under Forms > Form Entries until you receive your first form submission. So if you were to submit a test entry through your form right now you would immediately be able to see that test entry on the Form Entries page and would no longer see the "no form" message that you're currently seeing. Give that a go and you should be all set!

That bounce message means your address is bouncing the form email back to the senders as undeliverable.  Unfortunately, this is not something we can directly fix or control.  Email delivery can get tricky for these kinds of messages occasionally.  Two options:

1 (and easiest): Switch the form email address to a different one and test that.  You can see how to do that here:

http://hc.weebly.com/hc/en-us/articles/202015838

2: You can reach out to whoever handles IT for that email address and ask what info they need from us to whitelist your form emails.  Then we can provide whatever info they request.  This would allow the emails to get through.

macros.title: Editor::Forms::Change the Language on Contact Form Fields

value:
If you want to change the default titles on your form fields, click on the field you want to change and then enter your new title instead. It's not possible to change the sub-labels on the "name" and "address" fields but you can remove those fields and replace with a short text box which can be labeled whatever you want.

For more info on how the contact / survey form works, please see this area of our support center:

http://hc.weebly.com/hc/en-us/articles/212044867-Create-a-Survey-Poll-RSVP-or-Contact-Form

actions.value: I wanted to let you know that our developers are aware of this issue and are working to get it resolved for you. Thank you for your patience.

value:
To change the email address assigned to your 'Contact Form' or add an additional email address to the form, please: 

- Click on the form from within the Weebly editor.

- Then click the "Form Options" button. 

- You should see an "email submissions to:" field appear in the blue toolbar that will appear at the top of the screen. 

- Use this field to remove and replace the email address or to add an additional address.  If you want to connect multiple addresses to your contact form, just separate the addresses with commas. 

For more information about this topic, please see:
http://hc.weebly.com/hc/en-us/articles/201505766-How-Can-I-Change-My-Contact-Form-Email-Address-

I apologize for the issues you've been experiencing with the contact form.  Your form appears to be set up correctly. If you don't see the messages in your Inbox, please check your Spam/Junk folders in case the messages are being routed there.  You can also use the 'Form Data' option found under the More button to right of your site listing on your home page to access all the messages that have been submitted through the form.  

Delivering form emails to the inbox can be tricky and there are some situations where the emails may be blocked. If you cannot find the messages in your Inbox or your Spam folders, and you believe the messages really aren't coming through, you may be able to use a different e-mail address with the form and have better results.

You can also associate two email addresses with your contact form temporarily by separating them with commas. To change the email address assigned to your contact form or add an additional email address to receive the form, click on the form from within the Weebly editor and then click the "Form Options" button. You should see an "email submissions to:" field appear on the toolbar where you can remove and replace the email address or add an additional address. Be sure to republish and then test your form!

For more information about this, please see:

http://hc.weebly.com/hc/en-us/articles/202015838-I-m-Not-Receiving-My-Contact-Form-Submissions-Why-Not-

For details on how the contact / survey form works, please see this area of our support center:

http://hc.weebly.com/hc/en-us/articles/212044867-Create-a-Survey-Poll-RSVP-or-Contact-Form

actions.value:
Can you try to clear your cache, close your browser, re-open it and then access Weebly?  If you're not sure how to clear your cache, take a look here:

http://www.wikihow.com/Clear-Your-Browser's-Cache

value:
To delete Contact Form entries, visit the page in your editor where the Contact Form has been placed.

Click on the form to make it active and you should see an option to 'View Entries'.

Click on 'View Entries', and a screen will pop up with all of your form submissions.  You will see a red x to the left side of each of the submissions.  

Click on the x next to the submission you want to delete and you will see a prompt asking "Are you sure you want to delete this submission?"  

Click OK and the submission will be removed for you.

macros.title: Editor::Forms::Export Contact Form Submissions to CSV

value:
To export your form entries as a .CSV file please follow these steps:   

1. Log into your Weebly account and select the 'More' button to the right of your site's 'Edit' button.    

2. Then select 'Form Entries' from the drop-down menu.   

3. On the next page, select the form you would like to view from the drop down menu and click on the 'Export Data' link on the right side of your screen.  

4. Lastly, you will be prompted to download the form entries as a .CSV file. Download the file to the selected location on your computer and you are all set.

If you run into any problem with this, please just reply to this email and I will get right back to you.

Pro and Business users have access to a file upload field which can be added to a contact form.  Your site visitors can use this field to send you documents and other files (up to 20MB each).  For details on how the contact form works, please see this area of our support center:

http://hc.weebly.com/hc/en-us/articles/212044867-Create-a-Survey-Poll-RSVP-or-Contact-Form

macros.title: Editor::Forms::No Captcha on Contact Forms / Spam Submissions

value:
Spammers target contact forms as an easy place to spout their nonsense. While we do have defenses to help stop this, some do still manage to get through.  If you give it time any wave of spam entries is likely to pass as we fight them off. 

At this time, it's not possible to add a Captcha verification to your Weebly form but the forms do have advanced security measures built in to avoid automated submission and we're constantly tightening up our own security to stop as much spam as possible. There is no way to prevent a malicious user from submitting spam but you should not have a problem with robots submitting your form. I truly apologize for the trouble and annoyance caused by any spam submissions that do slip through.

To add a forum to your site, drag the 'Tal.ki Forum' element to a page.  This element is available under the 'More' category of elements.

For more details on how to get started with the forum, please see:

http://hc.weebly.com/hc/en-us/articles/210899627-Create-a-Forum

If you don't want to use our Tal.ki forum option, you are more than welcome to use a different forum like nabble.com with your site.  Any embeddable forum will work, and you can add such forums using our 'Embed Code' element.  For assistance with the 'Embed Code' element, please see: 

http://hc.weebly.com/hc/en-us/articles/201740213-Create-Widgets-Embed-Code-and-Add-External-Content

If you need help getting started with our service, a great resource is our 'Beginner's Guide to Weebly' which can be found here:

http://hc.weebly.com/hc/en-us/sections/200354313-Beginner-s-Guide-to-Weebly

We also host several free live training sessions every week to walk customers through the ins-and-outs of building a Weebly website.  We encourage you to register to attend any of those sessions here:

http://hc.weebly.com/hc/en-us/sections/200362446-Live-Training-Webcasts

Unfortunately, Weebly sites don't have a built-in guestbook feature,  If you want to have a guestbook, the best approach is to create a blog and use the comments section of a single post as a place where visitors can leave messages that other visitors to the site can read.  

Learn how to set up a blog here:

http://hc.weebly.com/hc/en-us/articles/202015808-Start-a-Blog

macros.title: Editor::Headers and Layouts::Create Custom Header Images

value:
You can replace any of our default header images with your own images.  For step-by-step instructions on exactly how to upload your own header image and re-size it to fit properly, please see:

[Editing a Header Image](http://hc.weebly.com/hc/en-us/articles/201505676)

You can assign different header images to different pages of your site.  Just use the arrow to the right of the orange 'Save' button when going to save the header.  This will provide you with a number of options as to which pages you'd like to save the header image.  For more information about this, please see:

http://hc.weebly.com/hc/en-us/articles/201505676-Edit-the-Header

When using one of our themes that supports background images, you can assign different images to different pages of your site.  Just use the arrow to the right of the green 'Save' button when going to save the background image.  This will provide you with a number of options as to which pages you'd like to save the background image

Each page on your site can be assigned one of four different page layouts (some templates may include more layouts).  These layouts are:
  
1. Tall Header: This is the default layout and includes space for a tall header / banner image. 
  
2. Short Header: This includes space for a short header / banner image. 
  
3. No Header: The page layout includes no header area at all. 
  
4. Landing: This layout has space for an image, message, and a button linking to another page from within the header area. 
  
To read more about the different page layouts and how to use them, please take a look at our short guide:
  
http://hc.weebly.com/hc/en-us/articles/205639018?
  
You can freely switch between different layouts, so if you don't like the way one works with a page you can simply choose another without losing any of your content.

Pro and Business users have the option to create slideshows in the headers of their pages. These slideshows function in much the same way as our standard slideshows, excepting, of course, that they've been designed to work specifically with the Header of the site.  

Please note that some of our themes use background images for the header / banner area of of the site instead of using the standard headers that most of our other themes use. This makes it impossible to use the Header Slideshow option. You can tell if you're currently using one of these themes by clicking to edit the header image. If it shows you an option to select or upload a background image, then you will not be able to use a slideshow in the header area.

The only real option to use Header Slideshows is to switch to a theme that supports this feature. Many of our themes **do** support this feature, so it's fairly easy to find one. What you will look for is a Theme that has a "contained" header area, rather than a screen-wide one.

You can learn how to switch themes here:

https://weebly.zendesk.com/hc/en-us/articles/201696407-How-to-Switch-Themes

We're not currently seeing any problems with image and file uploads, and can't recreate this issue in your account.  There could be a number of causes for the problem you're seeing.  The best way to resolve this is to take a look at our troubleshooting guide:

[Troubleshooting Failed Uploads](http://hc.weebly.com/hc/en-us/articles/201505796-I-Can-t-Upload-Images-or-Files-)

This short guide walks through the most common causes (and solutions) for when image and file uploads aren't working.

If you continue to experience any issues after trying those options, please just let me know and I'll get right back to you.

Our editor doesn't currently support animated gifs in the Header / Logo areas. So any animated gifs you upload to these places will cease to be animated and just become plain old boring gifs. 

You can place animated gifs in the HTML / CSS for the Logo or the Header area but this takes a strong knowledge of CSS and is not for everyone.

However, please note that you can certainly upload animated gifs to picture elements in the content area of the site. Just drag a picture element to the page and upload away!

macros.title: Editor::Images::Can't Enable Lightbox / Link to Full-Size

value: Once an image has been edited, the option to link it to a larger image (Lightbox) no longer appears. The only way around this is to delete this element, then re-upload the photo. Once you have added these photos, the first thing you should do is link them to a larger version.  I apologize for the inconvenience.

This problem can usually be fixed by changing the Color Space used for the image in Photoshop. The sRGB Color Space is pretty much the standard for web images. Can you please switch the Color Space you're using to sRGB, then Save and upload the picture again?  

If you're interested in reading more about color space, here are a few links to sites that discuss this more in-depth:

http://om4.com.au/client/preparing-images-color-profiles-srgb-adobe-rgb/

http://graphicdesign.stackexchange.com/questions/18577/whats-the-difference-between-monitor-rgb-and-srgb

http://petapixel.com/2009/09/17/why-you-should-probably-use-srgb/

To upload a picture to your site, you'll first need to add one of the picture elements to your page, then click on the 'Upload Image' box to upload or select a picture to add. Our short guide walks through the entire process:

http://hc.weebly.com/hc/en-us/articles/201505636-Adding-Pictures-to-a-Site

To do this, you would need to create an Image Map.  While you can't generate an Image Map from within your Weebly account, you can create one outside of Weebly then add it to your page via an Embed Code element.

For more information on Image Maps, please see:

http://www.w3schools.com/tags/tag_map.asp

For assistance with the Embed Code element, please see: 

http://hc.weebly.com/hc/en-us/articles/201740213-Create-Widgets-Embed-Code-and-Add-External-Content

It can be virtually impossible to fully protect any image on the Internet. Unfortunately, if someone wants it, they will find a way to access it.  Pro users have the option to use password protected pages which offer the best form of protection.

To disable right clicking on your pages in some browsers (in order to prevent people from easily copying your text and pictures) paste the following into the "Footer Code" (NOT "footer message") box under the 'Settings' tab in the 'Search Engine Optimization (SEO)' area of the editor.  

    <body oncontextmenu="return false;">

This will be active once your site is published. Again, it will not offer full protection but it may slow some efforts down a bit.

Rather than protect images in this way, some photographers and others with online images choose to use graphics programs to add a watermark or stamp onto the online version of their photos. Although it does not prevent the photo from being stolen, it does protect from use of the photo in most cases since the watermark renders the photo useless.
The best approach for uploaded photos are to use JPEGs that are 72 DPI and no more than 1000 pixels on their longest side.

These images are probably in CMYK color mode.  CMYK images often display incorrectly in certain browsers.  If these images are currently CMYK, I would recommend converting them to RGB before adding them back to your site.  This can be done in an image editing program such as Photoshop.

To link to the full-size version of an image you've uploaded, just click on the image and toggle the 'Lightbox' switch to 'On'. 

Note that once an image has been edited, the option to link it to a larger image no longer appears, so you should always link to the larger version before doing any edits to the image.

For more information on working with images, please see our guide here:

http://hc.weebly.com/hc/en-us/articles/201505636-Adding-Pictures-to-a-Site

macros.title: Editor::Images::Offensive Images in free Image Database (Teacher)

value:
I'm very sorry for that! We actually don't have any control over that image database. It's a collection of images that various photographers have submitted to be used under creative commons licensing. The same database is used by numerous website builders and other internet services. We can report an inappropriate image to the database administrators, but unfortunately, we don't have the power to remove an image ourselves.

Since you're using Weebly for Education, you do have the option to disable the image search completely under your 'Class Settings'.

If you're creating a gallery, slideshow, or product you'll need to orient the pictures before uploading them to Weebly. Sometimes, you can change the orientation of the picture preview on your computer without actually modifying the original file. That's why the picture appears correct on your computer but sideways once you upload. 

To correct this, open the image in whatever photo-editing software you use, rotate the image to the correct orientation, and then save the file. When you upload the new file to Weebly, the photo should appear correctly.

Please note that if you upload the image specifically using our 'Image' Element, you can click the 'Edit' button in the upper right of the image to access our rotate (and other editing) tools.

macros.title: Editor::Designs/Design Options::Can I Upload My Own Theme

value:
You may be able to use an outside web template, but please note that templates or themes uploaded into Weebly must meet some basic specifications (as you'll see under the 'Documentation' tab of the 'Edit HTML/CSS' area).  

You will most likely have to modify any theme you use so that it meets these criteria, unless that theme has been specifically designed for use with Weebly.  At this time,  we are unable to provide in-depth support for the use of custom themes or scripts.  There are simply too many variables involved for our small team to be able to provide assistance on a case-by-case basis.

Alternatively, you can directly modify the HTML & CSS of a standard Weebly template using the "Edit HTML / CSS " option under the "Designs" tab of the editor.  However, this feature should be used only if you're experienced with HTML & CSS code as we do not provide support for problems that may occur while using this area of the editor.  We appreciate your patience as we continue to develop Weebly.

macros.title: Editor::Images::Size and Crop Images in Galleries and Slideshows

value:
If you're creating a gallery or slideshow, you'll need to size and crop the pictures before uploading them to Weebly.

To do this, please open the image in whatever photo-editing software you use, ensure that the crop and sizing are correct, and then save the file. Upload the new file to Weebly and the photo should appear correctly.  If you're using a Mac, open the image in iPhoto (or a similar program), size and crop the image and export it.  

Please note that if you upload the image specifically using our 'Image' Element, you can click the 'Edit' button in the upper right of the image to access our editing tools.  Unfortunately these features are not currently available within our gallery and slideshow elements. Very sorry for that!

The size of the slideshow is based on the aspect ratio of your images.  You must upload images in either a 4:3, 3:2 or 16:9 format to ensure there is no excess whitespace in the slideshow.  You can adjust this a bit by going to the 'Advanced' section of the slideshow editor (this is available on the blue toolbar that pops up when you click on the slideshow).  If you have any further questions about this, please just let me know and I'll get right back to you.

We provide two different options for organizing and displaying multiple images: slideshows and galleries. 

To learn all about these features, read our guide here:

http://hc.weebly.com/hc/en-us/articles/201273653-Upload-Multiple-Images-w-Slideshows-and-Galleries

macros.title: Editor::iOS App - What Can I Do With The App on My iPhone / iPad / Apple Watch?

value:
Our iOS apps are a great complementary experience to the Weebly web builder. You can now do more than ever right from your phone or tablet, including:


- Create and edit a complete website from your iPhone or iPad

- Monitor all of your site activity and get detailed stats on blog comments, site traffic, store orders, form entries, and more.

- Build and manage your online store


Another great feature is the ability to work offline and sync work across all devices so you can pick up where you left off on desktop or another device.

You can even use an Apple Watch to monitor site and store activity as well as get notifications when someone places an order or leaves a blog comment.

macros.title: Editor::iOS App - Leave a review (iPhone / iPad / Apple Watch)

value: If you're enjoying the Weebly App, please take a few minutes to leave us a review. Once you've pulled up the Weebly app in iTunes, just click the "Ratings and Reviews button" then click the "Write a Review" button.

macros.title: Editor::Android App - What Can I Do With The App on My Phone / Android device?

value:
Our Android app is a great complementary experience to the Weebly web builder. You can now do more than ever right from your phone or tablet, including:


- Create and edit a complete website from your phone or tablet

- Monitor all of your site activity and get detailed stats on blog comments, site traffic, store orders, form entries, and more

- Build and manage your online store

You can download our app here:

https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.weebly.android

If you're enjoying the Weebly App, please take a few minutes to leave us a review. Just visit:

https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.weebly.android&hl=en

Once there, click the Write a Review button. If you are not already logged in to Google + you will be prompted to sign up.

The 'Button' element enables you to create call-to-action buttons that link to other pages on your own site, pages on other sites, or files such as PDFs and documents.  

Please note that the button can say anything you want it to say.  Your button could say "Click Me" or "Buy Some of My Cupcakes" or anything else along those lines.  

To learn more about how to use the 'Button' element, please see:

http://hc.weebly.com/hc/en-us/articles/201018148-Create-Links

I just took a look at your account, and it appears you've set up the email addresses correctly.  However, please note that when someone clicks on a link, this will try to open an email program (such as Outlook or Mac Mail) on the visitor's computer. This only works if the person who clicked the link has one of these programs set up for use on their computer.  This isn't anything Weebly can control directly, it's simply how browsers treat links to email addresses.  

You may want to consider using a 'Contact Form' instead of a link to your address.  To learn more about this, please see: 

http://hc.weebly.com/hc/en-us/articles/212044867-Create-a-Survey-Poll-RSVP-or-Contact-Form

You can easily add a file to your site by uploading the file and creating a link to it using our provided link creation options.  

To learn more about this, please see:

http://hc.weebly.com/hc/en-us/articles/201273623-Upload-Documents-PDF-Powerpoint-Slides-and-More

Creating a list of links can be tricky because it's easy for the code to get mixed up and cause several links to run together. The first step is to click on the links that are currently merged and click "Remove Link". You can then highlight the appropriate text and recreate the links properly. 

I've found that the easiest way to create a list of links is to enter the entire list first, then carefully highlight one item at a time to link it.  If you run into any issues with this process, please just let me know and I'll get right back to you.

Phone links can be a little tricky, and work differently depending on the specific platform being used. For a great tutorial that explains exactly how different links work on iOS and Andorid platforms, please see: http://mobile.tutsplus.com/tutorials/mobile-web-apps/phone-number-links/ For iOS and Android operating systems, text that "looks like" a phone number should automatically be linked to the phone's dialer even though the text won't be highlighted as a link on the webpage. Using the link tool in Weebly, you can highlight the number and click the link button. Use the option to link to an external site and instead of an http://www address, enter tel:// and the phone number (tel://5555551234). Using an Embed Code element, you can enter the following code to create a phone number link. Be sure to plug in your phone number. Call me!

You can easily create links from both text and images on your site.  For assistance creating such links, please see our detailed guide here:

http://hc.weebly.com/hc/en-us/articles/201018148-Create-Links

macros.title: Editor::Mobile::Changes to Mobile Affect Both Versions of the Site

value:
Currently, when you make a change (other than choosing a different theme) to the Mobile site, that change is also made to the main site. Adding a new element, editing text, uploading a new photo or anything else along those lines will change the main site as well.  

This is something we're likely to change in the future (as we'd also prefer it work the way you'd like it to work), but for now it's simply how the Mobile editor and Main site editor interact with each other. Very sorry for that!

macros.title: Editor::Mobile::Header Image Option Not Appearing on Mobile

value:
Sorry for the confusion! Some of our themes use background images for the header / banner area of the site instead of using the standard header images that most of our themes use. Unfortunately, it's not possible enable header images on the mobile site for those themes that have background images instead of header images.  

It appears that you are using one of the themes that works in the way I've described. What are your options? 

The only real option to use a header image with your mobile theme is to switch to a theme that supports this feature. Almost all of our themes do support this, so it's fairly easy to find or happen on one. 

You can learn how to switch themes here:

https://weebly.zendesk.com/hc/en-us/articles/201696407-How-to-Switch-Themes

As an alternative, you can also turn the mobile version off from the 'Settings' tab, so that the standard version of your site is displayed to mobile visitors.

Weebly automatically generates a mobile version of your site for viewing on iOS, Android, Blackberry and other smartphone platforms.  You can choose a theme (many with multiple color schemes) for the mobile version by clicking on the smartphone icon in the upper right-hand corner of the main Editor, next to the 'Publish' button. 

If you don't like the way the site looks on your mobile device, you can try a different mobile theme or
consider switching to one of our newest themes. Our most recent themes are "responsive", which means that they're designed to automatically adapt to the size of the viewer's screen. This eliminates the need for the separate, simplified mobile versions that are necessary with our older, non-responsive themes and ensures a uniform look across every device.

You can switch your site to different theme by going to the Design tab and clicking on the "change theme" button. Sorting the themes by "newest" will allow you to see the most recent themes at the top of the list.

If you're currently using a non-responsive theme and don't want to change your whole site's look, you can also turn off the mobile version of your site and have have the full desktop site display on smartphone platforms. 

However, the issue with this is that Google may lower your search ranking on mobile searches if your site is not considered mobile friendly (they also may not lower your ranking, it just depends on the situation and it's not something we can predict). We don't recommend disabling the mobile version completely for this reason.

Weebly automatically generates a mobile version of your site for viewing on iOS, Android, Blackberry and other smartphone platforms.  In the Weebly editor, you can choose a theme (many with multiple color schemes) for the mobile version of a site by clicking on the smartphone icon in the upper right-hand corner of the Editor, next to the 'Publish' button.

You can also turn the mobile version off, so that the standard version of your site is displayed to mobile visitors if you would prefer. To do this, go to the 'Settings' tab in the editor, and then uncheck the option to display the Mobile version.

macros.title: Editor::Mobile::Site Flickers / Flashes / Blinks on Mobile

value:
This problem is caused by using domain forwarding with URL masking (meaning that the domain name stays in the address bar at all times). In order to prevent this from happening, you would need to either point your domain name here and then publish to the domain, as detailed here:

http://hc.weebly.com/hc/en-us/articles/201372693-How-to-Use-a-Domain-You-Purchased-Elsewhere

Or, if you would prefer, you can use domain forwarding **without** URL masking. Either option will work fine, but please note that publishing to a domain name you purchased with another registrar requires a paid subscription to either our Starter or Pro service.

If you have any further questions about this, please just let me know and I'll get right back to you.

macros.title: Editor::Move or Copy Elements Between Pages

value:
To move or copy elements from one page to another please follow these steps:

1. Scroll over the element. 

2. Click the blue arrow in the upper left of the element. 

3. You'll see a list of pages from which to choose. Click on the page to which you'd like to move / copy your element and the element will be moved or copied to that page.

For more information about this, please see:

http://hc.weebly.com/hc/en-us/articles/201740063-Intro-to-Content-Elements

It's not immediately obvious, but you can quickly and easily move or copy an entire set of columns (and all the content within those columns) with just a few clicks of your mouse. 

How can you do that? We have a really short guide (with a few screenshots) that shows exactly how to do what you're looking to do:

https://weebly.zendesk.com/hc/en-us/articles/202511666

Weâve made some significant updates to how elements can be arranged on a page. At first glance, that may make it appear that Weebly no longer works in a way that you expect it to work. Iâm truly sorry for that. 

But I also promise that the changes weâve made here dramatically improve the way our columns (and our entire editor) works. We have a short video that details all of the changes and I think itâs worth a look: 

https://weebly.zendesk.com/hc/en-us/articles/202497066

Hereâs a breakdown of the changes weâve made (which is also covered in the video and at the above page): 
 
Update #1: Columns are created automatically
Whereas before you needed to use the old Columns element to place one element next to another, you can now simply drag elements next to each other right on the page. Doing so creates two or three or four or however many columns you need. These then function just like the Columns element previously did. 

Update #2: Column widths snap to a grid
As before, you can adjust the width of a column simply by dragging the blue line that divides two columns. To help keep column widths consistent between pages we've introduced a grid system to which all columns snap. If you want to break free of this grid, just hold "Shift" while you drag the column divider line and you can drag it wherever you like. 

Update #3: New Behavior for Moving and Copying Columns
It may appear that the options to "Move" and "Copy" a set of columns has been removed. But this isn't the case at all. You simply have to click on one of the divider lines in that set of columns and the move / copy controls will appear in the upper left of the columns as always.

Update #4: New Text+Image Behavior
We've removed the Text+Image element because you can now drag an image right on to (or out of) a block of text. This makes it much simpler to add an image to a page and allow text to wrap around it. 

Update #5: New Spacer Element
We've added a new Spacer Element so you add extra space to a page as needed. This element can be made as wide or as tall as needed to ensure it best fits your design. 

If what Iâve described here does not fit with what youâre seeing, can you give me a little more detail so I can look into this issue and get it fixed for you? I promise weâll make sure things work better for you than ever before.
