Unfortunately, we don't currently offer a mailing list opt-in form directly through the Editor.  However, you can create such a form with an email provider like MailChimp or AWeber and then add it to your site via our 'Embed Custom HTML' element.  For more information about this, please see:

http://hc.weebly.com/hc/en-us/articles/201740203-Create-a-Newsletter-Sign-up-or-Autoresponder-Form

Pasting text from other sources can bring fonts and hidden code from those sources along with it. This external formatting can cause conflicts and errors on any website. In the best case scenario, the pasted text becomes unpredictable and difficult to control. In many cases, the external formatting code "breaks" other code on the site and causes the page not to load for some users.  It may work for you for a month and then break your formatting without warning. 

To fix any of these formatting issues just select / highlight any text that has a different font and click the Tx button in the text toolbar. This will strip the extra formatting and cause the text to snap to whatever font you have selected for your site under Design > Design Options.

The best approach to avoid these issues altogether is to copy and paste your text from Word into a plain text document, and then adjust the formatting within Weebly.  You can create plain text documents via the NotePad program on PC or the TextEdit program on Mac. 

Though Word (and similar programs) use formatting that can destroy the font formatting of a webpage, pasting from Plain Text works perfectly.

If you have any further questions about this, please just let me know and I'll get right back to you.

Unfortunately, Weebly does not have a built-in podcasting element. It is possible to set up a podcast in Weebly but there are several steps involved and we're somewhat limited in the support we can provide for this process. Here are the instructions if you want to give it a try:

**UPLOAD THE AUDIO FILE**

You'll need to use a File element (not the audio element) to upload your mp3 file.

**CREATE THE XML**

You can use the free tool at http://webnet77.com/podcast-rss/index.pl/PODS to create an XML file with the basic information about your podcast. 

This produces XML markup with one tag. 

Paste this content into an XML file on your computer using a text editor like notepad or textedit and save it as podcast.xml.

Note: You will need the URL of your mp3. You can get this by opening the page with the audio file in your *live site*, and right or control-clicking to copy the link.

You may need to add the file size of your mp3 in bytes if the "auto" setting in the XML generator doesn't work with your file.

**UPLOAD THE XML**

Add a File element to a page in your Weebly site and upload the XML file you made in the last step. 

Publish your site, then right- or Control-click the link and copy the URL of the file. This is the "Podcast URL" that you'll provide to iTunes.

**UPDATE THE XML**

For each episode you produce, you'll have to upload the audio file, and re-upload the XML. iTunes should update automatically.

To publish, simply log in at Weebly.com, click on the 'Edit Site' link and then click the orange 'Publish' button in the upper right-hand corner of the editor. When your site is finished publishing, you'll see a confirmation message appear with a link to your live site.  For more information about publishing your site, please see:

http://hc.weebly.com/hc/en-us/articles/202015818-Publish-Your-Site

To change the web address (URL) of your website, simply click on the 'Settings' tab of the Editor, then click on 'Change Site Address'.  From here, you can choose a different address.  Once complete, just re-publish your site and you should be good to go.  For more information about this, please see:

http://hc.weebly.com/hc/en-us/articles/201740093-How-Can-I-Change-My-Site-s-Address-or-Domain-Name-

Please note if you have purchased a custom domain name outside of Weebly, you will need to be subscribed to either our Starter or Pro Plans to connect it to your site.

macros.title: Editor::Publishing and Pages::Comments on Non-Blog Page

value:
Each individual blog post includes space for unlimited comments but we do not currently have a built-in option to add comments to regular pages.  

If you'd like you to add a comment box to a regular page, you can use a third party tool like Facebook comments (https://developers.facebook.com/docs/plugins/comments/) or Disqus (http://disqus.com/websites/). 

To enable any of these features, simply copy the code they provide and paste it into one of our 'Embed HTML Code' elements.  Once you click Publish, visitors to that page will be able to make comments.

For more information on using the 'Embed Code' Element, please see:

http://hc.weebly.com/hc/en-us/articles/201740213-Create-Widgets-Embed-Code-and-Add-External-Content

macros.title: Editor::Publishing and Pages::Content Publishing Before I Click Publish

value:
When you Publish a site you are making the edited version of the site live. However, this version of the site is not frozen until you (or anyone else on earth) takes at least one look at the site. This is simply due to how our Publishing mechanism works. 

Next time you Publish click the link that comes up to view the site. Doing so will "lock" the published version so that no new content shows up until next time you Publish the site. Doing this every time you publish will ensure you never encounter the problem again.

To create a custom 404 page for your site:  

* Log into your account at Weebly.com, open the Editor for the site you wish to edit, and click on the 'Pages' tab.

* Create a new page named "404" (without the quotes).

* Make the page hidden. To create hidden pages, please see:

http://hc.weebly.com/hc/en-us/articles/201994638-Manage-Pages

* Edit the page to add whatever message you want your users to see when they click on a broken link to your site.

* Make sure you publish your changes. Your 404 page will replace the default Weebly "Site Not Published" page.

If you run into any problems with any of this, please just let me know and I'll get right back to you.

macros.title: Editor::Publishing and Pages::Deleted or Missing Pages

value:
Usually when a page disappears, it's because the page was accidentally renamed, moved, and/or deleted when you were working in the 'Pages' tab.

The best place to start is by checking any new pages you recently created to make sure you didn't accidentally rename your missing pages. If you're unable to locate the missing content on the 'Pages' tab, we have the ability to restore deleted pages to your site. Just please let me know which site you're working on, what the name of the page is, and approximately what date you think it was deleted.  I will do my best to locate and restore your deleted page for you.

I have restored what appears to be your accidentally deleted page.  Please take a look in the Editor and see if the page you were missing is back and working.  If you are still experiencing any issues, please just respond directly to this email and I will get back to you ASAP.

macros.title: Editor::Publishing and Pages::Disable the More Tab

value:
You can turn the 'More' feature ON or OFF under the 'Settings' tab of the Editor.  Turning the 'More' option ON causes any excess menu items to appear as sub-pages of a "More" navigation link on the navigation menu.

If you have a large number of pages you should probably consider making some of them sub-pages of other pages. To learn more about this, please see:

http://hc.weebly.com/hc/en-us/articles/201505656-Create-Pages-and-Navigation

macros.title: General::Bug::Can't access Pages tab in IE9

actions.value:
I wanted to let you know that our developers are aware of this issue with Internet Explorer 9 and looking into this. 

As IE9 is an older browser, I would recommend either upgrading to a newer version of IE or switching to a different browser. Firefox, Safari and Chrome are all free and if one doesn't work perfectly for you, another one might.  

Thank you for your patience.

value:
In order to comply with the EU cookie directive, please ensure that you do not have any external analytics services installed on your site. You may do so by visiting the "Settings" tab and then clicking on "Search Engine Optimization" and ensuring that Header and Footer code sections are empty.

Weebly is certified and compliant with the US-EU Data Protection Safe Harbor. All cookies placed by Weebly for visitors of your site are strictly necessary for the operation of the service by Weebly.

To create hidden pages, please see our guide to managing pages:

http://hc.weebly.com/hc/en-us/articles/201994638-Manage-Pages

For reference (for after you create the page), the URL of a hidden page is the name of the page with "-" appearing in place of any spaces between the words in the name.  For example:

If you name a page "thank you", it's http://www.yourdomainhere.com/thank-you.html.  

If you name a page "thanks", it's http://www.yourdomainhere.com/thanks.html.  

If you name a page "thank you very much" then the URL is http://www.yourdomainhere.com/thank-you-very-much.html.

If you have any further questions about this, please just let me know and I'll get right back to you.

macros.title: Editor::Publishing and Pages::HTML File Name Different Than Page Title

value:
While you can use accented letters in your page names, these accented letters will need to be converted into a format that the internet can handle.â This is why you will see strange results in the url for your site or page.

However, although it may look incorrect to us, computers will be able to read it perfectly.

There's currently no way around this limitation, however I can tell you that this feature has been highly requested and we are working on enabling it for a future release.â I truly apologize for any inconvenience this causes.

macros.title: Editor::Publishing and Pages::Make Top-Level Page Unclickable

value:
In the Weebly editor, if you click on the 'Pages' tab at the top, you will see a list of your pages in grey boxes. You can drag a page to the right so that it is underneath and slightly to the right (indented) of the page that you want to be the primary page. It should snap into place, slightly indented. Then next time you publish, it will show up underneath that page in your navigation.

For more help creating subpages, please see 

http://hc.weebly.com/hc/en-us/articles/201505656-Create-Pages-and-Navigation

Please keep in mind that it isn't possible to make a top-level navigation page link unclickable so that only the sub-pages can be clicked.  The best work-around for this is to add links directly to the main page that lead to each of the sub-pages.  That way, people who click the main page link don't see a blank page.    

For assistance creating links, please see:

http://hc.weebly.com/hc/en-us/articles/201018148-Create-Links

Your page title is automatically generated by combining the site title from the 'Settings' tab with the page title from the 'Pages' tab. For your home page and blog pages, it will be "Site Title - Page Title". For all other pages, it will be "Page Title - Site Title". At this time, it's not possible to modify that basic structure.  I apologize for any inconvenience this may cause.

To hide your website content from the public, you can use the 'Password Protection' feature.  For information on exactly how this works, please see: 

http://hc.weebly.com/hc/en-us/articles/213248637-Hide-Restrict-Access-and-Un-Publish-Your-Site

We also recently announced a new Membership feature for Pro and Business users. You can read more about how that works on our blog: http://blog.weebly.com/post/membership-is-here

With a Weebly Pro account, you can create up to 100 members. With a Business account, you can have an unlimited number of members and you can choose to create the members yourself or allow visitors to register on your site. 

Please note that password protection and membership are both part of Weebly's Pro and Business upgrades.

Please also keep in mind that while you can password protect a page on your website, files and documents linked from that page are NOT protected. You should not use Weebly's password protection to hide PDF's, DOC's, or other uploaded files.

The reason you were unable to renew your expired Google Apps account is that it is in an "Appsless" state. More details can be found in our help guide:

http://hc.weebly.com/hc/en-us/articles/201982006-Google-Apps-is-Appsless

macros.title: Editor::Publishing and Pages::Membership/Password Protection - Different Passwords

value:
Our Membership feature for Pro and Business users allows you to control who has access to your site. You can read more about how that works in [this help guide](http://hc.weebly.com/hc/en-us/articles/203859386).

With a Weebly Pro account, you can create up to 100 members. With a Business account, you can have an unlimited number of members and you can choose to create the members yourself or allow visitors to register on your site. 

You can specify whether individual pages will be visible to everyone with a password or only specific members or groups of members.

macros.title: Editor::Publishing and Pages::Membership and Password Protection - Files Are Not Protected

value: Files or content added to a membership page will not be accessible to non-members as long as the file or content was added to the page â*after*â enabling Password Protection. However, the link to the file itself is not password protected, so if you link to the file from a public page or site, that file will become indexed by search engines and visible to the public.

actions.value: We are currently experiencing a problem with published Weebly sites.  Our Operations team is working to resolve the issue and we will notify you as soon as your site is back online.

macros.title: Editor::Publishing and Pages::Password Protection - Password Not Always Required

value: Your users should not have to enter the site password more than once per session.  Once the password is entered, a visitor can freely browse the password protected areas of the website.  Only when the browser window is completely closed and re-opened will the password again be required.

For the vast majority of features, the Editor itself acts as a preview of your site. Generally speaking, what you see in the editor is how your live site will look.  However, there are a few features that you may want or need to check on prior to releasing your live site. In those instances, you may want to publish just long enough to check the functionality and then unpublish the site using the option to do so found under the 'Settings' tab of the Editor.

macros.title: Editor::Publishing and Pages::Published Site Looks Different Than Editor Site (Shift Reload)

value:
When your Published version of your site looks different than the version in the editor, it almost always means one of two things:

1.  That you haven't Published the site since you've made your changes (I'm sure you've likely done this, but I mention it just in case).  Please make sure that you published the latest version by pressing the "publish" button in the editor.  

2.  A browser will often display a cached/outdated version of a site to provide a faster browsing experience.  This can make your recently published site look different or even broken.  Clearing your browser's cache forces the browser to display the site's latest version.  

If you're not sure how to clear your cache, please see step-by step instructions here:

http://www.wikihow.com/Clear-Your-Browser's-Cache  

If you still have changes that are not showing up, please let me know **exactly** what is not publishing and I will be happy to take a look for you.

macros.title: Editor::Publishing and Pages::Redirect / Navigation Link to External Site

value:
To learn how to create a navigation link that leads to another site, please see the end of this guide:

http://hc.weebly.com/hc/en-us/articles/201018148-Create-Links

macros.title: Editor::Publishing and Pages::Rename the More Tab

value:
There isn't a way to rename the "More" link to something else but you can simply replace the "More" link with a page of your own and then make your other pages subpages of that page. This is very easy to do and you can learn how to create subpages using our short guide here:

http://hc.weebly.com/hc/en-us/articles/201505656-Create-Pages-and-Navigation

Using the above method will allow you to create a "More" link that uses any name you like.

In the Weebly Editor, if you click on the 'Pages' tab at the top, you will see a list of your pages in grey boxes. You can drag a page to the right so that it is underneath and slightly to the right (indented) of the page that you want to be the primary page. It should snap into place, slightly indented. Then next time you publish, it will show up underneath that page in your navigation.

For more help creating subpages, please see:

http://hc.weebly.com/hc/en-us/articles/201505656-Create-Pages-and-Navigation

Please keep in mind that it isn't possible to make a top-level navigation page link unclickable so that only the sub-pages can be clicked.  The best work-around for this is to add links directly to the main page that lead to each of the sub-pages.  That way people who click the main page link don't see a blank page.    

For assistance creating links, check out:

http://hc.weebly.com/hc/en-us/articles/201018148-Create-Links

actions.value:
We are aware of this issue and our development team is working closely with Google to resolve it as quickly as possible.
We'll let you know as soon as we have it fixed.

value:
Once you've upgraded to Weebly Starter, Pro, or Business, you can easily customize the footer on your website. For step-by-step instructions on exactly how to do this, please see:

http://hc.weebly.com/hc/en-us/articles/201740123-How-Do-I-Remove-or-Change-the-Weebly-Footer-

If you want to display a list of recent posts from a blog on your site, you can use our 'Feed Reader' element, which is located in the 'Build' tab, under the "More" section (you can click the "..." icon on the top to quickly jump to that section).

Just drag the element to your page, and then click on it to edit the settings.  The feed address is where you enter the RSS feed URL for the blog you want to display.  If you're using it with a Weebly blog, you can get the feed URL from your published blog - just click on the RSS icon in the sidebar and copy the URL.  You can also use this element with other blogs as long as you have the RSS feed URL.

There are a couple other settings you can adjust, like the width of the element and the number of items it will display.  Once you have everything the way you like it, just publish your site again.  Please keep in mind that if the blog page is password protected, the feed reader won't be able to access the blog and therefore it won't work.

For more info about RSS, please see:

http://hc.weebly.com/hc/en-us/articles/201913808-What-is-an-RSS-Feed-

macros.title: Editor::RTL - Right to Left Languages (Hebrew / Arabic)

value:
Unfortunately, support for languages written from right to left is not yet available in Weebly.  Currently, you can directly modify the HTML & CSS of your website template using the 'Edit HTML/CSS' option under the 'Designs' tab of the Editor. However, this feature should be used only if you're familiar with HTML & CSS code as we do not provide support for problems that may occur while using this area of the Editor. 

There is some good information on the following website that may help you configure the text on your website accordingly.

http://www.i18nguy.com/markup/right-to-left.html


Please keep in mind that Internet Explorer does not generally work well with the Weebly templates that have a horizontal navigation bar when the direction is right-to-left. For best results, you should select a template that has a vertical navigation bar.

We appreciate your patience and understanding as we continue to develop Weebly.

All of your work is saved as you go, so there is no need to do anything special to save your site.  It is saved for you automatically.  You can just close out of the editor and come back when you're ready -- all of the work you previously created will be there waiting for you.  

The only exception to this rule is when you're working on a blog post.  To save a blog post to work on later (before Publishing it), be sure to click the 'Save to Draft' button at the top of the post.

Would you mind replying with a screen shot of the problem attached to your email?  If you aren't sure how to take a screenshot on your computer or device, please refer to the following page for simple instructions covering a variety of platforms:

http://take-a-screenshot.org/

Unfortunately, the 'Embedded Document / Scribd' element is not currently visible on the mobile version of our sites. We're working with Scribd to figure out the cause of the problem now; as soon as the issue is fixed the embedded documents will start working on the mobile version of your site immediately.  

That said: if you need to fix this problem right away, please go to Settings > Mobile, turn the mobile version of your site off, and then Publish the site again. This will display the desktop version of your site on iOS, Android phones, and other devices (the sites will still work perfectly on each of these devices) allowing Scribd to work normally again.  I truly apologize for the inconvenience and thank you for your understanding as we continue to develop Weebly.

The Embedded Document element is currently responding very slowly due to issues with the company (Scribd) that provides element. 

We are working with Scribd to fix this issue on their side. Unfortunately, the embedded document element is one of the very few elements that we did not create ourselves so there is nothing we can alter on our end to resolve the problem unfortunately.

If you are trying to upload a PDF file, I'd recommend simply linking to it in the interim. Linked PDFs open in a new tab in the browser as illustrated in the first part of this article:

http://hc.weebly.com/hc/en-us/articles/201273623-Upload-Documents-PDF-Powerpoint-Slides-and-More

Linking to PDFs is actually significantly better than embedding them as browsers know what to do with a linked PDF and will display them perfectly.

There is no other way around the problem right now. You may want to use a third-party document viewer to embed your documents (like CrocoDoc.com). You'd upload the document to their service and then add it to your site via our Embed Code element. For assistance with the Embed Code element, please see:

http://hc.weebly.com/hc/en-us/articles/201740213-Create-Widgets-Embed-Code-and-Add-External-Content

Scribd is one of the few elements in our system that is not built or controlled directly by us. So we're at the mercy of Scribd in this case. If we could fix it ourselves it'd already be fixed. I'm truly sorry for this and wish it was fixed already.

While we offer help and troubleshooting for technical problems related to our editor and elements, we don't offer consultation or development services through the support center. Weebly does not currently provide a service to analyze or audit SEO for our users. Our system is completely self-service. While we are more than happy to help out with any questions you have that are of a technical nature, the creation of the site is up to you.

It can take a number of weeks for new websites to get "indexed" in the search engine listings and even longer for a site to show up in the results for specific keywords.  The following page in our support center provides specific steps and information detailing how to get initially indexed and better ranked in search engines, however, this is the only information regarding SEO our support center will be able to provide.

http://hc.weebly.com/hc/en-us/articles/201672817-Improve-Your-Search-Ranking

If you need an SEO consultant, there are a number of third-party companies out there that are happy to assist Weebly users. If you search Google for "SEO consultant" you'll see many of them on the first page. While we don't currently endorse any companies or consultants in particular, I'm confident you will be able to find a consultant to help with your individual needs.

macros.title: Editor::Social Media::Change Facebook or Twitter Update Text

value: When you automatically share your Weebly updates on Facebook and Twitter, the text cannot be changed. If you'd like to include a custom message with your updates, you'll need to copy and paste a link to your site directly into your Facebook/Twitter account instead of using the "share" option within Weebly. While this is a feature we're working on developing, I don't have a set release date for you at this time.  Thank you for your patience and understanding as we continue to develop Weebly.

macros.title: Editor::Social Media::Google+ / Google Plus / G+ Link

value:
It's no problem to link your Weebly site to your Google+ page and I'll be happy to help you with that!

You actually have a couple of options. You can add Google+ to the built-in social network links in your site's header or anywhere on your page. For help using Weebly's built-in social network links, please see:

[Social Network Links](https://weebly.zendesk.com/hc/en-us/articles/202015908-Add-Social-Media-Links-Icons-Facebook-Twitter-Pinterest-)

You can also use the code that Google gave you with our 'Embed Code' element.  Google says to ask your webmaster to set this up for you but you're actually the webmaster for your own site. There's nothing special that we need to do to make that work for you. You just need to copy the one line of code and paste it into an Embed Code element where you want the link to show up on your page. For assistance using Weebly's Embed Code element, please see: 

[Embed Code Element](https://weebly.zendesk.com/hc/en-us/articles/201740213-Add-Widgets-Videos-and-Other-Content-by-Embedding-Code)

You can build a LinkedIn share button here:

http://developer.linkedin.com/plugins/share-plugin-generator

And then add it to your site using our Embed Code element.  For assistance with the Embed Code element, please see: 

http://hc.weebly.com/hc/en-us/articles/201740213-Create-Widgets-Embed-Code-and-Add-External-Content

macros.title: Editor::Social Media::Share to Facebook or Twitter

value:
You're welcome to share your website and blog posts to either a personal Facebook profile or to a business / fan page. 

We've written a short guide that shows how to connect your site to a Facebook fan page, as well as to Twitter and a personal Facebook profile. You can read through it here: 

http://hc.weebly.com/hc/en-us/articles/202015908-Add-Social-Media-Links-Icons-Facebook-Twitter-Pinterest-

If you're interested in sharing your blog posts, please see:

http://hc.weebly.com/hc/en-us/articles/203775853-Share-Blog-Posts-to-Facebook-and-Twitter

macros.title: Editor::Social Media::Social Icons Don't Show If They're Not Linked

value:
Although you see the icons when looking at your site in the Editor, Social Buttons won't show up on your published site if you don't enter a link for the buttons.    

So if you enter a link for Facebook, but not for Twitter, then the Facebook button will show up, but the Twitter button won't.  All the buttons will show up in the editor so you know which ones you have the option to use.

If you click on the buttons in the editor you'll be presented with a menu where you can enter a link for each button.  Add the links you need and Publish your site again.  Then you'll be all set.

macros.title: Editor::Social Media::Social Network Links and Widgets/Facebook Like

value:
You can easily link to your social network profiles using our built in icons. Check out our guide to using those [here](http://hc.weebly.com/hc/en-us/articles/202015908).
It's not possible to add other social networks to the built-in buttons in your design template at the moment but we'll likely add more options there in the future.

You can link to any other social network with pictures or text, which you can read about here:
http://hc.weebly.com/hc/en-us/articles/201018148

You can also embed other social widgets as long as they provide you with embeddable code (and most do).  You would then use that with our 'Embed Code' Element.  For assistance with Weebly's Embed Code element, please see: 

[Using the Embed Code Element](http://hc.weebly.com/hc/en-us/articles/201740213)

We also have a tutorial specifically for adding the Facebook like button [here](http://hc.weebly.com/hc/en-us/articles/202081836).

It's possible that our authorization allowing you to post updates to your twitter account can expire out of the blue. This is due to a weird quirk in Twitter (unfortunately) and doesn't look to be something we can fix on our side. 

That said, this is fairly easy to quickly fix via your Twitter account. We've written a short guide to this here:

http://kb.weebly.com/twitter-authorization.html

Follow along with the guide and you'll be on your way. Sorry for the trouble!

The reason that not all of the tweets are being displayed in the count on your blog buttons is because not every tweet is generated through the post buttons. The ones that are will always show up in the count, but at the moment, if someone visits your blog and then copies the URL to your post and goes to Twitter and pastes that link, it would not show up in the count.

This is because the tweet buttons are currently set up to work with the old blog URLs in order to keep the tweet counts intact on older posts. Our developers are currently working on a solution for the tweet buttons, but for the time being you may see a discrepancy between what's displayed on your post button versus the actual number of tweets at Twitter.

Please note that people can still tweet your posts no matter what - it's just the displayed count on the button on each post that is not showing the full total. It won't affect peoples' ability to tweet your posts at all.

macros.title: Editor::Social Media::Twitter Tweet Share Count Retired

value:
Twitter has recently redesigned the appearance of their buttons. During this process, they also decided to retire the Tweet/Share Count functionality. More information on this can be found here:

https://blog.twitter.com/2015/hard-decisions-for-a-sustainable-platform

Very sorry for the frustration!

Unfortunately, the Tal.ki forum is not a service provided directly by Weebly and it is not a tool over which we have even the slightest control.  This is one of only two elements that are not built by us.  We added it to our editor in partnership with Tal.ki in order to provide our users an easy way to simply drag a forum on to their site.  

There are two options going forward:

1 -- Stick with the forum you have.  It should be available and working again shortly.  

2 -- Start a new forum via a tool like nabble.com.  It's easy to add a Nabble forum to your site and Nabble has been around for a long time.  Pretty confident they're not going anywhere. 

When you build a forum with a tool like Nabble.com they give you embed code to use to add the forum to your site.  All you'd need to do to place it on your Weebly site is copy & paste that code into one of our Embed Code Elements.  Learn how to use the element here:

http://hc.weebly.com/hc/en-us/articles/201740213-Create-Widgets-Embed-Code-and-Add-External-Content

macros.title: Editor::Teachers and Students::Allow Students to Upload Assignments

value:
Students can upload files up to 20MB using the 'Assignment Form'. The 'Assignment Form' element is in the Basic category of elements.
  
Once you publish your site, students can enter their name and e-mail address, upload their file, and submit. You'll receive an e-mail notification with the attachment and you can also log into your Weebly account to see all of the form submissions and attachments at any time.

Under 'My Students', 'Class Settings', you can specify a "class password". This locks the students' published websites so that they can only be viewed by someone with the class password. Everyone will share the same class password. If you're being prompted for a password when you try to view a student's published website, the class password is the one you need to use. If you delete the class password, the students' published websites will be openly available on the web.  If you have any further questions about this, please just let me know and I'll get right back to you.

I apologize for the error message you're receiving.  This means that your school is blocking our embedded document provider (Scribd).  If you viewed the document at home, you'd be able to see it with no problems at all. 

Can you ask your IT department if they can unblock Scribd? This is the only way for those documents to be viewed at your school. 

Otherwise I'd recommend linking to PDF versions of your files. Browsers know how to properly display PDFs and will do so in a new tab when the link is clicked. It's a very good way to share PDF documents (though it doesn't work nearly so well for documents other than PDFs). You can learn about how to link to PDFs and other files here:

http://hc.weebly.com/hc/en-us/articles/201018148-Create-Links

macros.title: Editor::Teachers and Students::Students Cannot Be Editors

value:
Unfortunately, at this time, student accounts cannot be set up as editors. When you invite a student as an editor, strange things can happen as the system tries to process that request and make it work. Ultimately, you will wind up with errors because it's just not allowed.

We have had a few requests from teachers to allow students to edit the class website and that's something that we hope to have in place before the next school year starts, but for now, the only option is to have each student work on their own website in their own account and then link to each of those from the class site. We appreciate your patience while we continue to develop Weebly.

macros.title: Editor::Teachers and Students::YouTube / Scribd for NHD Sites

value:
According to the rules of the NHD competition, you're not allowed to link to content outside of your Weebly site so we've removed the YouTube and Scribd elements from the NHD version of the editor.

To add video to your NHD site, you can use the Weebly video element as described here: 

http://hc.weebly.com/hc/en-us/articles/202022398-Upload-HD-Videos

Please note that while this is normally a paid feature, it is available for free to NHD students.

To display documents on your site, the best option is to save the file as PDF and upload and link to that. Linked PDFs open in a new tab in the browser as illustrated in the first part of this article:

http://hc.weebly.com/hc/en-us/articles/201273623-Upload-Documents-PDF-Powerpoint-Slides-and-More

If you have any further questions about this, please just let me know and I'll get right back to you.

You have the option to use a text title, upload a logo image, or turn the title off completely. To add a logo, read this guide:

http://hc.weebly.com/hc/en-us/articles/203905306-Upload-a-Logo-to-Your-Site

And to edit the font of your text title, please read our guide on editing site fonts:

http://hc.weebly.com/hc/en-us/articles/201505666-Edit-Fonts

Can you try to clear your cache, close your browser, re-open it and then access Weebly?  If you're not sure how to clear your cache, take a look here:

http://www.wikihow.com/Clear-Your-Browser's-Cache

I'm sorry to hear that you've been experiencing these issues.  Unfortunately, we've had difficulty reproducing it on our side.  In order to help us replicate and fix the problem, would you mind taking a video screen capture?  

It's easy to do by going to kb.weebly.com/record and using the 'Record a Screencast' button that appears there.  Please write us back to let us know when you've done so, and don't forget to include the link that you are given when you've finished recording the video so we can see what you've recorded.

Thank you in advance for your assistance!

To unpublish a previously published site, please:

1. Click the 'Settings' Tab  
2. Click the 'Un-publish Site' button.  

You can always Publish the site again whenever you like. 

Also, feel free to read our guide here:

http://hc.weebly.com/hc/en-us/articles/213248637-Hide-Restrict-Access-and-Un-Publish-Your-Site

You can add a PDF/PowerPoint/Word/Excel file to a site by creating a link to a file using our provided link creation options.  

Alternatively, you can embed a document directly to a page.  This allows your visitors to view the document on a site without downloading it.

To learn how to do both, please see:

http://hc.weebly.com/hc/en-us/articles/201273623-Upload-Documents-PDF-Powerpoint-Slides-and-More

We recently announced a new Membership feature for Pro and Business users. You can read more about how that works on our blog: http://blog.weebly.com/post/membership-is-here

With a Weebly Pro account, you can create up to 100 members. With a Business account, you can have an unlimited number of members and you can choose to create the members yourself or allow visitors to register on your site.

I'm sorry to say that we don't currently provide this feature. But feedback like yours makes it much more likely that we'll develop and release such an option. 

If you want to keep up with our changes and updates, be sure to follow our blog at http://blog.weebly.com

You are also welcome to suggest and vote on this and other features at http://www.weebly.com/editor/feature_request.php

We've heard reports of antivirus software or a school or office firewall preventing some features from displaying properly. If you have antivirus software installed, try temporarily disabling it and then logging in. You may also need to check with the person in charge of the network firewall (if you are accessing your Weebly site from a school or office) in order to do this. If this works, you'll need to add Weebly to the software's "safe" or "accepted" list. Just in case they need it, our IP ranges are:

199.34.228/22
and
74.115.48/22

Unfortunately, your contact information doesn't match the information we have on file for this account. We have to be incredibly careful about providing access to an account if we're not 100% sure we're speaking to the owner of that account. So before we can help out, we need to verify that you are the owner.  

I'm escalating this issue to our senior staff so that they can do just that. They'll be in touch soon and we'll get this all worked out!

Our editor allows for people to create an ADA compatible website, but we are not able to ensure that each customer's website meets those requirements.

Like most WYSIWYG editors, the finished site will be as accessible as you make it. We provide all the tools to build an accessible site but you must be aware of the issues and use the tools effectively.

However, the editor itself may not be completely compliant, as it requires users to drag and drop elements in order to build the website.
I need help with this one

macros.title: General::Browser::IE Stuck in Compatibility Mode (and IE7/IE8 Not Supported)

value:
There are settings in the Internet Explorer browser that interfere with our editor when active, and it sounds like these settings are the cause of the problems you're seeing. Happily, these settings can be easily shut off. 

In IE 9 and 10, right click in the top title bar and choose to display the "Command Bar". In that bar is a "Tools" drop down menu - click it. Under "Compatibility View settings" it is possible that Weebly has been added to "Websites you've added to Compatibility View" - If Weebly appears there, simply remove it.  

Make sure the "Display all websites in Compatibility View" box is NOT checked. This mode of IE tells it to open the site using a very old tools that we do not support, so our editor will not work in IE's Compatibility View. Turning it off ensures that our service will work perfectly. 

And a reminder that if you use Internet Explorer 8 (or earlier) our service will not work at all. You'll need to upgrade to a newer version of IE or download another browser like the ones shown here:

http://whatbrowser.org/

Weebly provides two paid services that expand the features of our editor; these services are called Starter and Pro. 

Starter includes:

*Customizable Footer  
*Your Own Favicon

Pro Service includes all of the above as well as:

*Video Player  
*Audio Player  
*Password Protection  
*Editor Permissions

This means your link was shared at some point in the fairly recent past and Facebook has cached an older description for the link. This cached information is being shown instead of your newer title and description.  

This has nothing to with Weebly, so there isn't anything you can do on your site to change it.  However, Facebook has a tool called the "URL Debugger".  Submitting your address via this tool will clear the FB cache and enable FB to grab the newer information that you want it to show. 

If you want to give this a try, enter the address you want to share at the following link and then click debug:

http://developers.facebook.com/tools/debug

macros.title: General::Facebook Likes Not Shown on Timeline

value:
This is the way that the like button functions normally, and that is entirely controlled by Facebook and not Weebly.

When you like a post, it does not go to your main timeline where you see status updates and photo posts, but to your "recent activity" section. This section is dynamic and will update as you add friends, like items, and engage in other activities that are displayed in this section. Your friends may or may not see this in their newsfeed, and that is dependent upon their own personal Facebook account settings and preferences.

Weebly is free!  There is a charge for the optional upgrade to your own domain name and we also offer some optional additional services as part of our Weebly Pro subscription upgrade. But standard service is and always will be available 100% free and feature-packed.

We don't currently provide an option to build tables from directly within our editor.  Tables can be created using our custom html element.  However, this is not particularly intuitive.  For HTML help with tables, please see:

http://www.w3schools.com/html/html_tables.asp

And for help with our Embed Code Element:

http://hc.weebly.com/hc/en-us/articles/201740213-Create-Widgets-Embed-Code-and-Add-External-Content

You can alternatively embed a spreadsheet/table from Excel or Word into your site by following [this tutorial](http://hc.weebly.com/hc/en-us/articles/201273623-Upload-Documents-PDF-Powerpoint-Slides-and-More).

macros.title: General::CARBON - Create a Table / Simple Table

value:
A Simple Table is similar to an Excel table - but easier! Add as many columns and rows as youâd like and tailor your table to the design of your website with a custom background color. Simple Table allows for multiple table styles including basic, header, banded, and column. So forget the hassle of importing an Excel table and add a Simple Table to your website.

When a Simple Table element is dragged to a page, it defaults to four columns and three rows. A simple toolbox allows for the addition of extra columns or rows, as well as changes to background colors for the title areas of the table. You can then drag an element into a field to begin adding content. This makes it easy for you to add images (instead of just text) to a field.

macros.title: General::CARBON - How to Use Code Block

value:
The Code Block Element is a way to call-out and display HTML code on a page, which is helpful for someone providing guidance or tutorials that involves showing of code snippets to their visitors. Once added to your page, just click on the element to edit this element. You can customize the Code Block by managing the code type and style in the Code Editor of the app.

If you are looking to add an actual widget to your site, please use our Embed Code element.

macros.title: General::CARBON - How to Use the Team Card Element

value:
The Team Card Element can be used on your team pages, contact pages or literally anywhere else on your site. This is an easy way to showcase a member of your staff or group.

Once added to your page, just click on the element to edit this element. You can then add an image, text and even turn off the default button.

The Tabs element allows you to add content to your site,  but keeps the design neat and clean by only showing small snippets of information at one time. Your users can just click on a tab to see more information.

Customize the way your tabs look to match your site. You can choose where you want to position the tabs, whether that be on the left or the bottom of the box - itâs entirely up to you. You can also choose between four different tab styles; standard, 3D, line, and simple. Once added to your page, just click on the Tabs element to begin customizing.

macros.title: General::CARBON - How to Use the Counter

value:
The Counter is a great way to highlight an important number on your website. Using the Counter, the number displayed will animate up from 0 to the number that you preset. You can also change display aspects such as size, color and speed.

Once added to your page, just click on the Counter element to begin customizing.

Please note, this is not a visitor tracker or click counter.

macros.title: General::CARBON - How to use the Call-Out Box

value: The Call-Out Box helps draw attention to specific areas of content on your site. Call-Out Boxes can have borders, as well as different background colors. They also include a Title area, a content area where any elements can be dragged, and a button. Once added to a page, you can start editing your Call-Out Box by clicking directly on the element.

That said, we have no access to accounts created in their system. This makes it impossible for us to pull up your site and troubleshoot any questions or problems. For that reason, it's best that you address any questions to your host directly. We apologize for any inconvenience and wish you great success with your site!

BRAND NAME licenses a version of the Weebly sitebuilder for their users but they set everything up on their own servers and we have no control over the implementation. They control which features are available in which packages and we don't even have access to their customer accounts. So even if we did have control and could make changes, we're unable to view or alter accounts created in their system.  

I'm not trying to push you away, simply to explain that your host never should have sent you to us to begin with. If they continue to push you back to us, would you mind replying with a case number or support rep's name because we'd like to follow up with their management to make sure that everyone is on the same page and customers are not being tossed back and forth. I promise this is just as frustrating for us as it is for you.

macros.title: General::Partner::Endurance / Reseller - Why Don't I Have the Updates?

value:
Your host licenses a version of the Weebly sitebuilder for their users but they set everything up on their own servers and we have no control over the implementation. They control which features are available in which packages and we don't even have access to their system.


Generally, new features are available at weebly.com before they're released to our partners. We need to make sure all the bugs are out before we give them the code. Then their developers need time to customize their setup and test it on their system. Then they need to schedule the upgrade at a time that works for their company. We generally provide our partners with updates quarterly, so it can take a few months before the new features are available through all our partners. We appreciate your patience!

The problem is that websites are designed to be viewed on a screen and not to be printed directly from the web browser. You can print a webpage, but it is likely not going to look the way you expect it to, and this would be true of most any website.  If you are interested in learning more about this issue and what you can do that might help, check out the following page for more information:

http://windows.microsoft.com/en-US/windows7/Printing-webpages-frequently-asked-questions


If you're concerned about your header image not printing, check your browser's Print options. It's in different places on different browsers but there should be a box you can check to "print background colors and images". That is typically turned off by default in order to conserve ink but when you turn it on, your header image and other layout images will print. 

You may have better results simply taking a screenshot of the content you wish to print, then printing from the image directly.

If you aren't sure how to take a screenshot on your computer, please refer to the following page for simple instructions:

http://take-a-screenshot.org/

This traffic appears to be caused by spambots. Spambots constantly scan the web for email addresses or any information. Virtually every website encounters this problem at one time or another, and there is no real way to prevent this from happening. 

While this is a serious annoyance, there is nothing to worry about, as all websites have to deal with this. Please note that you are the only one who sees the referrer stats.  The links are not visible to anyone who doesn't have access to your account.

More information on Spambots can be found here:

http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spambot

It can take a number of weeks for new websites to get "indexed" in the search engine listings and even longer for a site to show up in the results for specific keywords.  The following page in our support center provides specific steps and information detailing how to get initially indexed and better ranked in search engines:

http://hc.weebly.com/hc/en-us/articles/201672817-Improve-Your-Search-Ranking

It isn't necessary to list your site with Webmaster Tools to get indexed by Google, but it can be very helpful for improving your ranking.  The following article on our help site shows the exact steps you should take in order to get verified with Google Webmaster tools.

http://hc.weebly.com/hc/en-us/articles/201723433-Verify-Site-with-Search-Engines

You can also be verified by Bing if you'd like to take those extra steps:

[Getting Verified by Bing](http://www.bing.com/toolbox/webmaster)

While you can specify the title of your site in the Settings tab, this is not contained in an H1 tag. At this time, the only way to manually add an H1 tag would be using an embed code element or by modifying the HTML of the theme itself.

You can add H2 tags throughout your site by dragging Title elements to the page where needed.  These H2 tags act as "headlines" which can break a page up into different sections in the eyes of the search engines.

macros.title: General::SEO::Hide Site/Page From Search / Block Search Indexing

value:
If you want to hide an individual page from the search results you need to use our "Hide Page from Search" setting that's found under Pages > Advanced Settings. Every page has an Advanced Settings link where you can access this setting.  Follow our short guide for help with this:

http://hc.weebly.com/hc/en-us/articles/213248637-Hide-Restrict-Access-and-Un-Publish-Your-Site

Note that this will hide the page from your own site search as well as Google and other public search engines. 

Also note that the other Page setting called "Hide Page from Navigation" does not hide that page from search results; all it does is remove the page from your navigation menu so that no link to it appears in your site's navigation. 

If you want to block search engine access to your entire site (as opposed to just specific pages), you can do so by checking the box next to "Hide site from search engines" under the SEO heading on the Settings tab in the Weebly editor.

Be sure to save and publish your site for these changes to take effect.

macros.title: General::SEO::How To Get More Traffic / Visitors

value:
While we don't offer specific advice or assistance for this, here are some suggestions to  help you grow your website traffic:

  
**Spread the Word** - Tell your customers, family & friends about your site.
  
**[Optimize for Search Engines](http://hc.weebly.com/hc/en-us/articles/201672817-Improve-Your-Search-Ranking)** - make sure people can find you on Google.
  
**Update Regularly** - keeping your website content fresh gives visitors a reason to come back.
  

**Use Your Social Network** - post your site to Facebook, Twitter and/or LinkedIn whenever you update your content.
  

**[Start a Blog](http://hc.weebly.com/hc/en-us/articles/202015808-Start-a-Blog)** - a blog is an easy way to regularly add new content to your site and attract and build repeat visits.
  

**[Add a Facebook Like Button](http://hc.weebly.com/hc/en-us/articles/202081836-Add-a-Facebook-Like-Button-to-Your-Site)** - so your visitors can easily share your website with their friends.
  

**Promote Your Site** - add a link to your email signature, include a link to your site when you post to forums or comment on articles.
  

**[Start an Email Newsletter](http://hc.weebly.com/hc/en-us/articles/201740203-Create-a-Newsletter-Sign-up-or-Autoresponder-Form)** - use it as a tool to bring visitors back to your website.
  

**Get Reciprocal Links** - swap links with other websites that have a similar audience to drive free qualified traffic.
  

**Try Pay-Per-Click Advertising** - drive targeted traffic to your website. Get $100 in Google AdWordsâ¢ additional advertising when you [upgrade to a Weebly Premium Plan](https://secure.weebly.com/weebly/purchase.php?type=pro&comparison=1).*
  
*Google requires the Adwords credit to be used on a brand new Adwords account in the US or Canada. One Adwords credit per Weebly account.

macros.title: General::SEO::Keywords or Title Converted to HTML Character Strings

value: When you use two-byte characters (used in languages like Hebrew, Arabic and Chinese) in the Title & Keyword SEO fields, the text is converted to an HTML string.  This will likely look like gibberish to you, but the search engines can read this perfectly and use the information to properly index your site.  Such text conversion is normal and does not negatively impact your site at all.

When you move a site from one host to another there is always the potential for hitting a few bumps with your SEO. There are a couple of things you should do to keep any such issues to a minimum:

Use our 301 Redirect feature to make sure pages from your previous host are forwarded to your pages at Weebly.

http://hc.weebly.com/hc/en-us/articles/201723883-How-to-301-Redirect-an-Old-Page-to-a-New-Weebly-Page

Note that this is only necessary if the pages you create here have different names than the pages you had at the old host. If the page names are the same, they'll simply open right up as normal. 

And you should also read through our Basics of SEO guide to make sure you're taking all the steps needed with your Weebly site to get great search optimization.

http://hc.weebly.com/hc/en-us/articles/201672817-Improve-Your-Search-Ranking

Weebly automatically creates a blank robots.txt file for your site.  If you look at your robots.txt file (www.yourdomainhere.com/robots.txt), you'll see this text:

User-agent: *
Disallow: /ajax/
Disallow: /apps/

The user-agent: * means that the rules in this file applies to all robots. The "Disallow: /ajax/" and "Disallow: /apps/ " lines mean that robots cannot index any files you've uploaded to your store to sell (you'll see this line even if you're not using the Weebly store). If nothing else is listed, it means that nothing else on your site is disallowed. So all robots can access everything in your site except files that you're selling. If there were anything being blocked, it would show up after the second "disallow" but as long as that is blank, nothing is blocked.  So search engines can find your site. 

If you want to change this and block search engines from indexing your site, go to Settings > SEO and select "Hide site from search engines."  Then Save and Publish.

To learn more about all this, see here:

http://kb.weebly.com/robots.html

You can do some optimization to help ensure your images show up in a Google image search, but it's not as fine-tuned as it is for a regular page search since there's less information for the search engines to work with.

Here are some things you can do:

* Use a descriptive image alt tag
* Embed your images in relevant pages
* Use a relevant heading and/or caption next to the image
* Include relevant descriptive links near the image
* Use descriptive anchor text to link to the image from other pages

If you have any other questions, please let us know.

Sitemaps are automatically created (and updated every time you Publish) for sites on Weebly at http://example.weebly.com/sitemap.xml or http://www.yourdomain.com/sitemap.xml in the case that you're published to your own domain name.  There isn't an option to upload your own sitemap currently.

macros.title: General::SEO::Updates Not Reflected in Search Engine Results

value:
If search results don't show recent changes you've made to the Title and Description area of your site, keep in mind that this is because search engines are not updated in real-time. It can take anywhere from a couple of days to a few weeks for a change made a page on your site to be reflected in the small preview area shown by a search engine. And there's no way for us as a company or for you individually to speed up this process, though Google is usually speedier about indexing your site if you set up a free Webmaster account with them. Our short guide walks through this process if you'd like to give it a go:  

https://weebly.zendesk.com/hc/en-us/articles/201723433-Verify-Your-Site-with-Search-Engines

And note that if a visitor clicks on the link to your site provided by the search engine they'll see the newest version of your site. There is no delay with that at all. It's only the preview area shown in the search engine results that takes time to update.

macros.title: General::SEO::Webmaster Tools, Robots.txt, Googlebot Crawl Errors

value:
Your website is working fine and your robots.txt file indicates that your site is accessible to search engines. Google occasionally has difficulty crawling a site and will then send a message like that, but it's generally nothing to worry about as long as everything is working (which it is).

We have also found that Google bots make errors on a regular basis and it's not something to worry about. If this is a false positive, it should be cleared up the next time Google crawls your site.

We guarantee higher than 99.9% uptime for our servers, and your site is stored both on servers in San Francisco and in Las Vegas to ensure everything will continue running smoothly in case of a catastrophe. Our operations team monitors this server activity 24 hours a day, 7 days a week.

This is currently the only public detail and information we make available regarding our servers.

The statistics in Weebly are displaying daily pageviews.  This measure counts each visit of a page as one view.  Thus, if a person reloads the homepage of your site 3 times, it would count as three views.

We also have stats for unique views -- a unique visitor is someone who has not visited your site in the past 7 days. So if I visited your site and visited four pages, I'd count as one Unique View and four Page Views. Hope this helps! 

For even more detailed statistics about your website traffic, you can add Google Analytics to your website.  To do so, please follow these instructions in our support area.

[Adding Google Analytics](http://hc.weebly.com/hc/en-us/articles/201979698-Google-Analytics)

The links you're seeing on your site are not being added or caused by anything we're doing here at Weebly.  This issue is caused by one of two things:

1). Malware on your computer or in your browser. If you check your site from another computer, you won't see any ads because they're not actually part of your webpage. You should run a full virus scan on your computer and if the problem persists, try something like Adaware (http://www.lavasoft.com/products/ad_aware_free.php) which searches for and disables adware in particular. Or try this very easy guide to removing it:

http://botcrawl.com/how-to-remove-text-enhance/

OR

2). Third party code on your site that is overtaking your content to serve ads.  This is most commonly caused by a click counter.  If you have a click counter at the bottom of your site somewhere, I'd recommend removing it. 

I cannot stress enough that Weebly does not and will not run ads on your website.  We are a profitable company and the reason we're profitable is because many of our users upgrade to our Pro / Domain services.  If we treated our free users (or paid users) poorly and placed ads on their sites without their permission then no one would want to upgrade or renew.

Sorry for the noticeable change in stats! Our engineers discovered that we've been tracking bots and web crawlers as stats for the last few months. This could have incorrectly inflated the Page Views of your site. Our Engineers and Operations team were able to fix this issue, but this means that going forward your Page Views will be lower than previously.

If you want to add tracking beyond our own (which is never a bad idea), we'd recommend Google Analytics. Just follow these instructions from our help center:
http://hc.weebly.com/hc/en-us/articles/201979698-Google-Analytics

Sorry for the noticeable change in stats! We discovered we've been over counting Unique Visitors, sometimes accidentally counting the same person as multiple visitors. This means that going forward your Unique Visitor number will be lower than it was previously, though your Page View number should remain the same since we weren't over counting views, just the number of unique people who were making those views.

If you want to add tracking beyond our own (which is never a bad idea), we'd recommend Google Analytics. Just follow these instructions from our help center:
http://hc.weebly.com/hc/en-us/articles/201979698-Google-Analytics

We track views and unique visitors by IP Address whereas Google Analytics does it by setting a cookie.

Cookies notoriously undercount visits (as cookies might be disabled or otherwise blocked, they may not expire between visits taken to the site over multiple days, or the visitor may leave the page before the cookie is processed) and IP tracking can over-count them since automated visits are included and some ISPs assign roving IPs to their customers that change constantly.  Generally, the exact number of unique human visitors is somewhere towards the middle, between Weebly and Google.

This is not a flaw in Weebly's stats (or Google's), it's just that there will always be differences between server stats and third-party stats.

Unfortunately I was unable to duplicate this problem on my end.  Is it still an issue for you?  If so, please let me know the exact steps to take to reproduce this problem so I can check into this further.

We do not currently offer chat 24 hours a day.  Our normal chat hours are 8am to 6pm Pacific Time.

When there are no agents available to chat,  you will not see the option to start a chat on the Weebly help pages.  You can either submit a help ticket for your issue, or come back later to see if there is a chat agent available.

So please ask your questions here and we'll answer them for you in detail!

While I'm happy to assist you via email, I feel that we will be more successful speaking directly over the phone.  If you could please let me know the best time and number to reach you between 10am-4pm PST I will be more than happy to give you a call.  

If you need immediate help, the best way to access it is to go directly to help.weebly.com. You can live chat with one of our support folks there between the hours 8am to 6pm Pacific Time / 11am to 9pm Eastern Time. You're also more than welcome to respond to this message with your questions and we'll answer them for you. 

If you would prefer to continue via email, please just let me know and I'll get right back to you.

Thanks for getting in touch with us: we're excited that you're using Weebly to build your website. Through our partnership with BRAND NAME, we're able to provide a deep level of integration with their hosting platform, making it easier for you to create and publish your site. 

That said, we have no access to accounts created in their system. This makes it impossible for us to pull up your site and troubleshoot any questions or problems. For that reason, it's best that you address any questions to your host directly. We apologize for any inconvenience and wish you great success with your site!

macros.title: General::Third Party Solutions::FTP Import Third Party Site

value:
We don't offer FTP access to our customers; FTP is what would allow you to upload content from a third party program to a web host like Weebly. This means you wouldn't be able to upload a site or pages created through another service.  Instead, we offer the use of our Editor in order to create pages and blogs, upload images and files, add music and videos, password protect pages and more. 

You can learn more about using the Weebly editor by visiting this link:

http://weebly.zendesk.com/hc/en-us/articles/201696307-Beginner-s-Guide-First-Steps

That said, if you already own a domain name you are certainly more than welcome to use that domain name with a site you build using Weebly so long as you have our Starter or Pro service. We have a guide to doing that here: 

https://weebly.zendesk.com/hc/en-us/articles/201372693-How-to-Use-a-Domain-You-Purchased-Elsewhere

macros.title: General::Third Party Solutions::Is This Widget Compatible?

value:
You can add a lot of different kinds of custom features and content to your site via our Embed Code Element. This allows you to embed items to your site just by dragging the element down and pasting the code in.

For assistance using the Embed Code element, please see: 

[Using the Embed Code Element](http://hc.weebly.com/hc/en-us/articles/201740213-Create-Widgets-Embed-Code-and-Add-External-Content)

How do you know if a widget or app is embeddable? The best way is to just ask the provider or search their FAQs to see. There's no reason it won't work so long as they can give you embeddable code for your site.

Unfortunately, sites published to weebly.com subdomains are currently being blocked in Turkey. The sites are live and visible online to the rest of the world. We are investigating the issue to see if the block can be removed, but at this point, there is no workaround. We appreciate your patience.

macros.title: General::Visitors See My Personal Facebook/Twitter Account

value:
When you link to your own Facebook Profile or Twitter profile page visitors who click those links cannot see your personal information. All they can see is what you've made publicly available on your profile, and then only if they befriend or follow you in Facebook's case. 

When you click your own link you see your full profile because it's yours and you're logged in to your account. There is no possible way for other people to see this same thing because they are not logged in to your FB or Twitter accounts. There is no link you'd be able to provide to someone else that would give them access to your private profile information at Facebook or Twitter. It doesn't work that way.

Recent versions of the popular Bitdefender security products are currently causing problems for some Weebly users as their Anti-Virus module silently blocks all image and file uploads, no matter which browser you are using.

A ticket has been opened with the BitDefender tech support, but in the mean time you can try the following workaround:

- Open the BitDefender program, and click on the "gear" next to "Antivirus" to open the settings. 

- On the "Shield" tab, under "On-access scanning", click the "Custom" button. 

- On the "Traffic Scan" tab, uncheck the "Scan HTTP traffic" option.

Unfortunately, if the issue persists, you'll need to contact BitDefender's support for assistance.

Weebly Inc. 
460 Bryant St
San Francisco, CA 94107

macros.title: Temp Issue::iOS App Problems/Need to update/9-2014

value:
We recently performed a routine update of our SSL certificate which provides security for Weebly.com and services. If you have been using our iOS app for iPhone but have not yet updated to the latest version (2.1.0, released on September 9th), you will not be able to log in through the app until you update to the latest version.

Please open up the App Store on your phone and tap the âUpdatesâ icon in the lower right corner. If you havenât updated yet, youâll see the Weebly app is in the list and you can just tap the update button to download the latest version. Once youâve done that, you can log back in and continue using the app without any issues.

With our membership feature for Pro and Business users, you can invite different people and give them access to all or some of your site's pages. Check out [our help guide here](http://hc.weebly.com/hc/en-us/articles/203859416) for details.

If you're a Business user, you also have the option to allow visitors to register themselves as a member on your website. We have a [guide for enabling registration](http://hc.weebly.com/hc/en-us/articles/203859426) that will walk you through the steps.

Our developers have asked for a few more things to help narrow down the issue. I realize this is a little bit complicated so if you'd rather set up a screensharing session where I can take control of your desktop for a few minutes to check things out, just let me know. I'm on the east coast of the US and I'm generally available any time between 7a.m. and midnight EST.

If you're comfortable doing this yourself, here are some instructions.

In Firefox, click the menu button with three bars in the upper right corner and then click Developer, Network. In Chrome, it's the same menu button then More Tools, Developer Tools, Network.

Visit one of the membership links that is not working.

In the Developer toolbar, the next-to-last button will open the network information in a separate window. Do that and then maximize that window. Take a screenshot of that information. (If you aren't sure how to take a screenshot on your computer or device, please refer to the following page for simple instructions covering a variety of platforms:

http://take-a-screenshot.org/)

Click on the final HTTP request (it will be highlighted in red with a "404" status) and check the "Headers" tab. In the response headers, there is one called "X-Host", with a value similar to "app-64-3.intern.weebly.net". Can you let me know exactly what that says (or just take a screenshot).

When you're done, you can click the X on the toolbar to close it and return your browser to normal.

I do appreciate your assistance!
