Weebly is a free service.  There is a charge if you want to purchase your own domain name through Weebly and we also offer some enhanced service plans, but basic service is and always will be available 100% free and feature-packed.

You can purchase a domain (.com, .net, or .org) through Weebly very easily with no setup or configuration necessary.  The cost of this is $39.95 per year for a 1 year term, or less per year when purchased for a longer term.  Hosting is included, and there are no additional monthly fees.  You're also welcome to use a domain you've purchased elsewhere if you subscribe to any of our paid services. 

The pricing for our paid services follows:  

Starter:
$29.00 for six months average of $4.83/mo
$49.00 for one year average of $4.08/mo (Save 16%)
$79.00 for two years (24 months) average of $3.29/mo (Save 32%)

Starter includes expanded stats, customizable footer, your own favicon, unlimited storage space w/ up to 100mb per file, a web store with up to 10 products

Pro:
$59.00 for six months average of $9.83/mo
$99.00 for one year (12 months) average of $8.25/mo (Save 16%)
$159.00 for two years (24 months) average of $6.63/mo (Save 33%)

Pro includes all the features of Starter as well as site search, header slideshows, video player (up to 1GB per file), audio player, password protection, membership option for up to 100 members, editor permissions, unlimited storage space with up to 250MB per file, a web store with up to 25 products

Business: 
$29.00/mo on a month to month basis
$299.00 for one year (12 months) average of $24.92/mo (Save 14%)
$469.00 for two years (24 months) average of $19.54/mo (Save 33%)

Business includes all the features of Starter and Pro as well as a web store with unlimited products, no transaction fees from Weebly (fees from payment processors still apply), ability to sell digital goods up to 3GB per file, fully customizable tax and shipping options, your choice of payment processor (Stripe, Paypal, Square, or Authorize.net), SSL certificate, coupons, checkout hosted on your own domain, user registration with unlimited members


** If you purchase more than one month for any of our plans you are unable to divide that into month-month payments, payment in full is required.

If you don't want your service to automatically renew, you can cancel the subscription following these steps:

- Log in and click the Account tab, and then on My Services

- Next to the service you don't want to renew automatically, click the cancel subscription button

If there is no cancel subscription button, or you see "reactivate subscription" instead, then you don't need to do anything else - automatic renewal has already been turned off!

You can also delete any saved payment info from your account by going to Account > Payment Methods.

Weebly is a very small company in terms of staff. We don't have a separate billing department to send out bills and process manual payments. All billing notices are automated and come from an @weebly.com e-mail address to the e-mail associated with your Weebly account. Legitimate billing notices will always direct you to log into your Weebly account to update your billing information and make any payments due or contact support@weebly.com or billing@weebly.com with any questions. We NEVER send out paper reminders and we only accept payments by credit card or Paypal - never by check or over the phone.


Any time you receive a "bill" that doesn't meet these criteria, a red flag should go up. You can log into Weebly and click "Account" to view the status of all your paid services and, of course, you can always e-mail support@weebly.com to confirm anything that is unclear.

At this time, we're able to accept American Express, Visa, MasterCard, and Discover credit cards, or PayPal payments.  PayPal allows you to withdraw money from a bank account in order to make the purchase, which is convenient if accepted credit cards are not an option for you.
You can print an invoice for your purchase via the Order History tab on the Account section after logging in.  You'll find a Print Receipt link next to all your previous purchases.

As our subscriptions are paid in advance, we can't provide pro-rated refunds after more than a few months of service.  Our credit card processor doesn't even allow us to run refunds on charges after a few months. 

Can I help you put the account to better use?  Would you like to transfer the service to another account?

We do accept Purchase Orders for Campus Edition only. If you are purchasing Campus Edition, you can send the Purchase Order to the following address, or you can reply to this message with a copy attached:

Weebly
460 Bryant Street, #100
San Francisco, CA 94107

We can not always provide refunds on a domain name purchase as we have only a very short period of time to receive a refund ourselves.  But since you recently purchased this domain, we've cancelled the domain registration and processed the refund for you. This refund will show up on your statement within a few business days.

Truly sorry for the unwanted renewal!  I've refunded the charge back to your card, and you should see this reflected on your statement within a few business days. The domain will now expire as scheduled.

Note that this means your site, as well as any email addresses associated with the domain name, will stop working after the expiration date. Additionally, domains do not immediately become available for purchase elsewhere after they expire (it takes 75 days for that to happen), so if you were hoping to keep this domain to use elsewhere, let us know ASAP and we can help you transfer it away.

You were charged automatically for the Google Apps email at the conclusion of your 15-day free trial. Sorry for any confusion with that!

I've refunded your one year subscription Google Apps email in full, and removed the Google Apps service from your Weebly account.  You'll see this refund on your online statement within a few business days.

Sorry this service didn't work out, but thanks very much for giving it a go!

Okay, you should now be able to renew your Google Apps subscription for another year.  Just follow the six (6) steps below to reactivate:

1.  Log into your Weebly.com account.
2.  Click on the Email tab.
3.  Click the Enable Email button.
4.  On the popup window, confirm the email address(es) to renew.
5.  Click the green Purchase button.
6.  You should be good at this point.

If you encounter any errors on step #5 above you'll need to go to your Billing > Payment Methods tab and remove the current saved cards shown there.  Then go back to step #2 and retry the renewal process.

macros.title: Price/Package::Billing::Refund Pro Purchased via iOS App

value:
Unfortunately Apple doesn't enable or allow us to refund purchases made through our iOS apps. That is completely under their control. 

So to get a refund you need to simply request it through iTunes. Apple has no stated policy on this (and thus no official instructions), but this guide shows exactly what you need to do to get your money back: 

http://www.labnol.org/software/itunes-app-store-refunds/13838/

Sorry we aren't able to run the refund. Since Apple processed the charge, they have the money and they have to give it back. This is their policy.

I've refunded the charge back to your card, and you should see it on your online statement within 2-3 business days. Sorry an upgraded Weebly account didn't work at this time, but consider checking back in the future as we are always adding new features and working to improve our service!

Let me know if I can further assist in any other way.
Truly sorry for the unwanted renewal regarding your service with us!  I've refunded the charge back to your card, and you should see this reflected on your statement within a few business days.

To renew your expired service, log in to your account and go the Account tab. Next, click on "My Services" and you'll see all of your paid services and a link to renew/extend each one.

Once your information is updated, the charge will process and your service will be re-activated. Please update your billing information as soon as possible to avoid a situation where your service expires outside of our control. 

If you run into any issues with this, please just let me know and I'll get right back to you.

I apologize for the confusion with your order! The coupon actually expired before you made your purchase which is why the discount was not applied. I will be glad to refund the value of the coupon, but I have to wait until the charge has processed (usually 24 hours). I will e-mail you when this is done. I appreciate your patience!

If the transaction is declined, it means the bank/credit card company blocked it for some reason. Insufficient funds is one common reason but there are many others. It could be something as simple as a slight mismatch between the name/address you entered in Weebly and what the bank has on file or something about the transaction may have appeared suspicious. To protect your privacy, we're only able to see that the transaction was declined - we can't see the reason. Only the bank can tell you that.

A voided charge will not appear as a refund on your debit card statement because we never actually put the charge through.  Instead, the charge simply disappears from your statement.  The length of time it takes for this to happen is dependent on the length of time it takes your bank to release the funds back to you.  Some banks take a couple of days, some banks take more than a week. 

I want to stress that we did not actually charge the card at any time.  We did a check with the bank to see if the money was available and, as it was, your bank sat the money aside so that it would still be available when the charge went through.  Since we cancelled that charge (and it never went through at all) the bank will simply put the money back and delete the charge as if it never happened.

macros.title: Price/Package::Billing::Weebly Receipts Aren't Sufficient, Please Create an Invoice

value:
The only receipts we currently provide for purchases are those found under Order History in your Account tab. You'll find a Print Receipt link next to all of your previous purchases in this section.

We're unable to further customize these receipts, add more information to them, change the name of the person listed on the receipt, or create custom invoices. Not because we just don't want to do so, but simply because altering information after the purchase has gone through is something we're wary of doing for a number of reasons and because we have a small accounting staff here that simply doesn't have the free time to manually create invoices on request.  

I'm truly sorry that we can't create a more detailed invoice for you!

When a Starter, Pro or Business subscription expires, the Starter/Pro/Business features remain in place as part of the editable version of the site, but when the site is republished, those elements or features won't appear on the published site until the site is upgraded back to Starter, Pro or Business status. 

So, if you Publish your site immediately after the Starter/Pro/Business subscription expires, then those features will immediately disappear from the site.  If you don't publish again until eight months after expiration, then the Starter/Pro/Business features won't disappear until eight months after it expires.

If you have the Business version of the editor those changes would happen immediately. In other words, features such as Shipping and Tax options, available with the Business upgrade, wouldn't be available to you until you upgrade the site to Business. 

Note: We never delete your site, the content or your products. The site will simply revert back to the Free version of the editor. 

Please just reply to this email if you have any further questions about this, or if there's anything further I can assist you with.

Weebly does not currently provide a service to design themes or sites for our users.  Our system is completely self-service. We can certainly help out with any questions you have, but the creation of the site is up to you.

Before determining that you need a designer, consider flipping through the dozens of new themes which can all be seen under Design > Change Theme > Sort By: Newest. There's an excellent chance one of those will be a good fit for your own site.

If you still want a custom design, there are a number of third-party companies out there that sell and design themes for Weebly users. If you search Google for "weebly themes" you'll see many of them on the first page. We don't currently endorse any companies or designers in particular, so it would be worth scanning through to see if any of them fit your current needs.

Good luck with your site!

macros.title: Price/Package::Is Designer Service Right For Me?

value:
For what you're looking to do, there are actually two different options and each has its own advantages and disadvantages. Only you can decide which option is right for you.

You can create a separate Weebly account for each client. I would suggest that you create these accounts yourself initially. Once you've received payment for your services and you're ready to turn the site over to the client, you can change the e-mail and password to make them the account owner. They can always invite you as an administrator so that you have continuing access to the account.

The advantage to doing it this way is that each site is separate and independent. If you decide you no longer wish to maintain any of your sites (or a particular client's site), it's easy for that client to go off on their own. The client has a little added security and peace of mind in knowing that they are the account owner and site owner (once you've turned it over to them, of course). The drawback is that your clients still know that you're using Weebly.

------------------------------

The other option would be [Weebly for Designers] (http://designers.weebly.com). This is a completely white-labeled version of our software which allows you to offer an end-to-end design and hosting solution under your own brand. Your clients will never see the Weebly name or know that they're using Weebly at all. The only thing they'll see is your name. You'll create your own portal page where the clients can log in to manage their sites and they have exactly the permissions you grant them. You have a great deal of control over what clients can or can't do on their own sites. You manage all the client sites from a single dashboard but each client logs in through their own account and can only see their site.

Client sites include the Pro features by default so they don't have to be upgraded to Pro separately but they are charged a monthly hosting fee for each site ($7.95 a month). You're only billed for sites that are published live, so you can take as long as you need to build the site and you only pay once the work is completed, the client has approved the site, and it goes live. All Pro features are included with any sites built in a Designer account. 

Hopefully this info helps!

See how that works here:

http://hc.weebly.com/hc/en-us/articles/210898937-Add-and-Manage-Students

macros.title: Price/Package::File Upload Size / Space and Bandwidth

value:
We do not put a cap on the amount of bandwidth or space associated with your account.  The only constraint is that files are limited to 10MB each for a free Weebly account and have significantly increased limits beyond that if you have a subscription to one of these services: 

Starter: Unlimited space; each file can be up to 100MB in size. 

Pro: Unlimited space; each file can be up to 250MB in size and each uploaded video can be up to 1GB in size. 

Business: Unlimited space; each file can be up to 250MB in size and each uploaded video can be up to 1GB in size. Downloadable products in the store can be up to 3GB each. 

That means in a free account you could upload an unlimited number of files that are each 10MB or smaller. And in a Pro account you can upload an unlimited number of files that are 250MB each or smaller.

Due to changes in the VAT rules, we now must charge our European customers. The VAT rate we charge is based on your location. As this is different for every one of our European customers, the VAT is listed as a separate charge during the checkout process.

You can purchase a domain (.com, .net, .co.uk, .ca, .nl, .de, .fr, .es, .us, .eu, .info, .co, .co.nz, .com.au and .org) through Weebly very easily with no setup or configuration necessary.  The cost of this is $39.95 per year for a 1 year term, or less per year when purchased for a longer term.  Hosting is included, and there are no additional monthly fees.  

Pricing for domain names is as follows:

1 Year $39.95
2 Years $33.95/year (15% discount)
5 Years $29.95/year (25% discount)
10 Years $24.99/year (37% discount)

Please note that .com.au domains can only be purchased 2 years at a time.

To purchase your own domain name, click on the Settings tab in your editor, select "change site address" and choose Option B. After you enter an available domain name, you'll be taken to a purchase page to complete your order.  Learn more here:

http://hc.weebly.com/hc/en-us/articles/201273693-Buy-Your-Own-Personal-Domain-Name

There are discount registrars out there who provide domain registration cheap or free. These companies make money off web hosting instead. Hosting packages range from $5/month up to several hundred dollars per month with extra fees for bandwidth usage, file storage over a certain amount, e-mail services, a website builder, etc.

Weebly operates on a different business model. We provide free hosting for all our users (along with unlimited bandwidth and file storage, a free website builder, etc.), therefore we must charge full price for domain registration.

While you can register your domain name with GoDaddy for about $10 per year, by the time you add in all the services that Weebly provides for free, the price is significantly higher.

If you have a Weebly Starter or Pro subscription, you can register your domain with a discount registrar and host the site with Weebly. In the long run, this can cause a lot of headaches since you'll be responsible for updating your own DNS settings to point to Weebly and you'll need to manage accounts with two different companies. There is a lot to be said for the simplicity of having your registration and hosting with one company and having all the setup and configuration done for you.

Ultimately, we'll be happy to help you with whatever option you choose. If you are looking at discount registrars, please look for one that gives you full control over your DNS settings (in particular you'll need the ability to create A-records and if you plan to have e-mail you'll need access to MX records). Many discount registrars only allow you to change nameservers unless you purchase a hosting package in addition to your domain registration. Some other "catches" you should look out for include a deep discount on your first year of registration and a higher price for renewal, a discounted price for registration only if you purchase hosting from the company, and you need to make sure that the domain will be registered in your name and can be transferred to another registrar at a later date.

macros.title: Price/Package::Why Can't I Refer More Than 5 Teachers?

value:
Each teacher account can only refer up to five other teachers to receive free space for extra students and a year of Pro service. Past that point we certainly very much appreciate further referrals, but there are no longer any rewards provided. 

Thank you so much for using Weebly and for referring other people to use our service; I cannot tell you how much we appreciate it.  We've just set 5 referred teachers as our cut-off.

We charge a monthly fee for Designer platform created sites because the platform is completely white labeled.  This allows you to invite your clients to assist in maintaining and editing their sites without their knowing that Weebly is in any way involved with the creation or hosting of that site. 

Most Partner / White Label platforms charge a hefty upfront fee to even use their system.  We don't do anything of the sort.  Our pricing is based entirely on a monthly rate per site, so you're only paying for the sites you create.   So you only pay us if you're successfully making money from the platform. 

If you have no need for a White Label system, then you are welcome to design websites for your clients using regular Weebly (weebly.com) with Weebly Pro.  This is less expensive, but if you invite your clients to help edit their own sites they'll be able to see that you're using our service.

In Weebly.comâs privacy policy, we take your privacy very seriously.  From our official privacy policy we do say the following :
 
Information Use, Sharing and Disclosure
 
Weebly does not share personal information we learn about you from your use of the Weebly web sites, products and services with others except as described in this policy.
We do not share, sell, rent or trade personally identifiable information with third parties for their promotional purposes.
 
You can view our full privacy policy here: 

http://www.weebly.com/privacy/
 
If a 3rd party source has information on your customers, it would not have come from us.

When you actually post a link on Facebook, Facebook scans your page, lists all the images, and lets you choose which image should accompany the post. That is how it is supposed to work, and it makes sense. Unfortunately, Facebook is a little quirky about which images it will recognize and which ones it won't, so it can be hit or miss.  This isn't a problem only with Weebly; it can occur when posting a link from any website, and there is not a whole lot that you or I can do about it right now.
Sometimes if you go to post the link and don't see all of the images in your post, you can cancel and then try adding the link again.  I have found that the images often will show up the second time even if they didn't on the first try.

We are issuing a refund for New York sales taxes collected on your recent purchase as we were informed that some of the services we provide are exempt from sales tax.

We cannot always provide refunds on a domain name purchase as we have only a very short period of time -- five days -- to receive a refund on domain registrations ourselves. What does this mean? 

Since it's been more than five days, we have no way to cancel the registration of the domain name. So it's officially and fully registered for the entire period for which you paid us. So if you were hoping to cancel this domain to purchase it elsewhere, that's not technically possible. This isn't because of a policy on Weebly's side, but because of a policy of ICANN; the international non-profit organization that oversees the registration of all domain names in the world.  

Now, this does not mean we won't refund your money. You didn't know about the ICANN policy before making your purchase, so we want to honor our 30 day refund policy. What it means instead, is this:

(1) If you don't actually want this domain name and don't mind losing access to it for the length of the registration period, then we'll refund your money in full as soon as you let us know you'd like us to proceed. 

(2) If you're hoping to use this domain elsewhere, we can help you move or point the domain to the other host so you can start using it immediately. Since ICANN won't allow us to cancel the domain at this point, this is the only way to use the domain with another host. However, you won't have to pay this new host for the registration or hosting of the domain name since you already paid us for it. 

Let us know if you simply want to proceed with the refund or if you need to use the domain elsewhere.

macros.title: Editor::SEO What should I put in the header/footer fields?

value:
The header and footer code sections are meant to be used with certain types of embeddable widgets and site verification tags (eg Mailchimp forms, Pinterest or Google verification tags, etc), but it's not required that you put anything into those fields, and you can simply leave them blank if you don't have anything to place there. 

If you're working with some code and the instructions tell you to put a portion into the document head or between the head tags, then you'd paste that code into the Header field. If the instructions tell you to put some code just before the end of the body tag, then the Footer field is where you would paste that part.

Again, there's no reason to use these fields unless you've been instructed to do so, and it's perfectly fine to leave them blank. One thing you should not do is use them for keywords, or for general text.

macros.title: Editor::Headers and Layouts::Some New Themes Use Background for Header

value:
All of our themes use background images for the header / banner area of of the site instead of using the standard headers that most of our other themes use. This makes it impossible to use different header images for each page as our system only supports a single background image per site. You're currently using one of the themes that works in the way I've described. What are your options? 

The only real option to use a different header or banner image on each page or various pages is to switch to a theme that support this feature. Many of our themes **do** support this feature, so it's fairly easy to find one. You can read all about different header images here:

http://hc.weebly.com/hc/en-us/articles/201505676-Edit-the-Header

And you can learn how to switch themes here:

https://weebly.zendesk.com/hc/en-us/articles/201696407-How-to-Switch-Themes

There's just not any way to use multiple headers with your current theme. We designed it with a single background / header image in mind because the theme looks and functions better this way. Sorry for the confusion!

Thanks for getting in touch with us: we're excited that you're using Weebly to build your website. Through our partnership with BRAND NAME, we're able to provide a deep level of integration with their hosting platform, making it easier for you to create and publish your site. 

However, you will need to address any questions or support requests to your host directly. We apologize for any inconvenience and wish you great success with your site!

You can set up rich snippets on your Weebly site and it's actually not hard to do. We don't provide support or troubleshooting for the coding itself (check out [Rich Snippets](https://developers.google.com/structured-data/rich-snippets/)), but we can definitely help you get set up on the Weebly side of things!

For the pages where you want to have rich snippets, you'll go to the Pages tab, Advanced Settings, and insert the rich snippet code in the Header Code field. You could use an Embed Code element but since this code is invisible, it's easy to "lose" that Embed Code element on the page. Don't worry if you've already got something in the Header Code field. This code can go either before or after that - just leave a blank line or two between them to help keep things tidy.

The only time this won't work is on Product pages and blog posts. Since you don't have access to the Header Code for individual blog posts and product pages, you'll need to use an Embed Code element in the blog post or the long description for the Product and you'll just need to remember it's there.

You won't actually see anything at all on your page when you add the rich snippets, but you can use [Google's Testing Tool](https://developers.google.com/structured-data/testing-tool/) to make sure Google sees it.

To set up your store with Authorize.net, please follow these steps:

Step 1:  Obtain your Login ID and Transaction Key
Note: this is not the same as what you use to login with at Authorize.net.
To locate this info, log into your account, and click on Settings under Account on the main menu on the left.
Then click on API Login ID and Transaction Key in the Security Settings section. Your API Login ID and Transaction Key are displayed here.  If you donât see them you can enter the answer to your Security Question and generate them.

Step 2:  Ensure that user fields are not set to required
By default no form fields are required, and any that need to be are handled by the cart itself so none of these should be set to required. Navigate to Account > Settings > Payment Form > Form Fields and make sure none are checked as required, and then save.

Step 3:  Make sure that Test Mode is turned OFF
Click on Settings under Account on the main menu on the left, and then click on Test Mode in the Security Settings section.
Ensure that Test Mode is set to OFF.

Step 4:  Enter your API Login ID and Transaction Key in your Weebly account in Store > Settings > Checkout.

We are not here to act as arbitration in business and account disputes. We have to look into accounts like this every single day, and they always follow the same situation to one degree or another.

As it stands we have no clear way of knowing who should own this account. The XXXX address is the current address on the account and it was also the first address on the account, and we're going to need to leave it this way.

Unless there are clear records that the person who designed the site was paid in full according to a contract for the design itself then the design and site remain the property of the creator. And going by only the information we have on file the creator / owner of the actual site is XXXX

We have a couple of options here:

1 -- You can take legal action against the other guy and have the site declared your property. In which case we'd hand it over to you.

2 -- He can give us permission to move the site to a new account. I can move it immediately if so.

Those are the options. There is not a third one in which I can decide to just give you control of the account. There are too many variables involved. I know that is frustrating, but I have to follow the information we have on file (because it is the only thing I can know with 100% certainty) and that gives ownership of the account to XXXX.

Your site is mobile friendly and fully ready for the updates Google is making to their mobile algorithm. You can verify this by entering the site address into Google's verification tool: 

https://www.google.com/webmasters/tools/mobile-friendly/

If you'd like to learn a bit more about what Google is doing with this change, take a look at this short article from our Help Center: 

http://hc.weebly.com/hc/en-us/articles/205568447

You can verify your site is mobile friendly and ready for Google's updates by entering your site's address into this online verification tool: 

https://www.google.com/webmasters/tools/mobile-friendly/

The great majority of Weebly sites are mobile friendly and have been mobile friendly for years now, which means your site is most likely good to go as it is. 

But what if it fails Google's mobile friendly verification test? This short article from our Help Center explains the situation and what you can do to (pretty easily) fix it: 

http://hc.weebly.com/hc/en-us/articles/205568447

Last week, Authorize.net, our credit card processor, experienced technical problems which caused a double charge within your account. Our Developers have already gotten the duplicate charge refunded back to your card, and you should see that back in your account within a few business days.

I am very sorry you experienced this.

It appears that your site is not "mobile friendly" in the eyes of Google's new search algorithm. You can verify this by checking your site address using Google's verification tool: 

https://www.google.com/webmasters/tools/mobile-friendly/

The great majority of Weebly sites are mobile friendly and ready for these changes. So why isn't yours? 

The reason is that you're using one of our older themes and you have the mobile version of that theme turned off. This wasn't previously an issue, but now that Google is changing the way they classify sites in mobile searches it's become more important to have this turned on. 

If you're happy to turn it back on, go to the Settings in the editor and check the box to activate your site's mobile version. Then Publish your site and the problem is solved (though Google's search algorithm may not notice the update for a week or so). 

What if you don't want to turn it back on because you don't like the mobile version of your site? Then the best best is to switch to one of our Responsive themes. All of our newer themes (those released since early 2014) are what are known as Responsive themes. This means that the theme itself is designed to automatically adapt to the size of the screen and device it's being viewed on. Responsive themes like these are exactly what Google wants to see from a mobile site.

You can switch to a Responsive theme by going to the Change Themes section found under the Design tab. From there you can sort themes by Newest. The most recent 20 or so themes are all Responsive. Choosing one of these and Publishing your site will also resolve the issue. 

What if you'd prefer not to do either? 

Then Google will not consider your site to be mobile friendly. But this is not necessarily that terrible of a thing. Google considers dozens upon dozens of variables when considering how to rank your site in a given search. Whether or not your site is "mobile friendly" is just one of those variables. There's a perfectly good chance your ranking won't change at all if you leave things as they are. 

If you'd like to learn a bit more about what Google is doing with this change, take a look at this short article from our Help Center: 

http://hc.weebly.com/hc/en-us/articles/205568447

macros.title: Editor::Images::Why is there no border on pictures in image and gallery elements?

value: We recently made an update to our image and gallery elements that changed the default settings for borders. Previously, a border was applied to images by default, but when you add a new image or gallery element borders will not automatically be applied to them. This doesn't affect any previously-added images with borders, and you can add a border if you want to by clicking on the element and using the options in the Advanced section to turn borders on (or off).

Sorry you're seeing this problem! It sounds like BitDefender is blocking access to certain elements of our editor. The fastest way to get around this would be to "whitelist" both Weebly and your site.

 To add a website to the Whitelist, follow these steps:
1. Open the Bitdefender window.
2. Access the Protection panel.
3. Click the Web Protection module.
4. In the Settings tab, click the Whitelist link. A new window will appear.
5. Provide the address of the blocked website or online application in the corresponding field and click Add.
6. Click Save to save the changes and close the window.


We've contacted their support to see what we can do to fix the problem but it'd be helpful if you could also complain to them that they're inadvertently blocking your site. They're much more likely to take action if you complain to them as a customer than if we alone complain to them. You can also submit a whitelist request here:

http://www.bitdefender.com/submit/

I promise this problem is not on our end and we're doing what we can to get BitDefender to fix the problem. But we don't have any estimates yet for when they'll actually put the fix in place.

Thank you for your patience!

Unfortunately, we are not able to support elements added from the App Center, as they are built by third party developers. You will be able to get help directly from the developer by visiting the page for this specific app in the App Center.

macros.title: Editor::CARBON - I Don't Like Carbon / How do I switch to the old version of Weebly?

value:

You can temporarily switch back to the older version of our dashboard by clicking the Account icon in the upper right corner of your screen. From the following page, click the "Go back to the old Weebly design" button. However, there is no way to switch back to the previous version of our Editor. 

We understand that no matter how many improvements we've made, such a big visual change to our service can be incredibly jarring. Especially if you were just hoping to pop in and make a few changes to your site without having to think too much about it. 

If you have any specific questions about the new features, please just let me know and I'll get right back to you.

Your page title is automatically generated by combining the site title from the 'Settings' tab with the page title from the 'Pages' sidebar. For your home page and blog pages, it will be "Site Title - Page Title". For all other pages, it will be "Page Title - Site Title". At this time, it's not possible to modify that basic structure.

Each page on your site can be assigned one of four different page layouts (some templates may include more layouts).  These layouts are:
  
1. Tall Header: This is the default layout and includes space for a tall header / banner image. 
  
2. Short Header: This includes space for a short header / banner image. 
  
3. No Header: The page layout includes no header area at all. 
  
4. Landing: This layout has space for an image, message, and a button linking to another page from within the header area. 
  
To read more about the different page layouts and how to use them, please take a look at our short guide:
  
http://hc.weebly.com/hc/en-us/articles/209766838-Alter-Header-Types
  
You can freely switch between different layouts, so if you don't like the way one works with a page you can simply choose another without losing any of your content.

You can also do this from within the editor on the page where the Contact Form has been placed.

Click on the form to make it active and you should see an option to 'View Entries'.  Click on 'View Entries', and a screen will pop up with all of your form submissions.  You will see a red x to the left side of each of the submissions.  

Click on the x next to the submission you want to delete and you will see a prompt asking "Are you sure you want to delete this submission?"  

Click OK and the submission will be removed for you.

macros.title: PayPal order not showing in weebly

value:
If a customer says that they received an order through Paypal but it did not show up in their Orders tab, this is usually because the buyer changed some information when they arrived at the Paypal checkout screen after filling in the Weebly checkout forms. There are a number of things you can change at the Paypal checkout, including shipping address and contact information, and when the information they entered at Weebly doesn't match what's added at Paypal, the order is not sent back to Weebly. 

This is not a Weebly bug so much as just the way Paypal is.

When this happens, the transaction is still processed as usual and the seller will receive their money, and they should receive the Paypal order notification so they'll know a sale was made. The buyer will also receive the Paypal receipt.

The developers are working to figure out a way around this, but it's totally the way PayPal rolls.

Please include internal note when escalating tickets.

Include:
UID
URL
SiteID
Theme
A brief description of the issue, where we can see the issue on their live site or in their editor, whether or not you could re-create it on your own site, and the steps you took to resolve the issue.

There are two options here.

If you are going to set up the Google Apps directly through Google then we can simply transfer the subscription to them. Once the transfer takes place, Google Apps through Google will be available to you immediately.

The other option would be to CANCEL the subscription on our end, and after 4-5 days you'd be able to set up the service elsewhere.

Please let me know what you'd like us to do for you.

Howdy!

We noticed that you had recently purchased a new domain name in your Weebly.com account. During the purchase a small error occurred attaching the domain name to your account. We have a tool that is notifying us of this error, and we have already resolved the issue for you. You may have not even noticed.

The reason that I'm reaching out to you is because I'm curious about the specific flow, or steps that you took leading up to purchasing this domain name.

Where were you at in the editor when you went to purchase? What buttons did you press? Did this purchase come immediately following a different purchase? Did you buy it from the DOMAINS tab? Did you buy it from within the SETTINGS tab in the editor? Did you buy it after hitting the PUBLISH button?

Any information that you can provide may prove helpful as we work to squash this bug for good.

We thank you in advance!

To complete the domain verification process to verify ownership, they will need to log into their admin console on Google Apps and follow the instructions to verify their domain. We suggest using the HTML tag option. They can add the provided tag in the Settings > SEO section of their site editor for the site that is associated with the domain. Be sure to have them save and publish the site after doing this. 

Here are detailed instructions from Google on how to complete this process:
http://support.google.com/a/bin/answer.py?answer=60216&hl=en

Howdy!

We made a recent change to the way that our API with Paypal works. We removed the ability for users to change their address on the Paypal side of things, but to do this does require that the address provided to Paypal be valid.

Any valid city, state and zip code combinations will not have any problem making it to the payment screen on PayPal.

If the city, state and zip code combinations don't match, then it will not be possible to get to the payment screen with Paypal. For example if a customer lives in North Las Vegas and they put in Las Vegas as their city, it will not proceed to the Paypal payment page. They would have to specifically put in North Las Vegas.

This new setting ensures the integrity of the tax and shipping settings that is set in your editor. We will not be reverting this change. Customers will just have to make sure that they are putting in the proper city, state and zip code when purchasing with Paypal.

Howdy!

This email was sent to all Paypal sellers (not just Weebly customers) as a precaution. Unfortunately, the tone of their email has caused some confusion and concern.

I can assure you that our Developers were aware of this upgrade and have already made changes to remain compliant with these security upgrades. You will not have to do anything on your side.

On June 10, there was an issue tracking stats for the sites in your account. Our Developers have already fixed the issue and have repopulated all of the site stats.

I am very sorry you experienced this.

macros.title: Temp Issue::Register.com Issue / Missing DNS or A Records

value: To reset your DNS records please go to the Domains tab in your account. From there, click the DNS and Name Servers tab. On the following screen, look for the "Host (A Records and CNAME Records)" section. In this section, click the âReset default settingsâ link. Once you have done this, your domain's DNS records will be fixed and you'll be able to continue publishing your site.

Regarding bloglovin...they're a bit of a pain it seems with the rss feed format they will accept.  I've tested and been able to use feed, or more easily just use the blog page URL address and add that to their profile > blogs I own button setting.  that's worked for me flawlessly over the past several months and most recently earlier this week.

I'm very sorry for the issue with the inventory on mobile devices! 

Our developers are aware of the issue and will have a fix in place shortly. We'll send you an update when the issue is resolved. 

In the meantime, as a temporary workaround, you can click "Settings" in the Weebly editor and disable the mobile version of the site. This means that visitors on mobile devices will be shown the same version of the site as desktop visitors and the inventory will display correctly. We realize that's not ideal but it will get your store functioning properly until our developers are able to deploy a permanent fix. 

We appreciate your patience!

macros.title: Temp Issue::Subpages Don't Work in Legacy Theme

value: It looks like you're using one of our older themes and there is an update available. If you click on the Designs tab, you'll see "Use Updated Theme" in the lower left corner. Don't worry if the theme preview looks odd - once you confirm the update, your site will look exactly as you expect and the menus will work. You'll also have the option to revert to the old version of the theme if you need to for any reason. Don't forget to publish the change after you update!

Thank you for your feedback! We recently re-launched our improved themes. Some of the older themes were not included, as we no longer support them. However, our developers have now restored our most popular older themes to your account.

You can access these from the editor by clicking the Design tab, then the Change Theme button. On the following screen, scroll down past our responsive themes and click the "Show Old Themes" button.

We recently updated our theme gallery to focus on our new, responsive themes and remove our older adaptive themes. While pre-existing accounts can still select older themes from the theme gallery in the editor, new accounts will not have access to them.

More information about our themes can be found here:

http://hc.weebly.com/hc/en-us/articles/201696407-Switch-and-Manage-Themes
We do appreciate your feedback. We are working to both improve our current translations and offer more language options in the future. Thank you for your patience.

I am sorry for this. The option to change the language settings for your account is located in the lower right corner of your dashboard. Once you select a different language, your account will be translated immediately.

Please note, this will not translate your actual site, just the language displayed in your account.

An RSS feed allows blog visitors to receive automatic updates about your blog in their favorite feed reader. There are dozens and dozens of such readers available for Windows, Mac OS, iPhones, iPads, Android devices, etc.  

A blog feed is XML code. When someone clicks on the link that has a feed reader installed on their computer they will see a nice neat layout that will allow them to click on a button to subscribe to your blog.

If you go directly to an RSS link and you haven't specified a default feed reader for your browser, you'll see XML code instead.  

You can try a Google search for "RSS feed reader" and once you have one installed in the browser you are using, your RSS feed will appear with the option to subscribe.

macros.title: Background Image not showing on Mobile

value:
Unfortunately, it looks like your issue was perhaps misunderstood by the agent who previously advised you.

What you're experiencing isn't actually a bug. Some of our themes use background images for the header / banner area of of the site instead of using the standard headers that most of our other themes use. You're currently using one of the themes that works in the way I've described. These background images are stripped from the mobile view of your site.

We understand that it was unclear that the background images on some of these older themes don't show on mobile, and this is why we've either updated most of them them to be responsive themes (where the image does show up) or have dropped them from our list of available themes.

While we did drop some themes from the list of available themes, we didn't automatically switch anyone off of the theme they are using (for obvious reasons). This is why, even though we no longer "offer" the theme you're using, you have still been able to use it.

My suggestion to you is to check out some of our newest themes by going to:

DESIGN --> Change Theme --> Sort By --> Newest.

Our newest themes are responsive, the current trend in website building. This means that your site will scale according to the size of screen you are viewing it from. As more users make the switch from Desktop and Laptop computers to tablets and phones for their internet browsing, responsive themes will ensure compatibility on any size screen.

Using one of these themes will also allow for your background images to show on the mobile view, unlike what you're experiencing with your current theme.

Please let me know if you have any further questions!

This is due to the difference in aspect ratios between the desktop and mobile version of your site. The desktop version has a very wide aspect ratio, so rectangular images look good, and the whole image shows.

On the phone view, the aspect ratio is much closer to a square, which causes the edges of your background image to be cut off.

The best advice I have for you it to re-create your background image with the "main image" part of it being a little bit smaller, and centered in the background.

The smaller "main image area" of your background image will likely show much better in the phone view.

Please let me know if you have any further questions!

When you're using the "Edit Options" button, our system will automatically create up to 120 SKUs.

If the options you've input generate an output larger than 120, you'll get an error. Once you've saved the input from "Edit Options", a table of SKUs will be generated below.

Beneath this table, there is a button that shows '+ Add SKU'. Clicking this button will allow you to manually add additional SKUs, and there's no limit to how many you can have.

Having said all that, I'd suggest that you build your products in a manner which doesn't require you to manually add SKUs. I'd try and limit the options per product to 120 simply because it can be a lot of work to manually add a ton of SKUs.

Nous travaillons actuellement sur notre plateforme Weebly Designer, qui sera dÃ©diÃ©e justement aux revendeurs potentiels. Celle-ci Ã©tant actuellement en version bÃªta, une mouture fonctionnelle ne devrait plus tarder. Nous vous recontacterons lorsque celle-ci sera disponible.

Merci encore pour votre commentaire et votre intÃ©rÃªt, nous reviendrons vers vous sous peu.

macros.title: (customer facing) PayPal Order not showing in weebly ORDERS

value:
Howdy!

I've been checking into this issue that you've reported where you received an order through Paypal but it did not show up in your Orders tab.

This is something that rarely occurs, and is usually because your buyer changed some information when they arrived at the Paypal checkout screen after filling in the Weebly checkout forms. There are a number of things you can change at the Paypal checkout, and when the information they entered at Weebly doesn't match what's added at Paypal, the order is not sent back to Weebly.

When this does happen, the transaction is still processed as usual on the PayPal side and you will still receive your money, as well as you will still receive the Paypal order notification so you'll know a sale was made. The buyer will also receive the Paypal receipt.

This is not an issue with Weebly code so much as just the way the Paypal API works. Our developers are working with Paypal to resolve this so we appreciate your patience.

Please let me know if you have any further questions.

Howdy!

I've been checking into this issue that you've reported where you received an order through Paypal for an item which was out of stock.

This is something that rarely occurs.

Let's say there's a product with limited inventory.

Buyer A adds this product to his cart and then continues shopping. 
Meanwhile, Buyer B purchases the last item in stock. 

When Buyer A goes to check out, our system doesn't double check the inventory a second time before routing the buyer to Paypal. Inventory is only checked upon the item being added to the cart.

At this time there is no way to ensure that this doesn't occur, although it is an extremely rare occurrence. I'm quite sorry that you experienced this issue.

Please let me know if you have any further questions.

Howdy!

I've been checking into this issue that you've reported where a coupon was used for a purchase after the expiration of that coupon.

Buyer A adds a product to his cart, adds the coupon to the cart and proceeds to checkout. However, the buyer doesn't finalize the purchase at that time.

The user doesn't come back to your site/checkout until after the coupon has expired, however, the coupon is still saved in his cart and isn't re-validated. Thus, when he goes to pay, the coupon works. Currently, the only time that our system checks the validity of a coupon is when it is first added to the cart.

At this time there is no way to ensure that this doesn't occur, although it is an extremely rare occurrence. I'm quite sorry that you experienced this issue.

Please let me know if you have any further questions.

macros.title: User Charged Old Sale Price After Price Was Removed

value:
Howdy!

I've been checking into this issue that you've reported where the sale price of an item was recorded after that Sale Price had been removed from the item.

Buyer A adds a product to their cart, and the Sale Price of the item is recorded. However, the buyer doesn't finalize the purchase at that time.

The user doesn't come back to your site/checkout until after the Sale Price has been removed by you, however, the price is still saved in their cart and isn't re-validated. Thus, when they go to pay, it is the Sale Price that they are charged. Currently, the only time that our system checks the price of an item is when it is first added to the cart.

At this time there is no way to ensure that this doesn't occur, although it is an extremely rare occurrence. I'm quite sorry that you experienced this issue.

Please let me know if you have any further questions.

macros.title: Temp Issue::Site Down / Weebly is Slow

value:
The issue you've seen is due to a number of DDoS attacks all over the internet today which are slowing traffic between certain locations.  This slowdown is making it impossible for some folks, on some internet providers, in some towns, from being able to access sites that are hosted in other parts of the country in some areas and towns. This should have cleared up by now. 

One thing I can promise is that your site is up and running, and has been up and running all day. Weebly has also been up and running without issue. It's just a particularly frustrating brand of DDoS attack impacting various parts of the internet today and this week. You can read up a bit on what's been going on in articles like this one:

http://www.pcworld.com/article/2096720/attackers-use-ntp-reflection-in-huge-ddos-attack.html

Weebly very recently updated the way we format our blog links. In the past the links for our blog posts were ungainly and, honestly, a little ugly. See an example from our own blog:

http://blog.weebly.com/2/post/2014/04/start-your-something.html

Notice the "2" and the "2014" and the "04" in there. It's messy. Our new formatting removes all that stuff, providing cleaner blog post URLs that look much more like the URLs we use for our standard pages. Here's the same post shown above in the new style:

http://blog.weebly.com/post/start-your-something

Your own blog post links have been cleaned up in this same way.

Does this mean the old links will no longer work? Not at all. All of your older post links automatically redirect to the new version of that same post. To see this in action, click on the http://blog.weebly.com/2/post/2014/04/start-your-something.html link. Notice how it leads directly to the http://blog.weebly.com/post/start-your-something page? 

The only issue with this is that your Facebook likes for old links aren't going to display on your older posts. Why is that? Because FB ties these Likes directly to the URL of the post itself. So they don't see a Like for http://blog.weebly.com/2/post/2014/04/start-your-something.html as a like for http://blog.weebly.com/post/start-your-something.

But that doesn't meant the Likes have gone away. If someone Liked one of your posts in the past, then that Like still shows up on that person's FB wall and if one of their friends clicks on that Like they'll still be lead directly to your post without the slightest issue. FB just isn't smart enough to display the likes associated with the old URLs on the new URLs. 

All new Likes will show up on your blog and on your posts. It's just the older ones that aren't showing and we quite simply have no way to force them to show. I promise, though, that the full value of someone liking your post is still there since the point of someone liking it is to share it with their friends and all those old likes are still shared and still working directly within Facebook. 

Hope this info helps!
